Ndathé, age 45, is married and has ten children plus two others to look after. She has been a member of the village loan group CESIRI for a year and a half. She wants to bolster her business in dyed fabrics (Ganila, first choice and second choice). She also sells beauty products. Her income enables her to care for her children and to equip her house. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dyed cloth

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Juan Alberto D. se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual es atendido en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Telica de la bella ciudad de León. Este caballero se ha caracterizado por ser un buen esposo y un buen padre por la razón que siempre ha llevado el sustento a su hogar porque se ha dedicado arduamente a su negocio. 

El motivo por el cual él ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de granos básicos para comercializarlos en la pulpería. Es por esto que muy confiadamente espera que su crédito le sea otorgado y de esta forma salir adelante en su negocio de pulpería.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Alberto D. is dedicated to his store business which he attends in his house in the municipality of Telica of the beautiful city of León. This gentleman has been characterized as being a good husband and a good father for the reason that he has always made a living for his household because he has been dedicated arduously to his business.

The motive that has brought him to Ceprodel to request a loan is the purchase of basic grains to allow him to market them in the store. It is for this that he very confidently hopes that the loan will be offered to him and in this way he will do well in his store business.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains to sell in his store

loans.name: Oumy

texts.fr: Oumy N., 37 ans, veuve avec 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de CESIRI depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut un prêt pour renforcer ses activités de restauration et de commerce  d’effets vestimentaires, chaussures et pochettes  Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Oumy N., aged 37 and a widow with four children in her care, has been a member of the CESIRI Village Bank for 18 months. She wants a loan to strengthen her restaurant business as well as her business involving the sale of clothing, shoes and purses. The loan she is requesting will be repaid after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for her restaurant and shoes and purses for resale

loans.name: Sonko

texts.fr: Sonko Samaké est mariée avec 07 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de CESIRI depuis 1 an et demi. Sonko veut acheter de l’huile de palme, de la pâte d’arachide, du poisson séché, des huîtres et autres marchandises diverses pour renforcer le niveau de sa table au marché   Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Sonko Samaké is married with 7 children to care for. She has been a member of the village council CESIRI for a year and a half. Sonko wants to buy palm oil, peanut butter, dried fish, oysters, and other diverse goods to build up the level of her table at the market. She is seeking a loan which she will repay at the end of six months in one payment.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm oil, peanuts, dried fish and oysters

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
La señora María Antonia R. es originaria del municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León donde se dedica a atender su propia pulpería el cual la inauguró desde hace 15 años con pocos recursos económicos y realizando pocas ventas. 

Es madre de un hijo el cual ha beneficiado brindándole los estudios para su desarrollo siendo su mayor anhelo que su hijo llegue a ser un gran profesional. 
Su negocio se ha venido desarrollando poco a poco y esto gracias al apoyo de Ceprodel el cual le ha permitido la compra de sus productos para su respectiva comercialización y hoy en día una vez más espera que su crédito sea otorgado para que de esta manera continúe con el desarrollo familiar y del negocio.
texts.en:
María Antonia R. is from the municipality of Telica in the city of León , where she has her own general store, which she opened 15 years ago with few economic resources and making few sales. She is the mother of one child, who she has helped with his studies, for his development. It is her greatest longing that her son becomes a professional. Her business has been developing little by little, and this is thanks to the support of Ceprodel, which has permitted her to buy the products that she sells. Today once more she hopes that a loan will be granted so she can continue in this way with the development of her family and the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia es socia del Banco comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro poblado D. Chimbo del distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 40 años D. edad  y es madre D. 6 hijos, 2 mayores con familias y 4 que aun dependen D. ella,  no hizo estudios secundarios porque era huérfana, es casada, su esposo trabaja ayudándola en el negocio D. compra y venta D. ganado vacuno para engorD., antes D. iniciar con este negocio tenia una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes, hace 2 años que incursiona en la crianza D. animales y al que actualmente se dedica. Con el primer préstamo D. S/: 300.00 nuevos soles compro 01 vaca para engorD..

Con el préstamo D. S/: 3000.00 nuevos soles que solicitara y que pagara en 5 cuotas comprara  forraje, gallinazo,  afrecho, etc. 

Ella desea continuar con su negocio para tener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the Community bank "Espiritu Santo" (meaning Holy Spirit) of the Centro Poblado D. Chimbo located in the district and province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 40 years old and she is mother of 6 children. Two are grown and have families of their own and the other four still deped on her. She did not have any secondary education because she was an orphan. She is married and her husband helps her with the business of buying and selling cattle. Before she started this business she had a small convenience store. For the past 2 years she has been raising cattle, a business she still carries out. With ther first loan of S/.300 neuvos soles she purchased one cow.

With this loan, amounting to S/.3000 and which will be repaid in 5 months, she will purchase hay, grain, bran cereal, etc.

She wishes to keep up her business to have better earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase feed for cattle (hay, grain, bran cereal).

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Doña Agripina es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo”  del Centro Poblado D. Chimbo, del Distrito y  Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 64 años y es madre D. 6 hijos que ya están casados (viven en Lima)estudio el segundo grado D. primaria. Ella junto a su esposo se dedican al negocio D. venta D. ropa americana desD. hace muchos años, nos cuenta que con este trabajo hizo estudiar a todos sus hijo. Con el primer préstamo D. S/: 300.00 nuevos soles que recibió D. Manuela Ramos  compro fardos D.  ropa americana para vender los días Jueves en el Barrio Bellavista D. Puno, negocio con el continua trabajando para cumplir con su pago puntualmente.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles que será pagado en 5 cuotas, comprara ropa americana para aumentar su mercadería.

Ella desea continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Agripina is one of the founding members of the ‘Espíritu Santo’ Communal Bank in Chimbo, in the district and province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 64 years old and is the mother of 6 children, all of them married (and living in Lima); as a child she was in school through the second graD. of primary school. Agripina, together with her husband, has worked selling American clothing for many years now. She tells us that by doing this work she was able to put all of her children through school. Agripina used the first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles ($100) that she received from Kiva Partner Manuela Ramos to purchase bundles of American clothing, which she sold on Thursdays in the city of Puno’s Bellavista neighborhood. She has continued to work in this business in order to complete her payments on time. Agripina will use the current loan of 3000 Peruvian Soles ($975) to purchase more American clothing so that she can increase her merchandise; the loan is to be repaid in five installments. Agripina hopes to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing American clothing wholesale

loans.name: Yesenia Asunción

texts.es:
La señora Yesenia  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Inmaculada Concepción”  del Distrito de J., Provincia de Chucuito-Puno, vive en el Jr. San Juan Nº 146  y tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de una niña de 8 años, termino sus estudios superiores y se dedica a todo tipo de negocios según la temporada de venta. Su esposo se dedica al manejo de carros “chofer”.
 Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro artículos de joyería como artes, collares y pulseras, después de 2 años cambio de rubro y abrió una Tienda .Ella es independiente en sus negocios, es muy activa en el trabajo, actualmente cuenta con tiendita escolar en el Centro Educativo Nº 890 de J.  que abre a partir de las 9 de la mañana y  por las tardes sigue vendiendo en su Tienda de Abarrotes.

Con este préstamo que recibirá de S/: 3000.00 nuevos soles el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas comprara  material (cinta cola de rata) para confeccionar carteras, correas, etc.

Su deseo es construir su casa  e implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yesenia belongs to the communal bank "Immaculate Conception" in the J. district in Chucuito-Puno province (Peru). She lives in Junior San Juan No. 146 and is 31 years old. Mrs. Yesenia lives with her partner, and has an 8 year old daughter. She finished her higher education and works in various types of businesses depending on the season. Her husband is a chauffeur.

With her first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles (US $100), Yesenia bought artistic jewelry, necklaces, and bracelets. After 2 years, she changed directions and opened a shop. She is independent in her business and very active at work. Currently, she has a school shop in the Educational Center No. 890 in J., which opens at 9am. In the afternoons, Yesenia continues to work in her grocery store.

Yesenia is requesting a loan of 3000 Peruvian Soles (US $975), which will be used to buy material (ribbon) to make wallets, belts, and so on. The loan will be repaid in 4 installments. Her desire is to build her house and improve her store.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make crafts (i.e. wallets, belts)

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Sabina es nueva integrante del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado de Chimbo, del Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo –Puno. Tiene 34 años  y es madre de 3 hijos pequeños aun, es casada, su esposo trabaja junto con ella en la crianza de animales menores. Ella nos cuenta que no pudo estudiar por que sus padres decían que las mujeres debían dedicarse a los cuidados de la casa.

Con el primer préstamo que recibirá de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  el cual será pagado en 5 cuotas  comprara ganado ovino y porcino para engorde.

Su deseo es comprar mas ganado y así continuar con la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sabina is a new member of the communal bank "Holy Spirit" of the Town Center of Chimbo, in the Yunguyo-Puno province of Peru. She is 34 years old, and married with 3 small children. Sabina's husband works with her to raise small animals.

She says that she was unable to study because her parents believed that women should dedicate themselves to household chores and duties.

With this first loan request of 500 Peruvian Soles (US $175), Sabina will buy sheep and pigs to fatten. She will repay the loan in 5 installments.

Her wish is to buy more livestock and continue to raise animals.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Bruna

texts.es:
La señora Bruna es socia del Banco Comunal “Inmaculada Concepción”  hace 9 años , vive en el Jr. Daniel Espezua Velasco Nº 451 del Distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito- Puno. Tiene 41 años, es separada y madre de 5 hijos que apoya en sus estudios. Bruna con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles aumento su capital y compro materiales para trabajar con  bordados en bayeta. Ella empezó con este negocio cuando se separo de su esposo, tuvo que trabajar duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos y con el apoyo del Banco construyo su casa.

Actualmente vende los trabajos que realiza en Los Uros  y cuando no le alcanza el tiempo  compra bordados hechos de otras personas para no perder a sus clientes.

Con el préstamo  de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles que pagara en 4 cuotas comprara mas material para bordados como lana de diferentes colores, bayeta, etc.
texts.en:
Ms Bruna has been a member of the Banco Comunal “Inmaculada Concepción” for the past 9 years. She lives at Nº 451 Jr. Daniel Espezua Velasco in the district of Juli, in the province of Chucuito-Puno. She is 41 years old, separated, and the mother of 5 children whose schooling she pays for. With her first loan of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles ($100.00 USD), Bruna increased her working capital and bought materials for embroidery. She started this business when she separated from her husband, as she had to work hard in order to raise her children and with the help of Banco Comunal she built her home. She currently sells the finished embroideries in Los Uros and when time is short, she buys embroideries made by others in order to not lose customers. With this loan of S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles ($500.00 USD) which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy more material for embroidering such as wool of different colours, embroidery fabric, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool and embroidery fabric

loans.name: Biviana

texts.es:
Doña Biviana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del centro poblado D. Chimbo del distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo- Puno. Tiene 64 años D. edad, asistió al Programa D. Alfabetización durante 01 año, es casada y madre D. 5 hijos. Biviana vive con una D. sus nietas quien siempre la acompaña. Trabaja aproximadamente 7 años con el Banco. Con el  primer préstamo recibido D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles decidió invertir en la crianza D. animales menores como ovejas, chanchitos, negocio que inicio cuando entro al Banco y en el que trabaja junto a su esposo.

Con el ultimo préstamo que recibirá D. S/: 2500.00 nuevos soles el cual será pagado en 5 cuotas comprara 01 vaca y forraje para engorD..

Su deseo es mejorar sus ganancias y así incrementar su  capital.
texts.en:
Ms Biviana belongs to the community bank "Espíritu Santo" of Chimbo in the district and province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 64 years old and attended the Literacy Program for a year. She is married and the mother of 5 children. Biviana lives with one of her granddaughters, who is always by her siD.. She has been a member of the community bank for approximately 7 years. She decided to invest her first loan of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles ($100 USD) in breeding small animals such as sheep and pigs, a business she started when she joined the bank and at which she works with her husband. She will use this loan of S/: 2500.00 nuevos soles ($825 USD) to buy a cow for fattening up, as well as fodder. She will repay the loan in 5 installments. Her wish is to improve her earnings and thus increase her capital.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 1 cow and fodder to fatten it up.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La señora Asunta  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado D. Chimbo, del Distrito  y Provincia D. Yunguyo del Departamento D. Puno. Tiene 41 años D. edad y es madre D.  6 hijos, 2 mayores D. edad y 4 que aun dependen D. ella, estudio el sexto grado D. primaria, es casada, su esposo trabaja en el Terminal Terrestre D. la Ciudad D. Tacna y también tiene a cargo la educación D.  sus hijos que estudian allá. Asunta con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro un chancho para engorD.. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores y  venta D. ropas que compra en Desaguadero y lleva a Tacna, con el fin D. pagar puntualmente su prestamo

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprara un toro (ganado vacuno) a S/. 2.200 y forraje para alimentar su ganado.

Ella desea vivir en Tacna e iniciar su negocio allá para  seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ms Asunta belongs to the community bank “Espíritu Santo” of Centro Poblado in Chimbo, in the district and province of Yunguyo in the department of Puno. She is 41 years old and the mother of 6 children: 2 are adults and 4 are still dependent on her. She completed GraD. 6 and is married. Her husband works in the bus terminal of the city of Tacna. She is also responsible for the education of her children who live in Tacna. Asunta bought a pig for fattening up with the first loan of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles ($100 USD) which she received from Manuela Ramos. She has been a member of the community bank for 8 years. She currently raises small animals as well as sells clothing which she buys in Desaguadero and brings to Tacna, all in order to repay her loan punctually. With this loan of S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles ($975 USD), which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy a bull (cattle) for S/. 2.200 ($700 USD) and fodder for the cattle. She wants to live in Tacna and base her business there in order to continue supporting her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle (a bull) and fodder for cattle.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz D. Cacorco” del distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 36 años, es madre D. 5 hijos, es casada, su esposo trabaja en la compra y venta D. ganado vacuno para engorD.. Con el primer préstamo recibido D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles aumento su capital y compro habas D. Bolivia, ella empezó con este negocio hace 15 años, viaja muy seguido a la Frontera  a comprar mercadería. Actualmente y junto a su esposo continúan con ambos negocios.

Con  el préstamo que solicitara D. S/: 1700.00 nuevos soles que pagara en  4 cuotas comprara 5 sacos D. habas.

Su deseo es seguir viajando y tener más capital D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Alejandrina belongs to the Banco Comunal "Santa Cruz D. Cacorco" in the district of Copani in the Yunguyo-Puno province. She is 36 years old, has 5 children and is married. Her husband buys and sells feedlot cattle. With her first loan, she received S/. 500.00 to increase her capital and buy Bolivian beans. She began with this business 15 years ago. She frequently travels to the border to buy merchandise. Presently, she and her husband work together in both businesses. She is requesting a loan of S/. 1700.00 loan, which she plans on repaying in 4 installments. With this loan, she will buy 5 sacks of beans. Her dream is to continue traveling and increase profits from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans wholesale

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
Doña Santusa es socia del Banco Comunal “Chojchoni” ubicado en el Distrito de Copani, Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 74 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos mayores vive en el sector Pallcacato, asistió al Programa de Alfabetización, es casada y su esposo le ayuda a vender golosinas, los días de feria. Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro ganado vacuno y ovino para engorde después de 2 años decidió cambiar de negocio e iniciar con la venta de golosinas. Hace 4 años que trabaja con Manuela Ramos. Actualmente sigue con la actividad económica de venta de golosinas.

Con el préstamo que solicitara de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas comprara una vaca (ganado vacuno) para engorde.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando con el Banco y continuar con su negocio hasta donde pueda.
texts.en:
Dona Santusa is a member of the communal bank "Chojchoni" located in the Copani district of Peru's Yunguyo-Puno province. She is 74 years old and married with 4 grown children. She lives in the Pallcacato area, and has attended a literacy program. Santusa's husband helps her sell candy during street market days.

With a previous loan of 300 Peruvian Soles (US $100), Santusa bought cattle and sheep to fatten. After 2 years, she decided to change businesses and began selling sweets, which she continues to do. She has been working with Manuela Ramos (the microfinance partner) for 4 years.

Dona Santusa is requesting a loan of 800 Peruvian Soles (US $275) to buy a cow to fatten. The loan will be repaid in 4 installments.

Dona Santusa's desire is to continue working with Manuela Ramos and to take her business as far as she can.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cow to fatten.

loans.name: Pacisa

texts.es:
La señora Pacisa es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Cacorco”, ella vive en el Sector Cacorco  del Distrito de Copani, Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno.
Tiene 34 años, es casada y madre de 4 hijos que estudian todavía, su esposo trabaja junto con ella en el negocio de compra y venta de ganado ovino. Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles aumento su capital y compro mas ganado ovino para engorde. En la actualidad cuenta con 12  ovejas que venderá para pagar su préstamo con exactitud.

Con el ultimo préstamo de S/. 800 .00 nuevos soles que solicitara  comprara mas ganado ovino (5 ovejas) de Bolivia.

Pacisa expresa que los bancos de Manuela Ramos son de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pacisa is a member of the communal bank "Santa Cruz de Cacorco." She lives in the Cacorco sector of the Copani district in Yunguyo-Puno province (Peru). She is 34 years old and married with 4 children who are still studying. She and her husband work together in their business of buying and selling of sheep.

With a previous loan of 300 Peruvian Soles (US $100), Pacisa increased her capital and bought more sheep to fatten.

Pacisa currently has 12 sheep, which she will sell to pay back her loan. With the latest loan of 800 Peruvian Soles (US $275) that she is requesting, Pacisa will buy 5 more sheep from Bolivia.

Pacisa says that Manuela Ramos (the microfinance partner) is a great help.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 5 sheep to fatten.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Petrona es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz D. Cacorco” del distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. 
Tiene 59 años, es casada y madre D. 07 hijos que ya formaron  sus familias, asistió al Programa D. Alfabetización durante 01 año, su esposo se dedica  a reparar radios y televisores. Doña Petrona con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles deciD. invertir en la compra D. mercadería para su  pequeña tienda D. abarrotes. Tiene 5 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos.
Actualmente sigue vendiendo en su tiendita, ella abre todos los días, viaja a comprar sus productos a Desaguadero. 

Con el préstamo que recibirá D. S/. 800.00 nuevos soles y que pagara en 4 cuotas comprara  arroz, azúcar, fideos y aceite.
texts.en:
Mrs. Petrona Q. D. C. is a member of the communal bank "Santa Cruz D. Cacorco" in the Copani district of Yunguyo-Puno province (Peru). She is 59 years old and married, with 7 grown children who have already started their own families. Mrs. Petrona attended a literacy program for 1 year. Her husband repairs radios and televisions for a living.

Mrs. Petrona decided to invest her first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles (US $100) in buying merchandise for her small grocery store. She has been working with Manuela Ramos (the microfinance partner) for 5 years.

Mrs. Petrona continues to sell goods in her shop, which she opens daily. She travels to Desaguadero to buy her products. With the new loan of 800 Peruvian Soles (US $275) she receives, Mrs. Petrona will buy rice, sugar, noodles and oil. Mrs. Petrona will repay the loan in 4 installments.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, noodles, and oil.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz D. Cacorco” del distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 50 años D. edad ,es madre D. 1 hijo que vive en Tacna,  ella  trabaja junto a su esposo en la crianza D. ganado porcino. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro 03 chanchitos para engordar, nos cuenta que vive con su mama por que su papa falleció hace un año.
En la actualidad  continua con la crianza D. estos animales para después venderlos y poder pagar su cuota mensual.

Con el préstamo que recibirá D. S/. 1000.00nuevos soles comprara 01 ganado vacuno para engorD., dicho monto lo pagara en 4 meses.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of “Santa Cruz D. Cacorco” Community Bank in the Copani district of Yunguyo-Puno province. She is 50 years old, lives with her mother because her father died a year ago, and is the mother of one child who lives in Tacna. She and her husband raise pigs. With her first loan (of 300 Peruvian “nuevos soles,” approximately US $100), she purchased three baby pigs to fatten. She continues raising these animals in order to later sell them and make her monthly payments. With this loan of S/1000 (US $325), which will be repaid in four months, she will buy one head of cattle to fatten.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase one head of cattle to fatten.

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.en:
Yaroslav is married with a 2-year-old daughter and lives in Belaya Tserkov, a busy town in the Kiev region. Yaroslav runs a kiosk selling varnish, coloring agents and dishware in the central market of Belaya Tserkov. He inherited this business from his father, generating his equity capital while working in Germany before returning to continue their family business. He has been running it for 6 years. Currently, he has about 10,000 Grivnas invested in inventory with income of about 6,400 Grivnas a month.

Yaroslav would like to get a 5,000 Grivna loan to purchase assorted merchandise wholesale as retail prices might go up very soon. This would allow him to keep his selling prices competitive and bring him additional profit. Yaroslav is seeking to achieve financial stability for his family. He is the only breadwinner in the family and has to provide for his family and retired father who lives with them. We believe Yaroslav’s willingness to see his business become more diversified and sustainable will ensure success of his trade and prompt repayment of the current loan.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Rostislav

texts.en:
For the last year, Rostislav has been investing his time and finances into developing his small business in Ivano-Frankivsk. He offers purified water supply and delivery services. Gained experience has equipped him to be a very successful entrepreneur. His business has grown to the point where he has been able to invest about 10,000 Grivnas in turnover capital.

Rostislav is known as a goal oriented business owner who is optimistic about the future. He is dreaming about developing a second business selling computers and offering related technical maintenance services. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 Grivnas to cover maintenance costs for his van which he uses to deliver water bottles to different locations in his home town. We believe financial assistance will help Rostislav continually meet the needs of his customers while providing for his own financial responsibilities.

loans.use: To cover van maintenance costs

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya decided to start her own business and become self-sustaining 10 years ago. Ever since she has been getting closer to her dream. Presently, her business has grown a lot and she already has about 8,000 Grivnas invested in stock. Nataliya sells a range of retail items, like perfumes, leather goods and cheap jewellery in one of the local outdoor markets. She has been a salesperson for several years and is very open-hearted, sociable and polite.  Nataliya is very good at her business, with a perfect credit history in “Nadiya Ukraine” and a good reputation among other market vendors. She has two vending facilities in her home town of Zaporozhye.

Nataliya wants to get a loan of 2,500 Grivnas which she will invest in increasing her inventory and purchasing new retail items in bulk. This will help her meet the needs and demands of her customers this holiday season. The loan will give Nataliya a chance to expand her trade and increase sales. She will be able to use the profits to invest in her family’s welfare and further growth of her business. 

Note: this is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar tiene 20 años. es soltera vive en casa de sus padres. La Isla Tata kily del Lago Titicaca es el lugar donde Pilar tiene su pequeño puesto de venta de artesanías ella, elabora collares y algunos artículos elaborados en base a totora(planta andina) y compra los hechos en cerámica, para ofrecer a los turistas que visitan su isla de diferentes lugares del mundo. A Pilar le gusta hablar con los turistas los cuales le cuentan como son las cosas en sus países y también algunas palabras que le resultan fascinantes, es por eso que ella busca dejar en alto el nombre de su pueblo y de su país con las artesanías que vende esperando hacer la estadía de  sus visitantes mucho más placentera. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita comprara más artesanías en base a cerámica y algunos materiales para elaborar collares, etc y así aumentar su producción para ofrecer mejores productos a los turistas que gentilmente los visitan.
texts.en:
Pilar, 20, is single and lives at home with her parents. She operates a small crafts business on Lake Titcaca's Isla Tata Kily. She makes necklaces and other items from "totora" (a reed-like Andean plant) and buys ceramic items, all of which she sells to the tourists who come to the island from all over the world. Pilar enjoys talking to the tourists who tell her about life in their countries, something that fascinates her. In turn, she seeks to pass along a little bit of her village and her country with the crafts that she sells, hoping that they will remember their visit to the island with great pleasure. This is her first loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. With the loan, she will buy more ceramic products and materials for making necklaces, etc. so that she can increase her production and offer her customers better products when they kindly stop by to take a look.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resell.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with one son. She is a Technical school graduate and worked for a while as a design engineer, but was unable to earn a stable salary. Seeking another source of income, Ludmila decided to start her own small business. She rented a kiosk and began selling household chemicals. Recently, however, Ludmila decided to make a change in the type of products she offers and start selling knitted wear and caps. She believes this new area of trade will help her generate additional profit.   

Ludmila has been in business for 15 years and can easily guess the preferences of her clients which helps build customer loyalty. Her integrity and perseverance have helped Ludmila keep her business stable throughout all these years. Presently, Ludmila has around 10,000 Grivnas of working capital. Her monthly profit amounts to 2,500 Grivnas. Ludmila would like to get a loan for 6,000 Grivnas to buy more clothing products. She is planning to purchase knitted wear and warm caps that always sell well in Ukraine in winter. This loan will help Ludmila’s business continue to grow ensuring the well-being of her family and helping to provide an education for her son at a good college.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es: Carlota tiene 47 años, vive con sus 2 hijos universitarios. Trabaja desde hace 12 años en la venta de artículos de cuero y de cuerina en un stand que alquiló ubicado en el centro de su ciudad, por ser esta, una zona comercial, le garantiza los ingresos para que siga adelante, diariamente con ayuda de sus hijos.  Carlota  se asegura de adquirir carteras y billeteras  con modelos innovadores y también de buena calidad, después de estos 12 años dedicándose a esta  actividad, tiene todos los deseos de seguir adelante para continuar sosteniendo la educación de sus 2 hijos. Para Carlota  hay meses D. año que son difíciles por las ventas disminuidas, así como otros meses, como en navidad,  en los cuales tiene mucho éxito y lo aprovecha al máximo. Es la primera vez que está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, pero se compromete a  ser una persona puntual y responsable con su devolución D. préstamo. Carlota desea invertir en más mercadería, es decir, comprará al por mayor directamente de fábricas, las carteras y billeteras para abastecerse y aprovechar la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Carlota is 47 years old. She lives with her two sons, both of whom are university students. For 12 years, she has sold leather and imitation leather goods in a rented stand located in the center of the city. Because of her stand's location in a commercial district, she is guaranteed the income she needs to advance her business. She works in the stand everyday with the help of her sons. Carlota makes sure to procure purses and wallets with innovative designs that are of high quality. After 12 years in this line of work, she has every desire to keep going and continue financing the education of her two sons. For Carlota, there are some months of the year which are more difficult due to decreased sales. During other months, such as Christmas time, her business is very successful. She makes sure to take full advantage of those months.

This is the first time she is requesting a loan with MFP, but she promises to be punctual and responsible with the repayment. Carlota wants to invest in more merchandise by purchasing products wholesale directly from the factories. This way she can meet the anticipated demand and take full advantage of the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale merchandise directly from the factory

loans.name: Dario

texts.es: Darío vive con su esposa y sus 2 últimos hijos. Lleva muchos años dedicándose a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales, ya suman 20 años de esta labor, él cultiva cereales y tubérculos, y en la cosecha vende todo el fruto de es esfuerzo a fin de que pueda cubrir los gastos de su hogar. También se dedica a la crianza de animales, principalmente vacas y toros que vende en la feria después de un tiempo de tenerlos, con las ventas adquiere mejores animales y aunque flacos, los hace engordar para que obtenga mejores ganancias. Lo difícil es cuando el clima perjudica seriamente sus cultivos, por ende, el alimento de sus animales, pero Darío ha aprendido ha superar estas dificultades y trabajar de una manera  beneficiosa. Es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, habiendo sido puntual en el primer ciclo. Este dinero será invertido en la siembra de papa, para lo cual comprará abono.
texts.en:
Darío lives with his wife and 2 youngest children. He has been a farmer for years, growing crops and raising animals for over 20 years. He grows grains and tubers, and at harvest time he sells all the products of his labor in order to be able to cover his household expenses. He also raises animals, primarily cows and bulls that he sells in the markets after having them for a while. With the sales of those animals he buys better although skinny animals, which he fattens in order to have greater profits. It is difficult when the weather damages his crops which are what he feeds his animals, but Darío has learned how to overcome these difficulties and work in a beneficial manner. This is the second time he has asked for a loan with MFP, he was punctual with his first loan. This money will be invested in the sewing of potato and purchasing fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Elvi

texts.es: Elvi tiene 37 años, vive con  su esposo e hijos. Desde hace un año da pensión (menú diario) en su casa, por el momento prepara almuerzos, con esto tiene ingresos adicionales para su hogar, así está superando una situación difícil de salud, de la cual se está recuperando recientemente, ahora sigue adelante, y a la par también realiza diversos servicios, como lavar la ropa de sus vecinos. Elvi a futuro tiene un plan, dedicarse nuevamente a lo que antes era para ella un ingreso más rentable, que es la crianza de cuyes, pero está esperando recuperarse totalmente de una operación de cálculos biliares para seguir con más fuerza. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo de MFP, demostrando responsabilidad en sus pagos. Está solicitando este dinero como capital para seguir dando pensión a sus clientes, comprar los insumos e ingredientes para la preparación de sus platos.
texts.en:
Elvi is 37 years old and she lives with her husband and children. For a year she has provided meals from her home. At the moment she prepares lunches, and this provides additional household income. In this way she can overcome a difficult health situation from which she is currently recuperating. She also offers various services such as washing clothing for her neighbors. In the future Elvi would like to return to a profession that was previously very profitable, which is raising guinea pigs, but she is waiting to fully recover from her gallstone surgery so that she will have full strength. This is the second time she has asked for a loan from MFP, demonstrating her responsibility in her payments. She is asking for this loan as capital to continue providing meals for her customers, buying consumables and ingredients to prepare her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients and consumables to prepare meals

payments.comment: correction due to overpayment for business 75762

loans.name: Tanya

texts.en:
Tanya is married with a son. She is an entrepreneur from Novomoskovsk where she works in the local bus station, selling interior doors for 2 years. She is characterized as an entrepreneur of integrity by her fellow vendors. Tanya has about 2,000 Grivnas in income. 

Some of Tanya's other characteristics are her consistency in customer service, dealing with suppliers and stress, and persistence in her business endeavors. Tanya is an entrepreneur who would never give up, but strives even harder. Tanya hopes to see her trade grow as she makes an investment in equipment for her office to facilitate her operational procedures. Tanya is seeking a 5,000 Grivna loan and is hoping to repay it in 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her office

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: Enma tiene 25 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Ella y su esposo, desde hace 8 años tomaron la decisión de tener su propia fabrica de ladrillos, antes solo trabajaban en otras fabricas de manera dependiente, ahora el trabajo para ellos es todo un esfuerzo bien recompensado, desde muy temprano ambos se esfuerzan para elaborar los ladrillos que necesitan todo un proceso para su elaboración, demoran  hasta 4 días en  producir millares. Esta actividad es muy rentable, aunque exista época de escasez de ventas, pero que son compensadas por las temporadas de abundancia que es durante los meses de marzo y abril, aunque el trabajo se torna sacrificado es una buena fuente de ingresos, que anima a su familia a continuar fabricando ladrillos. Esta es la tercera vez que solicita préstamo en MFP y hasta el momento ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos. Solicita este dinero para la compra de troncos y aserrín, que son necesarios para la fabricación de los ladrillos, además pagará el arriendo de parte de espacio donde tiene su fabrica de ladrillos. La camionada de aserrín está valorizada en 600 soles, y los palos y troncos serán comprados con el dinero restante.
texts.en:
Emma, 25, lives with her husband and 4 children. She and her husband decided 8 years ago to set up their own brick factory. Before that, they had worked in other factories for other people. Now they work for themselves and reap the full reward for their labor. Starting very early in the morning, they both work hard making bricks, something that requires several steps. It takes 4 days to make thousands. It's a profitable business but seasonal and sales vary depending on the time of year. Sales increase substantially in March and April and, though the work is hard, those months are a good source of income that inspire the family to go on with the business. This is the third time that Emma has applied to MFP for a loan and she's been consistently responsible and punctual in repaying the loans. She's applying for a loan to buy logs and sawdust, materials necessary for making bricks. She will also pay part of the rent on the space where she operates the business. A truckload of sawdust costs 600 soles and she will pay for sticks and logs with the rest of the money.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for brick-making business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 59 años y vive sola. Se dedica a la contratación de arrendamiento o alquiler de su local para eventos especiales, también ofrece  servicio de buffet, con el cual obtiene las ganancias para solventar la educación de 2 hijos universitarios que están fuera de la ciudad. Su dedicación es de todos los días, gracias a ello puede tener buenas entradas económicas, ya son más de 3 años de exhaustiva labor, por la cual Juana se siente muy satisfecha y sabe que siempre tiene que tener operativas las instalaciones e infraestructura de su local  para poder alquilarlo a un buen precio, por lo cual tiene deseos de seguir implementándose más para la decoración de su local. Es la primera vez que solicita este préstamo, pero promete ser muy responsable con los pagos de devolución de su crédito. Juana solicita este dinero con el que podrá abastecer los pedidos de buffet que recientemente ha obtenido, esto consiste en comprar los alimentos  por cantidad y al por mayor.
texts.en:
Juana is 59 years old and lives alone. She rents or hires out a site for special events and also offers a buffet service, with which she obtains profits to pay for the education of her two university-age sons who are outside the city. Thanks to her constant dedication, she has a good economic income from the last three years of exahustive labour. As a result Juana feels very satisfied and she knows she always has to keep the instalations and infrastructure of her business active in order to be able to hire them at a good price. For this reason she wants to continue installing more decorations on-site. It is the first time shes asked for a loan, but she promises to be very responsible with the repayments of her loan. Juana has requested this money so that she can fill the buffet orders which she has recently obtained, which means purchasing food wholesale and in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her buffet service

loans.name: Lily

texts.es: Lily tiene 38 años, en la actualidad vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Es docente de profesión, pero diariamente, en sus tiempos libres, generalmente en las tardes, ella y su cuñada elaboran yogurt de diferentes sabores, en su misma casa han implementado un espacio para la preparación de estos con los estándares exigidos en cuanto a higiene se refiere. Los fines de semana se dirigen a las  principales ferias comerciales para vender  los yogurt, lo más difícil es cuando existe mucha competencia, ya que existen muchos comerciantes del mismo producto, pero Lily está pendiente siempre de ver las mejoras de su producto para que  su consumo sea más aceptado. Es la tercera vez que solicita este préstamo con MFP, en los cuales se ha portado de manera responsable. Este dinero será invertido en la compra de los insumos y materiales necesarios para la elaboración del yogurt, como los envases e ingredientes como los saborizantes  y leche.
texts.en:
Lily, 38, lives with her husand and their 2 children. She's a teacher by profession, but in her spare time--afternoons, generally--during the week, she and her sister-in-law make different kinds of yogurt for sale. They have set up a space in Lily's house to make the yogurt which is processed to the standards of hygiene that yogurt requires. At weekends, they go to the principal fairs in the area to sell the yogurt. The main challenge is competition because there are lots of vendors selling the same product, but Lily is committed to ensuring that her product is the best because she wants to draw in as many customers as possible. This is her third MFP loan and she's demonstrated a responsible manner in the past. This loan will be used to buy the supplies and materials necessary to make yogurt: bottles, for example, and ingredients such as flavoring and milk.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and materials for yogurt business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma vive con su esposo y su hijo. Nació en una familia netamente agrícola y ganadera, de ahí que también optó por dedicarse a esta actividad, junto a su esposo siembran papa, olluco, oca y cebada por temporadas, de acuerdo a las condiciones climáticas, una vez que se acerca la cosecha, lleva a vender sus productos a la ciudad de Huancayo, donde obtiene las ganancias de su trabajo. Mientras que todavía no llega la época de la cosecha Norma y su esposo  concentran sus actividades en la crianza y venta de sus animales, ya que tiene mayormente ovejas. Es la segunda vez que Norma solicita un préstamo en MFP, en el primero demostró puntualidad y responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas de crédito. El dinero que solicita ahora es para compra de 4 sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Norma lives with her husband and son. She was born into a farming family and she's chosen to make her own living by farming. She and her husband grow seasonal products such as potatoes, barley, "olluco" and "oca" [olluco and oca are foodcrops] in accordance with local weather conditions. At harvest time, she takes the crops to the city of Huancayo where she can make the most money for her work. Before the harvest, Norma and her husband concentrate on raising and selling their animals, most of which are sheep. This is Norma's second MFP loan. With the first, she showed herself to be punctual and responsible in repaying her loan. This loan will be used to buy 4 sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for farming business.

loans.name: El Amor Group

texts.en:
"El Amor" is a large group of 25 borrowers. In this loan, 5 members of this group are hoping to receive their third loan. The first two loans helped each of these members start a small business, and all members started to experience a little bit of success.

Martina R. is the group representative, and a perfect example of the power of micro credit. Martina took her first two loans and started a small business selling used clothing. She has really increased her business, and is finally starting to feel able to take care of her family. Martina is the mother to 4 children, and would love to send all her children to college someday. She is very excited about the things that are starting to happen in her life, and ready for the challenges ahead.

On behalf of Martina, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support.

loans.use: Buy used clothing

loans.name: Santa Isabel

texts.es: Santa Isabel tiene 56 años, vive con su esposo y su última hija. DesD. que fue niña le ha gustado realizar variedad D. tejidos, es así que teje todo tipo D. gorros, chalinas, ponchos, entre otros, los venD. a los negociantes D. gran escaL., esta opción fue muy buen para Doña Santa Isabel, desD. que migró del campo a L. ciudad, antes L. agricultura  era L. única fuente D. ingreso, pero ahora también lo son los tejidos, lo cual le ayuda significativamente  para sostener L. educación D. sus hija  menor. A pesar D. vivir  mucho tiempo en L. ciudad no ha dejado D.  dedicarse a las tareas agrícolas, siembra papa y maíz, y cuando cosecha se los lleva a vender al mercado, pero esto solo suceD. cada 6 meses, por lo cual el ingreso fijo para elL. son los tejidos. Realmente disfruta  realizar sus tejidos. Se está iniciando como cliente D. MFP, pero su historial crediticio es limpio. Solicita este préstamo para invertir en L. compra D. lana por kilos, para seguir tejiendo, además D. comprar 3 sacos D. abono para sus cultivos D. papa.
texts.en:
Santa Isabel, 56, lives with her husband and her youngest daughter. She's enjoyed weaving cloth since she was a girl, which is how she came to set up a weaving business manufacturing all kinds of hats, "chalinas", ponchos and other clothing items. She sells them to bigger businesses, a good option for her now that she's moved from the country to the city. Her only source of income before was farming but now she has the weaving business which has helped her to pay for her youngest daughter's education. Despite having lived in the city for some time, she still works at farming, growing potatoes and maize, which she takes to market for sale at harvest time. The harvest only rolls around every 6 months, though, and the weaving business provides her with a fixed income. She truly enjoys her work. This is her first MFP loan but her credit history is clean. She's applying for a loan to buy bundles of wool by the kilo so that can continue her weaving business. She will also buy 3 sacks of fertilizer to grow potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool for weaving business.

loans.name: Tito

texts.es: Tito tiene 35 años, es casado y vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Trabaja desde hace 6 años a la cerrajería, en un comienzo era un trabajador más de un taller, pero dio un paso firme para implementar su propio taller y ser independiente, realiza todo tipo de trabajo en  carpintería metálica, de acuerdo a los trabajos que le solicitan y por medio de ello ha adquirido contratos que le permiten tener buenas ganancias. Tito está contento con su labor, porque es independiente, además  puede disponer de su tiempo libre para atender a sus hijos, su deseo es seguir adelante, por el bien de su esposa y de sus hijos, por lo cual continuará esforzándose. En esta oportunidad, es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito, durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. Tito solicita este préstamo con el que podrá comprar fierros al por mayor, para seguir fabricando sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Tito, 35, is married and lives with his wife and their 2 children. He worked at a locksmith's shop for 6 years, first as a laborer and then as a craftsman. He's now taken firm steps to set up his own shop and become independent, doing all kinds of work related to shaping metal, depending on what his customers want. He's already received orders that will allow him to earn a good living. Tito is happy with his work because he's independent and because he now has time to spend with his kids. He's striving to get ahead, to make a better live for his wife and children, and he'll continue to work hard for them. This is the the third loan for which he's applied and he showed himself to be punctual in repaying past loans. He's applying for this loans so that he can buy wholesale supplies of iron in order to continue making his products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies of iron for metal-shaping business.

loans.name: Tula

texts.es: Tula tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace un año decidió dar un giro completo en sus actividades para generarse recursos económicos en su propia casa, mediante un locutorio, donde además de ofrecer el servicio de fotocopias. Arrendó un local en una zona céntrica de su ciudad para  asegurarse las ventas, considera que ha sido un año de éxitos, lo que la motiva a perseverar en este negocio y con miras a expandirlo para seguir progresando. EL servicio que ofrece en su establecimiento es diario, con su amable y cálida atención logra captar nuevos clientes, una ligera dificultad es la competencia, por lo que quiere ofrecer un mejor servicio. Tula es una de las clientas más fieles que tiene MFP, estuvo en un grupo en Jauja (a 1 hora de distancia), pero se mudó y ahora ha empezado en esta zona con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en la compra de una cabina más y para el mantenimiento de su fotocopiadora. Ambos, suman la cantidad que solicita.
texts.en:
Tula is fifty years old and lives with her husband and their three children. A year ago she decided to make a a complete change in her activities to generate economic resources from her own home by opening up a phone booth store ("un locuturio," a place where long distance calls can be made at a cheaper a rate) as well as offering photocopy services. She leases a location in the center of their city to insure sales, and considering she has had a year of successes, she is motivated to continue in this business and has thoughts of expanding it to keep progressing. She offers these services every day at her store. With her friendly and warm attention, she gains new clients. A small challenge though is the competition, which is why she wants to offer better service. Tula is one of the most loyal clients that MFP has. Previously she was a member of a group in Jauja (one hour from her current location), but she moved and now has begun in this zone with MFP. With the money requested, she will invest in purchasing another booth and pay for the maintenance of her photocopier. These two goals sum up to the quantity of money that she has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a booth for her phone booth store and pay for maintenance of her photocopying machine.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y dos hijos. Se dedica de manera independiente a la agricultura desde hace 10 años, siembra papa, cebada  y habas; también vende animales, todos los días lunes los lleva a una localidad cercana a su zona, de esta manera  Vilma asegura el ingreso familiar. El trabajo que realiza es siempre junto con su esposo, a pesar de los días muy calurosos ella no se desalienta, porque está habituada a esta forma de trabajo y además  ahora se está impulsando más porque tiene en mente mejorar cada vez más. Esta es la primera vez que solicita el préstamo y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado responsabilidad. Con este dinero podrá invertir en la campaña de siembra para la papa, también para el forraje de su ganado. Comprará sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Vilma is 26 years old and lives with her husband and their two children. She is dedicated in an independent manner to agriculture and has been for ten years. She sows potatoes, barley, and beans. She also sells animals, which she brings every Monday to a nearby town in her zone to sell, and in this way she ensures the family income. The work that she does is always done together with her husband in spite of the very hot days when she is not discouraged because she is used to this form of work. Furthermore, she is very driven because she has it in her mind to improve more every day. This is the first time that she has requested a loan and so far she has shown a lot of responsibility. With this money she will be able to invest in sowing potatoes and forraging for her livestock. She will also buy sacks of manure fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in harvesting the potatoes and buying manure fertilizer.

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.en: Mrs A. Akouwa is an  expert in selling  charcoal . She  has  other  women working with her  as a  staff. Her staff  members are  Batchassi Pierrette, A. Akouwa and Passai Celestine, who is standing with her in the picture.  Her staff members  are  also specialized in  the charcoal business. Mrs A. Akouwa is requesting a loan of 900 dollars to buy  more charcoal  which  are made from dead  wood  so that they  can  bring   them in  the cities like Lome, Anie, and Aneho  to sell to the  women  who have restaurants  and food shops.  As Christmas and  New Year   are coming,  women  will need  charcoal to prepare their food  for  business and   for family  needs.   Because the market is flourishing  at this time of the year, she is sure that she could sell and make  more profit at the end of this year  and  continue the business throughout the next year.  She said she will use half of the profit of each month for her family's basic needs (food, particularly) and the other half to pay back the loan. Thank you for supporting  her small business.

loans.use: Charcoal  and sell it  in Lome, and other  cities

loans.name: Fransisco Jose

texts.es:
Francisco José C. tiene la edad de 43, su estado civil es casado, el tiene 3 hijos de los cuales su hija de 21 años de edad estudia anales clínico, un varón de 19 años que recientemente cursa el 5 año de bachillerato y una niña de 9 años que cursa el 4 grado de primaria, su compañera de vida labora como responsable de la boutique glamour, sus sueños son de comprar una casa que sea para sus hijos  para que así puedan vivir unidos y buscar su propia independencia, sus propósitos son de establecer un negocio en su casa de habitación donde pueda ofrecer mejor su mercadería donde sus clientes puedan escoger sus productos .



La actividad económica es de mercadería en general que expande los productos de: pantalones, camisas, camisas sport y trajes para damas Don Francisco tiene este negocio desde hace 4 años, el inicia este negocio por cuenta propia y empieza realizando viajes a Managua donde realiza las compras con pequeñas cantidades de ropa y por sus amistades obtuvo un sin numero de clientes y para suplir la demanda es que decidió ampliarse por el cual es el motivo del financiamiento para la compra de mas producto que se realizara en el departamento de Chinandega y Managua para que asi le pueda favorecer mejor.
texts.en:
Francisco, 43, is married and has 3 children: a daughter, 21, who is studying clinical analysis; a son, 19, who recently finished a 5-year baccalaureate; and a daughter, 9, who is in the 4th grade. His wife manages a beauty salon. They would like to buy a house for their children so that they can live together and gradually become independent. Their goal is to set up a shop at home where they could better show their merchandise and serve their customers. Francisco earns his living selling merchandise such as pants, blouses, sports shirts and suits for women. He has owned the business for 4 years. He started it on his own, traveling to Managua where he buys small quantities of clothing. Thanks to his good nature, he has an endless number of customers. He's decided to apply for a loan so that he can meet the demand for his goods. He'll buy wholesale supplies of merchandise in Chinandega and Managua because that's where he can get the best deals.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Piyalo

texts.en: Mrs. P. is married and the mother of five children. She has sold food for ten years now. She sells chips made by yam “Koliko” every evening. Most of her income comes from that activity which she uses for her family needs. She also helps her husband pay for the rent and invests in education for their children. As school has started, she believes she should buy additional food and respond better to her family's demands. On top of that, she can also sell better during the end-of-year parties and Christmas. Thus, she is requesting a loan of 500 dollars that she will use to buy more yams, potatoes and other staple foods. She says she will be able to pay back her loan within 16 months. She thanks you for your assistance to her vital small business.

loans.use: Local food Restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fuel

loans.name: Yadira Ferrufino

texts.es:
La señora Yadira A. Ferrufino tiene la edad de 49 años, su estado civil es soltera, solo tiene a su cargo una niña de la edad de 18 años que cursa recientemente el 2 año de la carrera de administración turística en sus propósitos esta el de darle mejoras a su vivienda como serian cambiar el techo por lo que es necesario realizar las compras  de los materiales para lograr este propósito y con esto lograra darle las mejoras necesarias a su  vivienda por lo que es importante para ella ya que se aproxima la temporada de lluvia y así tendrá mas protección para su familia.


La actividad económica a la Doña Yadira se dedica es la venta de cosméticos, el tiempo que tiene de tener su negocio es de 30 años, ella comienza viajando a honduras y Guatemala donde compraba sus productos y venia a entregarlos a sus clientes cuando eran encargos mas tarde debido a su edad decidió no seguir viajando y enfocarse mas en las casas comerciales de león y selecciono a sus mejores clientes, el financiamiento es para  capital de trabajo que es para la compra de mas producto como: crema, perfumes, body ya que esto es lo que mas vende por lo que es necesario realizar las compras de sus productos.
texts.en:
Yadira A. Ferrufino is 49 years old, single, and only has in her care an 18 year old daughter who recently began her second year of study in tourism administration. Her purpose is to make improvements to her house, such as change the roof, for which it is necessary to buy the materials to achieve this purpose. These improvements to her house are important for her because the wet season is coming and like this she will have more protection for her family. The economic activity of Doña Yadira is selling cosmetic. She has had her business for 30 years. She began travelling to Honduras and Guatemala where she used to buy her products, and returned to give them to her clients when they placed orders. Later, owing to her age, she decided not to conitnue travelling, and focus more on the companies in León, selecting her best clients. The finance is for working capital to buy more products such as: moisturiser, perfumes, and cream as this is what she sells more, which is why she needs to buy these products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy cereal from the rural areas and sell them in town

loans.name: Editha

texts.es:
Editha pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Editha tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. Es profesora al igual que su esposo, aunque ella fundó un colegio particular y abrió una bodega en su casa, ubicada en Acobamba s/n frente a la capilla de Acobamaba. Afirma que ha crecido regularmente porque empezó su bodega con un préstamo que le brindaron de S/. 1,000. Actualmente tiene invertido en su pequeña bodega alrededor de siete mil a ocho mil soles, aunque encarga el negocio muchas veces a su madre por el escaso tiempo que dispone. Manifiesta que este negocio beneficia mucho a su familia porque cuando algo necesitan lo cogen de la bodega.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,300, el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de panteones porque ya está ingresando la temporada navideña. 

Editha afirma que le gustaría recibir talleres para mejorar tanto su vida personal como su negocio, aunque por ahora no tiene mucho tiempo disponible.
texts.en:
Editha belongs to the Mujeres al Progreso ("Women for Progress") community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash. She is 39 years old and partnered with 2 children. Like her husband, she's a teacher, but she started her own home-based school; she also opened a small grocery in her house in Acobamba, across from the Acobamba chapel. She says that the business has grown steadily since she started it with a S/.1,000 [1,000 Peruvian soles] loan. Edith has now invested about six- to eight-thousand soles in the business even though she's often entrusted it to her mother because she has so little time. She adds that the business has greatly helped her family because when they need something, they get it from the business.

With this S/.2,300 loan, to be repaid in 8 installments, Editha will buy "panetones" [a traditional fruitcake-like bread] for the upcoming Christmas season.

Editha says that she would like to attend workshops, as much to improve her personal life as her business, even though she doesn't have much spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy panetones [a traditional seasonal bread] for resale.

loans.name: Judith Catalina

texts.es:
Judith pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso del distrito y provincia D. Yungay, departamento D. Ancash.

Es casada, tiene tres hijos y a sus 58 años D. edad ha crecido. Junto a su esposo, que es jubilado, atienD. su fuente D. soda desD. hace cuatro años y tiene a su cargo a 2 D. sus hijos, uno D. ellos, una mujer, es especial, quien llegó a ser su mayor reto, el criarla. Abastece su negocio por medio D. los agentes distribuidores. Su negocio, poco a poco, ha crecido.

El préstamo D. S/. 1,500, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, abastecerá su tienda con cerveza y con otros productos que servirán para surtir su negocio.

Judith agradece el apoyo que le ha brindado Credimujer para el crecimiento D. su negocio.
texts.en:
Judith is a member of the community bank Mujeres al Progreso from the district and province of Yungay in the department of Ancash. She is married and has three children at her age of 58. Together with her husband, who is retired, she sees after their soda fountain and grocery store and has for the past four years. Two of her children are still under her care, and one of them, a woman, is special and it has been a big challenge raising her. She supplies her business with products from distribution agents. Her business, little by little, has grown. The loan of 1500 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, will supply her store with beer and other products that she will offer to boost her business. Judith is thankful for the support that Credimujer has offered her to help her grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy beer and other products.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Al Progreso del distrito y provincia D. Yungay, departamento D. Ancash.

Tiene 60 años edad, es casada y tiene seis hijos, aún cuando ya casi todos se han independizado mantiene todavía a dos D. sus hijas y junto a su esposo trabaja en su panadería, desD. hace 30 años, el cual se encuentra ubicado en Ranrahirca s/n, en la esquina D. la plaza D. armas D. este centro poblado. Manifiesta que al inicio del negocio empezó con 10 quintales D. harina por producción (1 quintal equivale a 50kg). Ha ido creciendo en su negocio, tan es así que en la actualidad produce 80 quintales por día y 2 veces por semana. Asegura que su mayor logro ha sido educar a sus hijos para que ellos tengan una profesión y construir su casa propia.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará específicamente con todo el préstamo, leña, debido que para calentar el horno es necesario gran cantidad D. leña.

Natividad menciona que desearía capacitarse para mejorar su negocio y también su  vida personal.
texts.en:
Natividad is a member of the community bank Mujeres al Progreso from the district and province of Yungay in the department of Ancash. She is sixty years of age, married, and has six children. Though almost all of the children have maD. themselves independent now, she still takes care of two of her daughters. For the past thrity years, she works together with her husband in their bakery, which is located in Ranrahirca, located on the corner of the plaza in the town center. Initially she began the business with 500 kilograms of flour for production. The business has been growing such that today she produces 4000 kilograms per day and twice per week. She affirms that her greatest achievement has been educating her children so that they have a profession and construct their own house. With this loan for 2000 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will purchase firewood, using all of the loan, because to heat the oven a great quantity of wood is needed. Natividad mentioned that she wants to qualify to improve her business and also her personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La microempresaria Isabel C. Álvarez tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, con 6 hijos, 2 menores que estudian en nivel secundario y 4 adultos que viven en sus propias casas. Esta señora tiene una pulpería desde hace más de 20 años cuando emigro de una zona rural de esta región en búsqueda de mejores alternativas para su familia. 

Este negocio le permite a la señora C. y a su marido poder sustentar el hogar dándoles estudios y otras necesidades mínimas a sus 2 hijos que viven con ellos.

Sin embargo necesita se le financie lo siguiente:

5 quintales de arroz americano el cual compra a US$ 59  cada quintal, 4 quintales de azúcar que compra a US$ 28 cada quintal, 2 quintales de frijoles a US$ 54 cada quintal, 6 bidones de aceite a US$ 25 cada bidón y 5 quintales de harina a US$ 32 cada quintal.
texts.en:
Small businesswoman Isabel C. Álvarez is 52 years old and is married with six children: the two youngest ones who are high school students and four adults who live in their own homes. This woman has owned a shop for more than twenty years when she emigrated from a rural area of this region looking for better alternatives for her family. This business allows Mrs. C. and her husband to support their home and give the two children who live with them an education and other small necessities. Nevertheless, they need to fund the following: 500 lbs. of American rice which costs US$ 59 per 100 lbs. 400 lbs. of sugar which costs US$ 28 per 100 lbs. 200 lbs. of beans at US$ 54 per 100 lbs. 6 drums of oil at US$ 25 per drum 500 lbs. of flour at US$ 32 per 100 lbs.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 500 lbs of American rice, 400 lbs. of sugar,  200 lbs. of beans, 6 drums of oil, and 500 lbs. of flour.

loans.name: Estefana

texts.es:
Estefana lleva 5 años, de tener su tienda a la cual  le colocó el nombre de Buenos Aires.  Ella se ha dedicado a tiempo completo a dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, además les ofrece una muy buena calidad en sus productos.
Aparte de vender artículos como: café, frijoles, azucar, arroz, (consumo diario) tambien tiene venta de Agua pura en garrafones y Gas propano, y tambien se ha dedicado a la elaboración de prendas de vestir, como: blusas, camisas, vestidos..etc.
Estefana tiene 4 hijos los cuáles la apoyan moralmente en su negocio, una de ellas, le ayuda a atender el negocio cuando ella sale a hacer las compras para la tienda.
Gracias a la ayuda que se le brindo anteriormente, ella pudo ampliar su tienda, teniendo variedad de mas productos.
El proposito de adquirir un nuevo credito, es para poder comprar un mostrador que le ayude a poder mostrar su producto variado.
Tiene en sus planes poder colocar venta de cuadernos, lapices, lapiceros, borradores, (artículos de librería).
texts.en:
Estefana has owned her store, called Buenos Aires, for 5 years. She has worked hard to provide good-quality merchandise to her customers along with good service. In addition to products such as coffee, beans, sugar, rice, Estefana sells jugs of clean water, propane gas, etc. She also makes clothes: blouses, shirts, dresses, etc. Estefena has 4 children who support their mother and help her with the business when they can. One of them tends the store when she has to go out to buy supplies. Thanks to the help that she's received, she's been able to expand the store, adding more products. The purpose of the new loan is to buy a counter where she can display her merchandise. Her plan is to add products such as notebooks, pens, pencils, erasers and other school and office supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in store.

loans.name: Cruz Adilia

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa tiene 56 años de edad, habita en un bario de la capital de Managua que se llama la primavera, es madre soltera, con un hijo de 24 años de edad, que tiene dificultades ya que es enfermo de síndrome de daunw, lo cual para ella es difícil, ya que necesita muchos cuidado, doña Rosa logro instalar un salón de belleza desde hace diez años, lo cual inicio con dinero que un banco presto, las dificultades que tiene abecés es cuando se va la energía eléctrica, casi todo el día, lo cual ella no puede laborar y es un día perdido. Ahora estoy en Afodenic esta es mi segunda solicitud lo cual es de gran beneficios ya que he podido mantener mi negocio y por que tiene taza de interés bajas con la solicitud de préstamo es para comprar cosméticos, y tratamientos para el cabello ya que estamos en una temporada donde las jóvenes comienzan a cambiar de look, y deseo aprovechar a los clientes, espera obtener muchas ganancias para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. A largo plazo es remodelar el local y ampliarlo, y hacerlo en una estética, a si como abrir una cuenta de ahorro para asegurarle el patrimonio a mi hijo para que no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is 56 years old, and lives in a suburb of the capital, Managua, known as spring. She is a single mother, with a 24 year old son, who has difficulties because he has down syndrome. This is difficult for her, as he needs a lot of care. Señora Rosa managed to install a beauty salon 10 years ago, which she did with a bank loan. The difficulties she sometimes has are when there is no electricity for nearly a whole day, because she can't work and loses a day. Now she is in Afodenic and this is her second request for a loan. From these loans she has received great benefits and has been able to maintain her business, because it has a low interest rate. The loan is to buy cosmetics, and hair treatments. They are now in a time when young people begin to change their look, and she want to make the most of her clients. She hopes to obtain many earnings to continue inveseting in her business. Her long-term objective is to remodel the premises and expand it, making it a cosmetic surgery, so she can open a savings account to ensure that there are assets for her son, so that he doesn't want for anything.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tints and cosmetics for hair treatments

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es: Doña Adilia habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama  Waspan Norte, tiene 28 años de edad, casada y con un niño de 5 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de la zona franca y se desempeña como operario en maquinas, la Sra. Adilia vende cosméticos desde hace cuatro años, lo cual inicio con prestamos de bancos comunales, sus dificultades es cuando las clientas se cambian de domicilio y no le pagan ya que sus productos los vende al contado y al crédito, con la solicitud que esta solicitando en Afodenic es para invertir en la compra de pacas para vender ropa favorables a los clientes y obtener mejores ingresos ya que todo esta caro, tiene que buscar como promover el dinero. A largo plazo es ampliar su negocio y vender varios productos que les guste a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Doña Adilia lives in a neighborhood of Managua named Waspan Norte, she is 28 years old, married, with a 5 year-old son. Her husband works operating machinery at an enterprise in the free zone . Mrs. Adilia has been selling cosmetics for four years and she initiated this business with loans from community banks. She has difficulties when her clients move and do not pay the products as she sells in cash or on credit. With the loan requested from Afodenic she will invest in buying clothing in bulk to be able to sell favorable garments to the clients and obtain higher income, and as everything is so expensive she has to find ways of making money. In the long run she will increase business and sell other products that are popular with her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Carla Patricia González M. tiene 34 años de edad, es casada con dos hijos, ambos menores de edad, tiene desde hace 5 años una pulpería ubicada en un barrio periférico de esta ciudad conocido como Loma Fresca y por medio de este negocio ayuda a su marido en los gastos del hogar y a la vez le permite pagar los estudios de sus hijos y sus propios estudios universitarios.

Por la lejanía del lugar y valorando que el sector donde vive existen pocas pulperías le permite tener bastantes clientes lo que garantiza la venta de sus productos, sin embargo por no contar con capital suficiente no puede tener variedad de productos ni productos cárnicos (res, cerdo) que son parte de la dieta de los costeños y de esta manera pierde posibles ingresos, por tal razón requiere se le apoye con un  financiamiento para comprar los siguientes productos:

3 Docenas de sopa 3 minutos a US$ 11 cada docena, 24 unidades de leche la lechera a US$ 3.50 cada unidad,  quintales de arroz nacional el cual compra a US$ 49  cada quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar que compra a US$ 28 cada quintal, 2 quintales de frijoles a US$ 54 cada quintal, 2 bidones de aceite a US$ 25 cada bidón, 1 exhibidor el cual compra US$ 80, 2 bolsones de papel higiénico  US$ 15.50 cada bolsón y  20 sacos de carbón a US$ 3 cada saco.
texts.en:
Ms. Carla Patricia González M. is 34 years old, married and has two minor children. For 5 years, she has owned a grocery store in a suburb called Loma Fresca. Thanks to the grocery store, she has been able to help her husband with the household expenses, as well as paying for her children's schooling and her own university studies. Because of the remoteness of where she lives and the fact that there are few grocery stores nearby, she has many customers, which guarantees the sale of her products.
