However, due to a lack of working capital, she is unable to offer a greater variety of products, nor can she offer meat products (beef, pork) which are part of the diet of the local coastal people and therefore she is losing potential revenue. She needs you to help her with a loan which she will use to buy the following: 3 dozen 3-minute soups at $11.00 USD per dozen, 24 units of milk at $3.50 per unit, 2 100lb bags of national rice (each bag costs $49 USD), 2 100lb bags of sugar at $28 USD each, 2 100lb bags of beans at $54 USD per bag, 2 bulk cans of oil at $25 USD each, 1 display case which costs $80 USD, 2 bulk bags of toilet paper which each cost $15.50 USD and 20 bags of coal at $3 USD per bag.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 dozen 3-minute soups, 24 units of milk, 2 100lb bags of national rice, 2 100lb bags of sugar, 2 100lb bags of beans, 2 bulk cans of oil, 1 display case for candies, 2 bulk bags of toilet paper and 20 bags of coal.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: El señor José Samuel C. tiene la edad de 42 años habita en la concepción junto a su esposa y hijos, la esposa de don José trabaja como domestica en una casa particular, para ayudarle con los gastos de la casa y la universidad de unos de sus hijos, el hijo de don José también trabaja como jardinero en casa particular para ayudarse con los pasajes y mensualidad de la universidad. Este señor tiene un taller de carpintería el cual con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado tener ya que es una herencia que le dio su papá y la continuado trabajando por tradición ; pero lo que mas se dedica es a la agricultura la mayor preocupación de él es la falta de financiamiento , el se siente contento por que tiene el apoyo de AFODENIC , que le brinda su mano amiga para que trabaje con sus cultivos y tenga una buena producción , este vez solicita la cantidad de C$ 15,000.00 córdobas para establecer un cuarto mas de piña y lo demás comprar insumos que lo necesita con mucha importancia los otros cultivos establecidos . Su sueño es llegar a establecer seis manzana de piña para poder dejarles herencia a cada uno de sus hijos que al igual que el ; le acostado mantener la producción .
texts.en:
José Samuel C. is 42 years old and lives in Concpecion together with his wife and children. Jose's wife works as a domestic employee in a private house, in order to help with the household expenses and the university fees of one of their children. Jose's son also works as a gardener in a private house to help with University expenses. Jose has a carpentry workshop which with much effort he has managed to keep going, as the business was inherited from his father and he has continued working using traditional methods. But he dedicates himself above all to agriculture and his major worry is the lack of financing. He feels happy because he has the support of AFODENIC, which has given him a friendly hand so that he can work with his crops and ensure a good harvest. This time he is requesting $15000 Cordobas in order to estabilsh a further field of pineapples and also to buy much-needed materials for the other established crops. His dream is to establish six manzanas (about 10 acres) of pineapples, in order that he can leave an equal inheritance to each of children, who like him have worked hard to maintain production.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials such as pesticide and fertilizer to improve crops

loans.name: Liliana Hortencia

texts.es:
Esta Microempresaria Liliana Hortensia P. tiene la edad de 44 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Liliana tiene 3 hijos de las cuales 2 son gemelas que tienen la edad de 23 años ambas y estudian recientemente licenciatura en farmacia, y su otra hija de 27 años de edad quien no estudia por problemas de aprendizaje, su compañero de vida no labora, sus  sueños son de obtener un establecimiento donde pueda realizar mejor su venta y mantenerse en la competencia, otros de sus deseos es luchar por su hija y que esta pueda salir adelante con la ayuda necesaria por lo que en sus prioridades esta que ella reciba educación especial y el día de mañana  pueda desempeñarse por si sola.


Su actividad económica es la de mercadería en general por lo que vende lo siguiente: short, camisola, calcetines ropa interior y otros esta señora distribuye sus productos de manera ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer el negocio es de 30años, ella inicia este negocio por lo que sus hermanas y su mama le indujeron por lo que ella obtuvo su propio negocio, el financiamiento será utilizado para tener mas variedad  en su producto para que Doña Liliana pueda ofrecer los diferentes productos y que tendrá que realizar la compra de estos productos en Managua y así generar los ingresos necesarios tanto para su familia y sus compromisos contraídos
texts.en:
This micro-businesswoman Liliana Hortensia P. is 44 years old and married. Doña Liliana has 3 children, 2 of which are twin girls that are 23 years old. Both are studying a licence in pharmacy. Her other daughter is 27 years old and doesn't study, due to learning difficulties. Her husband doesn't work. Her dreams are to obtain an establishment where she can make better sales and remain competitive. Other wishes are to fight so that her daughter can move forward with the necessary help. Her priority is that she receives a special education and in the morning can manage by herself. She has a general store where she sells: shorts, camisoles, socks, underwear and others. She travels to sell these products. She has had this business for 30 years. Her sisters and mother induced her to start her business so she obtained her own business. The finance will be used to obtain more variety in her products, so that Doña Liliana can offer different products. She will have to make the purchases of these products in Managua, and like this generate the money that is so necessary for her family and her contractual commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marlenis

texts.es:
La microempresaria Marlenis R. tiene 42 años de edad, es casada con 2 hijos, todos estudian y desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de perfumes para apoyar a su marido en los gastos del hogar. Doña Marlenis tiene como clientes a mujeres que trabajan en oficinas publicas como el ministerio de educación, el ministerio de salud y algunas oficinas privadas como el chino chow entre otras. Sin embargo ella tiene que enviar a la capital pagos quincenales ya que estos productos son propiedad de empresa vogel, pero  la mayoria de sus clientas les pagan al mes por lo que necesita financiamiento para poder asumir esas deudas y recuperarlas mensualmente, además para poder comprar mas productos ya que sus clientas le compran estos productos por lo menos una vez cada mes, en algunos casos pintura de labios, en otros perfumes, en otros cremas en fin una sola clienta  siempre le compra algo. 

Quiere comprar los siguientes productos los cuales ya están encargados: 1 docena de perfumes de hombre variado a US$ 96 Dólares cada docena, 1 docena de tinte para el cabello a US$ 36 dólares cada docena, 2 docenas de perfumes de mujer  a US$ 120 dólares cada docena, 1 docena de crema para el cuerpo a US$ 36 dólares cada una, 1 docena de desodorante para mujer a US$ 32 dólares cada una, 1 docena de desodorante para hombres a US$ 30 dólares cada una, y ½ docena de tratamiento para el cabello a US$ 30 dólares la media docena.
texts.en:
Businesswoman Marlenis R. is 42 years old and married with two children. Both are students. For the last eight years, Marlenis has been selling perfumes to help her husband with household expenses. Her clients are women who work in government offices such as the Ministry of Education and the Ministry of Health, as well as private offices like Chino Chow etc. She has to send payments every two weeks to the capital since the products that she sells are owned by Vogel Company. However, the majority of her clients pay her monthly. She therefore needs a loan so that she can cover these debts and then get the money back at the end of the month. She would also like to be able to buy more products as her customers buy from her at least once a month such items as lipstick, perfume, or creams. Each customer always buys something. As a result of requests from her customers, Marlenis wishes to purchase one dozen men’s perfumes at US$96 per dozen, one dozen hair dyes at US$36 per dozen, two dozen women’s perfumes at US$120 per dozen, one dozen cases of body lotion at US$36 at US$36 per case, one dozen cases of women’s deodorants at US$32 per case, one dozen cases of men’s deodorants at US$30 per case, and half a dozen hair treatments at US30 per half dozen.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of personal care products

loans.name: Lai

texts.en: Mrs. Lai V. is 51 years old and she now lives in Lvea Sor Kandal village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Chea Savoeun, are farmers who own a piece of land.  They cultivate rice for a living. In this plantation, they face some problems because the field is infertile and they do not have rice seeds to support their field. Their field is also too far from the irrigation system. In order to deal these problems, Mrs. Lai V. requests a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and petrol pumping to support her field. She has three children, one of whom is a nurse while the others attend the local school.  Her husband is shown on the left of photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seeds and petrol pumping to support her field.

loans.name: Khai

texts.en: Mrs. Khai K. is a farmer living in Lvea Sor Kroum village in Kandal Province.  Mrs. Khai K. is 45 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while one is a worker and the last is in school.  She owns a small piece of land and grows vegetables to earn a living. On this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have vegetable seeds to plant. Thus, she requests a loan for buy vegetable seeds and to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Im Seak, is under president of the village.Her husband is presented on the left of photo.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Sothy

texts.en: Mr. Sothy B. is 25 years old and lives in Lvea Sor Kroum village in Kandal Province. His wife, Mrs. Ey Chenda, is a farmer. Mr. Sothy B. has a three year old child. His wife is presented on the right of photo. He uses a horse with a cart to transport passengers and goods. His cart is in bad condition and that effects his services. Thus, he requests a loan to repair his horse cart. He hopes to increase income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To repair his horse cart.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, who is married to a good man and blessed with five obedient children, cooks and sells rice cake (or the famous "bibingka") in the Philippines.  She has been in this business which she enjoys for almost ten years now.  Her enjoyment is brought about, aside from the income, by the good remarks of her customers, i.e. she "cooks deliciously". She roams around their community going from one house to another to sell rice cake. Her income is at a minimum of Php100.00 a day.  

Aside from her daily house-to-house selling of the tasty native food, she is also able to get orders during special occasions like birthdays, fiesta, Holy Week and All Souls Day. But the highest demand for this native food is during the month of December, or the Christmas season, because it is the tradition of the Filipinos to eat this delicacy combined with ginger tea after attending the "misa de gallo" or the night (or early morning) mass held from December 16 to December 24.

With the Christmas season fast approaching, and to meet the expected high demands for rice cake, Anita wants to avail of a loan of Php 5,000.00. She wants to be prepared for the blessings that this season will bring to her.
	
She hopes that her request will be granted so she can continue improving her business and helping her husband in meeting the needs of their family, and eventually realizing their dreams.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli has a small poultry business in her humble community of Barangay Ballacong Ilagan, Isabela, where most of the settlers are engaged primarily in agricultural businesses. She is married and has two children. Arceli loves her family very much and she is motivated to work hard for them. 

She raises commercial chickens and sells them when they reach 40-45 days, and she earns PHP100 - PHP120 per kilo. She makes sure that she does not run out of stocks by buying some chicks even when there is still inventory of chickens ready for sale. The members of the family take part in managing the business.  

Arceli is asking for a loan of PHP5,000 in order to increase her income because at the moment, her earnings are limited due to lack of capital. Increased income will mean additional resources to support the basic needs of her family and her children’s education. Arceli further shared that the education of her children will bring them security in the future.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino is a diligent husband with simple dreams–to provide a better life for her family and send their children to school. He is married to Marivic and gifted with two children. They are living in a peaceful community surrounded by agricultural land.

Aside from selling the fruits and vegetables that he harvests in their farm, Avelino is also engaged in the buying and selling of carabao (water buffalo) and cow. This has been their sources of his income for almost fifteen years now.

He believes that a loan request of PHP 7,000 will enable him to generate higher profit because he will be able to buy other animals like boars and goats that he can sell to the nearby province.

Avelino and his wife are also starting to save some of their income in preparation for the college education of their children. They also dream to improve their house in the future when they are financially ready.

loans.use: To buy more animals like boars and goats.

loans.name: Yon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yon Y. is a group leader of eight people who all live in Korng Keb village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 54 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are farmers while the other is enrolled in the local school.  Her husband is presented in the picture.   She is a farmer who cultivates rice and vegetables on her plot of land. He husband, Mr. E. C., is a fisherman. Their family needs more income to support their family and improve living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Yon Y. requests a loan to add to her savings to buy a new house for her family. 

All the members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add her saving to buy a new house for her family.

loans.name: Pech Theary's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Pech Theary E. is a group leader of nine members who all live in Chrouy Dang village in Kandal Province. She is 27 years old and she is single. She is a bookseller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she requests a loan to buy more inventory for her consumers. She hopes to increase income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more books for her consumers.

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
Bienvenida and her family live in Malamag West, where farming is the main livelihood of the residents.  Her husband is a farmer while Mrs. Samuco is engaged in meat vending.  Their four children serve as the inspiration to improve their lives. 

For almost three years now, Mrs. Samuco, with the help of her husband, has raised pigs in their backyard, selling the meat in their community. Their store, very accessible to her customers since it is  located in front of their house, earns a weekly average gross income of about $70 which they use as revolving capital.  They are so thankful that increasing demand enables them to sell all of their meat products everyday.  

Bienvinida is now requesting a loan to purchase more pigs in order to satisfy this demand and is very optimistic that through their business, they will improve their way of life and be able to send all of their children to college.  “All things are possible with God on our side,” says Bienvenida.

loans.use: To buy more pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To request for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her customers.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda, married, lives in the orderly community of Barangay Lullutan Ilagan, Isabela and chooses a welding shop business as their source of income. Brenda and her husband work hard in order to earn enough money to provide for their family’s needs and support their six children’s education. The members of the family happily take part in the operation of their machine/welding shop.

They also receive orders for steel trusses, metal windows and other related metal products.  Brenda is requesting additional capital amounting to Php7, 000 to be used in purchasing a grinding machine, machine tools and welding rods which are all necessary to the growth of their business because these will meet their customers’ expectations in terms of quality.

She expects that the business growth that they will achieve by borrowing additional capital will enable her to help her husband and send all of their children to school and finish college.

loans.use: purchase tools, machine, etc.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch K. is a group leader of eight members who all live in Srae Chheu Neang village in Takeo Province. She is 59 years old and the mother of one. She and husband, Mr. Soun Phal, are farmers who cultivate rice on their plot of land. Their family needs more income to support their household. Thus, Mrs. Touch K. requests a loan to buy a pig to start a pig breeding business. She hopes to increase income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. 

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans (the rest of have monthly payment loans). These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a pig to start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally P., the group leader, is a farmer who cultivates rice and vegetables on a plot of land.  Her husband, Mr. Nhoek Sok, is a construction worker. Mrs. Phally P. is 35-year-old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young.  She does not earn enough to support her household. Thus, Mrs. Phally P. requests a loan to buy crop seeds to support her field.
 
The village group consists of sixteen members living in Toul Tbaeng village in KaK. Province.  The members plan to use the loan which they obtained in different purposes. This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans (the rest of have monthly payment loans). These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy crop seeds for growing to support her field.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina’s family lives beside the famous Lullutan River in Barangay Lullutan Ilagan, Isabela, across the Cagayan River (the longest river in the Philippines). She manages her own sari-sari store (local term for community-based variety store) in their village. She is married to a construction worker and is blessed with three children. Her husband’s job does not yield a stable income since working in a construction firm is only contractual.

In order to continue the operation of her store, Cristina approached a local MFI (micro finance institution) and asked for a loan of Php7,000 to increase her working capital. This will be used to purchase more stock including vegetables, fish, pork and poultry. Cristina believes that the more variety of products that is available in her store, the more daily sales and income she will gain. It will be of great help to them if this loan would be granted because she can grow her business and from its income she can support one of her children who is in college right now.

The client also believes firmly in the power of God.  Through faith, prayer and a closer relationship with Him, accompanied with hard work and dedication to her business, nothing is impossible.

loans.use: additional working capital (buy vegetables, fish, pork, meat and poultry)

loans.name: Carlota Tembe

texts.pt:
Carlota Tembe D. é natural de Maputo, tem 35 anos de idade, casada maritalmente como segunda esposa, onde vive somente com a sua filha o marido vem de vez em quando, mãe de uma filha de 14 anos de idade, para alem da sua filha sustenta os pais enviando lhe géneros alimentícios.

Carlota estudou até 6ªclasse e parou quando ficou grávida e dai nunca conseguiu continuar com os estudos, cresceu com os pais e devido a gravidez não planificada teve que entrar nos negócios para obter algo para o sustenta dela e sua filha, diz que numa primeira fase o marido não assumia a filha. Neste momento vive numa casa própria.

Carlota vive basicamente de negocio a mais de 10 anos e tem duas empregadas, onde vende, roupas, artigos / utensílios  domésticos e géneros alimentícios. Onde destacas as roupas de cama tais como. Djuvetes que compra na terra do rand por 110rands e vende por 1000,00mts e de 200rands vende por 1500,00mts.a cerveja que compra a caixa por 230,00mt e vende por 300,00mt,  Com isso tem um rendimento mensal de 5000,00mt.

Para Carlota este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, assim pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim de reabilitar a sua casa e também pretende comprar uma viatura para lhe facilitar nas compras na africa do sul.
texts.en:
Carlota Tembe D. is from Maputo, 35 years old, married as a second wife and lives only with her daughter as her husband is only home once in a while. She is the mother of a 14 year old girl and apart from supporting this daughter, she also supports her parents, sending them food.

Carlota was in school until the 6th grade and left when she became pregnant, never managing to resume her studies. She grew up with her parents and due to her unplanned pregnancy, had to start working in order to support herself and her daughter, as she says that in the beginning her husband would not acknowledge his child. She currently live in her own house.

Carlota has basically lived off her business for more than 10 years and has two employees. She sells clothes, home wares and food. She mostly sells bed linen such as duvets, which she buys in South Africa for 110 rand and sells for 1000,00 MZN or buys for 200 rand and sells for 1500,00 MZN. She also sells beer which she buys for 230,00 MZN per box and sells for 300,00 MZN. She has a monthly income of 5000,00 MZN.

This is Carlota’s first loan from Hluvuku and from Kiva and intends to pay it back early in order to request another loan to repair her house. She also intends to buy a vehicle to facilitate her purchasing from South Africa.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing more stock to be sold through her business

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.en:
Dionisio is a humble man and married to a simple and loving wife with six children.  His family lives in a community where farming is the primary source of income for most of the residents and where peace and cooperation are present.  
	
Mr. A. has been working as a photographer for years and that has supported the daily needs of his family.  He came up with this kind of business since he had the skills in taking good photos and in making wooden frames.  Aside from that, he also does photo lamination upon request for his customers.  He became known in their community because of these skills.

He is asking for a P5,000 loan which will improve his business.  He will use this to purchase additional materials and accessories needed in his business.  He is also planning to buy a digital camera for a more convenient way to take photos once he has enough money to buy one.  Also included in his dreams is to have his own motorcycle so he can have something to use whenever he is required to take photos in far places where his customers asked him to go.

  
He has a lot of plans for his business but he must do it step by step and he believes that with faith, hard work and perseverance all will take place.  He is ready to sacrifice a lot for his family and for the education of his children.

loans.use: additional working capital (buy additional materials and accessories)

loans.name: Shaig

texts.en: Shaig was born in 1983. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, settled in the Masazir village of the Absheron region. He has been in this business for three years and now needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy the spare parts for improving his taxi business.

loans.use: to buy the spare parts

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region. He is now settled in Absheron region. He is a widower with six children. Ten years ago, he started taxi business and he now needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy spare parts. Ahmad was born in 1947.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
With his skills in carving and carpentry, Edgar started up his own furniture shop.  Since their community is situated in a mountainous place, soft woods which he used in making furniture are available.

For almost ten years in his business, he always makes his customers satisfied with his work.  Most of his finished products include wooden chairs, tables, cabinets, drawers, dining tables, living room show cases and other wooden sets. 

To further improve his business, he is hoping to borrow Php5, 000.00 as additional working capital.  He intends to buy soft woods, varnish, sandpaper that he needed in making furniture to meet the orders of his customers not only in their community but also in other places. 

According to Edgar, he considers every piece of furniture as a masterpiece of his skilful hands. He always gives his best to improve the quality of furniture he is offering to his customers.  He dreams that through his business, he can support the education of his four children until they reach college.

loans.use: Additional working capital (buy soft woods, varnish, sand paper)

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en: Vusal has been in production of kapron (a flexible and strong polyamide) piping for three years. He was born in 1977. Vusal lives in Absheron region. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy the materials for production of kapron piping.

loans.use: to buy materials for production of kapron piping

loans.name: Elciline

texts.en:
Elciline, 24 years old and married with three children, lives in the small village of Lullutan ILagan, Isabela, where boats are the primary mode of transportation in reaching their community. She sells processed meat products such as “longganiza” (ground pork meat) and hotdogs house-to-house while her husband, Ferdinand, a helper in a corn trading centre, assists her in raising their family.  

Elciline is requesting a loan in order to purchase more food stocks including bacon, ham, and chicken, all of which will eventually increase her sales and income. In the future, she plans to start her own small sari sari store (community based variety store) so that she can sell various commodities which will give her more income.

With the needed capital to develop her business, coupled with a simple way of life, dedication in raising their children, respect for others and the support of her loving husband, Elciline envisions all of her children finishing college.

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs for her business.

loans.name: Bernardo Botão

texts.pt:
Bernardo Botão Mussamira Pamue é natural da Beira  província de sofala, tem 45 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de 4 filhos com idade entre 16, 14, 9 e 4 anos respectivamente. Alem dos filhos sustenta os pais enviando dinheiro mensalmente.

Bernardo estudou até 10ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras, em 1982 mudou se da província de Sofala para Maputo para continuação dos estudos no instituto agrário da Namaacha, onde por motivos financeiros não conseguiu tendo sido admitido com trabalhador como ajudante mecânico, hoje trabalha como mecânico motorista neste instituto. Com um horário das 7:30 as 15:30h tem um salário mensal de 2400,00mt.

Para Bernardo este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, onde os primeiros foram dos seguintes montantes 6000,00mt e 10000,00mt respectivamente. Não tem empregado. Assim Brnardo pretende pagar antes do tempo regulamentado para solicitar outro para dar continuidade com a obra.
texts.en:
Bernardo Botão Mussamira Pamue is from Beira, a province of Sofala, is 45 years old and married with 4 children, aged 16, 14, 9 and 4. Apart from supporting his children, he also supports his parents, sending them money every month.

Bernardo was in school until 10th grade and left due to lack of financial means. In 1982 he moved from the province of Sofala to Maputo in order to continue his studies at the Namaacha Agrarian Instiute, which he didn’t manage to do, again due to lack of financial means. He joined instead as a mechanic’s assistant and today he works as a mechanic and driver at the Institute. He works from 7.30 am to 3.30 pm and has a monthly salary of 2400,00 MZN.

For Bernardo, this is his third loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva, the first two being for 6000,00 MZN and 10000,00 MZN. Bernardo intends to pay off the loan before it is due in order to request another one to continue the construction of his house.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of material for the contruction of his house

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Mrs. Elena M., married and gifted with two children, her youngest only three months old, has operated a sari-sari store (a community based variety store) for almost five years.  Since the income of her husband as a driver is not enough to sustain their basic needs, Elena started this small enterprise as a way of earning extra income. 
	
Elena is a member of a micro finance group with a 100 percent repayment rate, but because of the current economic crisis in the Philippines, she lacks financial support to make her business grow.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase additional stocks such as canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, detergent soaps and other commodities which are in demand in their village.  The loan will be of great help in achieving her business goal: to increase her income for better livelihood opportunities in the future. 

“Don’t lose your hope and keep believing in God’s power as you fulfill your dreams in life,” Elena added.

loans.use: To purchase additional commodities for her store.

loans.name: Ana Rita Azuel

texts.pt:
Ana Rita Azuel Chauge is a native of Chibuto, one of the districts of Gaza Province, in the south of Mozambique. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children aged 23, 20 and 17 respectively. She also supports a grandchild who lives with her.

Ana Rita studied through 12th grade and stopped due to issues she preferred not to reveal to our interviewer. Ana Rita has been an employee in the field of education for over 25 years, with a 7 am to 12 pm schedule. She lives in her own home.

This is Ana Rita's second loan with Hluvuku, and she has dreams o requesting a loan in the future to complete the construction and furnishing.

Ana appears in the photo with her grandchild.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Ana Rita Azuel C. é natural de Chibuto um dos distritos da província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, tem 43 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 3 filhos com idade entre 23, 20 e 17 anos de idade respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta um neto que vive com ele.

Ana Rita estudou até 12ªclasse e parou pelos problemas de carácter social quais não quis revelar ao nosso entrevistador. Ana Rita é funcionária da educação a mais de 25 anos, com um horário das 7:00h até 12:00h. Vive numa casa própria.

Para Ana Rita este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku, tem sonhos para futuro solicitar um empréstimo para finalizar a sua obra e mobilar.

Ana aparece na foto com a sua filha.

loans.use: Purchase of construction material for her home

loans.name: Azar

texts.en:
Born in 1973, Azar is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the town of Fuzuli in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He is now settled in Absheron region. He is married with two children. 

Four years ago, he started a business transporting goods with his car. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. is married and has 4 dependents. She has received schooling through junior high level.

Florence sells bags of mineral water in bulk to retailers, who then resell it to their customers in smaller quantities. She started doing this business not long ago. Her husband is a businessman. Florence uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's daily expenses.

Florence will use this loan to expand her business to include building materials. She will use the loan to purchase building materials for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Florence plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase building materials for resale.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana O. is married and has 2 children. She has received a junior high education and is responsible for taking care of her family's basic needs. Her husband is a fisherman.

Diana started her business not long ago. She sells foodstuffs such as rice and gari. Gari is made out of cassava only; the cassava is milled into dough and then the starch is extracted to reduce the starch content. The dough is then fried into gari, which is very popular in the country. Diana also prepares other food for sale. She does her business at Elmina.

Diana will use her loan to buy raw cassava for the production of gari and also to increase her rice sales. She hopes to save the new profits from her business for reinvestment.

loans.use: To buy raw cassava to produce gari and to increase her rice sales

loans.name: Gular

texts.en:
Born in 1980, Gular is a mother with two children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the town Fuzuli in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. She is now settled in Absheron region.
Four years ago, she started this business and now needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy goods.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
E. Mary is married and has 2 children. She has received a junior high education. Her husband is a teacher.

Mary sells groceries like biscuits, sugar, Milo, and milk at Elmina, a business she started not long ago. She is responsible for assisting her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more groceries for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into her shop.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is married and has 3 dependents. She has received a junior high education. Her husband is a mechanic.

Esther sells cooked food to her customers at Boatase near Elmina. She started selling cooked food not long ago. She is responsible for assisting her husband in providing the basic needs of their family. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients for preparing food to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business for reinvestment.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for preparing food to sell

loans.name: Yaa Asantewaa

texts.en:
Yaa Asantewaa A. sells clothing and fabric at Elmina. She has received a primary education. Yaa Asantewaa is a single parent with 4 dependents, and she is responsible for providing the basic needs of her family.

Yaa Asantewaa started selling clothing and fabric not long ago. Her loan will be used to purchase more clothing and fabric to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business into her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing and fabric to sell

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina N. is married and has one child. She has received a junior high education. Her husband is a trader.

Ernestina sells stationery supplies such as books, office supplies, and writing materials at Elmina. She started her business not long ago. She is responsible for helping her husband provide for the basic needs of their family.

Ernestina will use her loan to increase her stock of stationery supplies for resale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business into her shop.

loans.use: To increase the stock of stationery supplies for resale.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita Y. is divorced and has 2 children. She has received schooling through the primary level.

Rita sells red oil, tinned tomatoes, rice, and other foodstuffs at Elmina, a business she started not long ago. Rita uses her income to assist her husband in providing the basic needs of the family.

Rita will use this loan to purchase more food to sell. She plans to save the new profits from her expanded business for reinvestment.

loans.use: To purchase more food for resale.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina O. sells foodstuffs such as onions at a place popularly called Air Force, near Shama. Dina has received a junior high education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is an artisan.

Dina has been selling foodstuffs since 2006. She is responsible for assisting her husband provide for the basic needs of their family. Her loan will be used as additional capital to increase her food sales and to pay transportation costs. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her child's education.

loans.use: To increase her food sales

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is married and has 4 dependents. She has received a junior high education. Her husband is a military officer.

Grace sells charcoal, which is a popular fuel for those who cannot afford to buy gas. She sells the charcoal at a place popularly called Air Force, near Shama. She has been selling charcoal since 1994. She is responsible for paying the family's utility bills and other expenses.

Grace will use her loan to buy more charcoal for sale, since demand for it is very high. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to support her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale, since demand is very high.

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargiz was born in 1976. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Djabrayil region of Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. She is now settled in Absheron region. 

She has been in this business for two years and now needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy goods.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Maame Lolo

texts.en:
Maame Lolo H. is a widow with 9 dependents. She has received no formal education. Maame Lolo uses her income to pay her utility bills and the other expenses of her family.

Since 1991, Maame Lolo has sold corn at Adakope near Shama. She also prepares a local meal known as 'kenkey,' which is made out of corn. Kenkey is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country; it is normally eaten with hot sauce and fried fish. Maame Lolo also sells smoked fish.

Maame Lolo will use the loan to purchase more corn, both for resale and for the production of kenkey. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame Lolo plans to invest in her children's education and also save towards putting up a house for her large family.

In the photo, Maame Lolo is the lady in the green dress; the other person is a lady she has employed to assist her.

loans.use: To purchase more corn for resale and the production of kenkey.

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena H. sells charcoal and soft drinks at Adakope near Shama. Lena has received no formal education. She is married and has 6 dependents. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Lena has been selling charcoal since 2000. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees as well as the family's utility bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more charcoal for sale. Charcoal is a popular fuel for those who cannot afford gas, and demand for it is very high. She hopes to reinvest her new profits into her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more charcoal for sale since demand for it is very high.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina B. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through junior high level. Her husband is a military officer.

Faustina has sold used clothing at Takoradi since 2004. She uses her income to assist her husband provide for the basic needs of the family. Faustina will use this loan to increase her sales of used clothing. She plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business back into the business.

loans.use: To increase her sales of used clothing

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca S. is a caterer by profession. She has been selling cake and other pastries, along with maize and other foodstuffs, at Adakope near Shama since 1997. She buys maize in large quantities, re-dries it so that it does not get moldy, and then repackages it in sacks for resale.

A widow with two children, Rebecca has received a junior high education. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees and the family's utility bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to increase her food sales and to ease her transportation costs. Rebecca hopes to save the new profits from her business towards getting a warehouse for her goods.

loans.use: To increase her food sales

loans.name: Adugbe

texts.en:
Adugbe A. has been selling lobster, cassava, and corn dough at the Takoradi market since 1998. Cassava and corn dough are used in the preparation of a variety of foods in the country. Adugbe also sells smoked fish. Smoking is a way to preserve fish; smoked fish is much preferred among the Ghanaian communities because it can be kept for many days without having to be kept in a freezer.

Adugbe has received no formal education. She is married and has 4 dependents. Her husband is a mason. Adugbe is responsible for assisting her husband provide for the basic needs of their family.

Adugbe will use her loan to buy more corn and cassava to make into dough to sell, and to buy more fresh fish to process and sell. She hopes to reinvest her new profits back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more corn and cassava to make into dough to sell, and to buy more fresh fish to process and sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana A. sells chicken and frozen fish at a place called Air Force near Shama. She also processes some of the fresh fish by smoking them which is a form of preserving the fish to stay longer before going bad. Juliana has received junior high education and she is married with four dependents. Her husband is a military officer. Juliana has been selling chicken and frozen and smoked fish since 1990. She is responsible for assisting her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more stock for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards getting a piece of land to build a family house for the family.

loans.use: Juliana would like to buy more stock of chicken and fish to sell.

loans.name: Saudatu

texts.en: Saudatu A. is married and has four dependents. She has received no formal education. Saudatu sells a local porridge and doughnuts in the morning to those on their way to work in Kokompe near Shama, which she has done since 1998. Her husband is a commercial driver. Saudatu uses her income to assist her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Saudatu will use the loan to purchase more wheat, sugar and other ingredients for the food preparation. With the new profits from her expanded business, Saudatu plans to support in her children's education. At the time this picture was taken, her porridge had been sold and she had already packed her things and was about to leave.

loans.use: Saudatu will use the loan to purchase more wheat, sugar and other ingredients for the food preparation.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce Z. sells groceries like biscuits, sugar, Milo, milk and other food stuffs at Adakope near Shama. Joyce has received primary education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mechanic. Joyce has been selling groceries and food stuffs since 1998. She is responsible for paying the utility bills and other financial expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more groceries for her shop. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the expansion of the business.

loans.use: Joyce would like to buy more Milo, milk, sugar and other groceries for her shop.

loans.name: Gulbakh

texts.en:
Gulbakh (whose husband is pictured here) is a mother with four children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Gubadli region in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. She is settled in Absheron region. 

Her husband sells metal and has been in business for ten years. Now they need a loan of 970 AZN to buy metal for improving their business.

loans.use: to buy metal

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha B. sells groceries like biscuits, sugar, Milo, milk and other items at Adakope near Shama. Agatha has received junior high education. She is a single parent and has three children. Agatha has been selling groceries since 1998. She is responsible for providing the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used as an additional capital to increase the sale of groceries. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the expansion of the business.

loans.use: Agatha would like to increase the sale of groceries.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy A. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high. Mercy sells groceries like biscuits, sugar, Milo, milk and other items at Adakope near Shama, which she has done since 2002. Mercy uses her income to assist her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Mercy will use the loan as an additional capital to increase the sale of groceries. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mercy plans to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: Mercy would like to increase the sale of groceries.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther D. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high. Esther sells groceries like biscuits, sugar, Milo, milk and other items at Adakope near Shama, which she has done since 2002. Her husband is a military officer. Esther uses her income to assist her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Esther will use the loan as an additional capital to increase the sale of groceries. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esther plans to reinvest to increase sales.

loans.use: Esther would like to increase the sale of groceries.

loans.name: Júlia Ernesto

texts.pt:
Júlia Ernesto C.  nasceu no distrito de Boane, província do Maputo, tem 35 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 5 filhos, o filho mais velho tem 19 anos de idade, e mais novo tem 4 anos, para alem dos filhos sustenta a mãe enviando dinheiro mensalmente.

Júlia não estudou por falta de condições financeiras da família, desde a sua infância cresceu aqui em Boane e nunca mudou se e casou no mesmo distrito. O seu trabalho é negociante e dona do negócio, possuindo um pequeno estabelecimento comercial sita no mercado, a mais de 6 anos, abrindo das 7:00h até as 18:00h.

     Tem como produto principal a roupa usada, com uma receita mensal de 3000,00mt, consegue poupar algum no final de mês, este é o seu 5º empréstimo na HLUVUKU-ADSEMA e conhece através de suas amigas vendedeiras do mercado. Tem como sonho aumentar o valor da poupança para permitir investimento no melhoramento das condições habitacionais.
texts.en:
Júlia Ernesto C. was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo. She is 35 years old, married and the mother of 5 children – her eldest child is 19 years old and the youngest is 4. Aside from her children, she also supports her mother by sending her money every month.

Júlia did not go to school as her family did not have the means to send her and she grew up right here in Boane, having never moved and even getting married in the same district. She works as a trader and as a housewife and has owned a small commercial establishment in the marketplace for more than 6 years, open from 7am to 6pm.

Her main product is second hand clothing, which gives her a monthly income of 3000,00 MZN and allows her to save some money at the end of the month. This is her fifth loan with HLUVUKU-ADSEMA, which she knows through friends who are stall-owners in the market. She dreams of increasing her savings so that she can invest in improving her living conditions.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing more stock to be sold

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia D. sells charcoal which is a source of fuel for those who cannot afford to buy gas and she also sells soft drinks at a place called Air Force near Shama. Felicia has received primary education and she is married with one child. Her husband is a military officer. Felicia has been selling charcoal since 2001. She is responsible for paying utility bills and the financial expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more charcoal for sale since demand for it is very high. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: Felicia would like to buy more charcoal to sell since demand for it is very high.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace O. sells food stuff like rice at a place called Air Force near Shama. She also owns a grocery store. Grace has received no formal education. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a military officer. Grace has been selling groceries and food stuff since 1996. She is responsible for assisting her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used as an additional capital to increase the sale of rice and other groceries. And also to ease her transportation costs. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: Grace would like to increase the sale of rice and other groceries.

loans.name: Giyam

texts.en:
Giyam was born in 1971. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Gubadli region of the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He is now settled in Absheron region. 

Three years ago, he started an appliance retail business. Now he needs a loan of 500 AZN to buy home appliances to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy home appliances

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice A. is married and has four dependents. She has received no formal education. Beatrice sells fried fish to food sellers at a popular place called Air Force near Shama, which she has done since 1994. She has started selling clothing and footwear in addition to the fish she processes for sale. Her husband is a military officer. Beatrice uses her income to assist her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Beatrice will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to be fried and smoked. She wants to also invest in her now growing clothing business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Beatrice plans to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: Beatrice will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to be fried.

loans.name: Kwamena

texts.en: Kwamena A. is married and has three children. He has received schooling through junior high. Kwamena sells wood; he buys the raw timber and then cuts them into pieces for sale. He also uses some of the wood in making furniture at Atabatsi junction near Abura, which he has done since 2006. His wife is a trader. Kwamena uses his income to pay for his childrens' school fees, utility bills and other expenses. Kwamena will use the loan to purchase more wood logs for processing and also to buy tools and other implements to enhance the efficiency of his work. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kwamena plans to save towards building a house for the family. The machines at the background are the cutting and planing machines he uses.

loans.use: Kwamena will use the loan to purchase more wood logs to process and sell.

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en:
Vasif was born in 1982. He is single. This young man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Agdam region of the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He is now settled in Absheron region. 

Six years ago, he started a business selling building materials. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy additional building materials for sale.

loans.use: to buy building materials for sale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia A. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high. Lydia sells fabric and ladieswear at Abura market, which she has done since 2003. She is a seamstress who sews all kinds of traditional dresses. Her husband is a trader. Lydia uses her income to assist her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Lydia will use the loan to increase the sale of ladieswear and fabric like lining and other sewing materials to enhance the efficiency of her services. With the new profits from her expanded business, Lydia plans to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: Lydia will use the loan to increase the sale of ladieswear.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia A. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through the primary level. Lydia sells used clothing, towels and bed sheets at Abura market, which she has done since 1999. Her husband is a pensioner. Lydia uses her income to assist her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Lydia will use the loan as an additional capital to buy more bails of used clothing, towels, bed sheets and other items. With the new profits from her expanded business, Lydia plans to save towards building a family house she has planned to do with her husband.

loans.use: Lydia will use the loan to buy more bails of used clothing, towels, bed sheet and other items to resell.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort A. is married and has four dependents. She has received no formal education. Comfort sells coal pots which are used as a stove for cooking. She also sells aluminum pots and cake baking containers at Abura market, which she has done since 1990. Her husband is a security man. Comfort uses her income to pay for her childrens' school fees, utility bills and other expenses. Comfort will use the loan to purchase more coal pots and other aluminum containers for resale to meet its high demand in the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to reinvest to further expand the business.

loans.use: Comfort will use the loan to purchase more coal pots and other aluminum containers for resale.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia A. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high. Emilia sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market to sell. She also has a grocery store at tetermu near Elmina, which she has done since 2000. Her husband is in the fish business. Emilia uses her income to assist her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Emilia will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish for processing and resale. She also wants to invest in her grocery store by increasing stock. With the new profits from her expanded business, Emilia plans to reinvest for the further expansion of the business.

loans.use: Emilia will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish for processing and resale and to invest in her grocery store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth K. sells firewood which is a source of fuel to the majority of fishmongers. She also sells clothing at a tetermu near Elmina. Elizabeth has received a junior high education and she is married with three children. Her husband is a truck driver. Elizabeth has been selling firewood and clothing since 1998. She is responsible for assisting her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Her loan will be used to buy more firewood to meet the increase in demand. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a family house she has planned to do with her husband.

loans.use: Elizabeth would like to buy more firewood to meet the increase in demand.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. has been selling fried fish and yam at Tetermu near Elmina since 2003. Victoria has received Junior high education. She is a single parent with two children and she is responsible for paying her children's school fees, utility bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used to buy fresh fish and yams for frying and then resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in the expansion of the business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy fresh fish and yams for frying and then resale.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla A. sells groceries like biscuits, sugar, Milo, milk and others at Elmina new market. Priscilla has received Junior high education.  She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a businessman. Priscilla has been selling groceries since 2006. She is responsible for assisting her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of rice, tin tomatoes and other groceries. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the expansion of the business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more bags of rice, tin tomatoes and other groceries.

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es: La Sra. Johanna tiene 24 años de edad, casada y con dos hermosos hijos de 6 y 5 años de edad, uno de ello asiste ala escuelita del barrio, su esposo trabaja en un mercado de la capital que se llama mercado oriental en una ferretería propia, doña Johanna tiene una pulpería desde hace tres años, que inicio con dinero que su esposo le dio, con esta solicitud es la segunda en Afodenic lo cual va invertir inventario ya que tiene  pocos productos, su pulpería y desea comprar bastante productos de condimentos para sazonar la comida, para la época de navidad que los clientes requieren bastante para preparar la gallina. Alargo plazo es es ampliar su negocio vendiendo todos los productos, ropa y calzado, a si como dar educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Johanna is 24; is married; and has two beautiful children, who are 6 and 5. One of them goes to school in their neighborhood. Her husband works in a market in the capital, which is called the oriental market. He has his own hardware store there. Doña Johanna has had a grocery store for 3 years, which she started with money her husband gave her. This is her second loan with Afodenic, which she will use to invest in inventory since her store has few products. She hopes to buy a lot of condiments to season food for the Christmas season since her customers require a lot of them to prepare chicken. In the long term, she would like to expand her business to sell all types of products like clothing and shoes so she can educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase condiments and various merchandise to supply her store

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es: El Sr. Porfirio tiene 54 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama La primavera en la capital de Managua, casada y con dos hijos de 6 y 8 años de edad, que estudian la primaria en el colegio del barrio, don Porfirio tiene una pulpería que junto a su esposa la trabajan, tiene tres años de estar en las ventas que inicio con prestamos en banco comunales, don Porfirio es decapasitado y quien se encarga  de las venta es su esposa, con esta solicitud es la segunda en Afodenic lo cual es de gran beneficio ya que tiene tasas bajas de intereses, y también ha crecido en inventario, con el préstamo va invertir en productos varios para sastifacer a sus clientes, con nueva mercadería. A largo plazo es ampliar el negocio y dar estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Porfirio is 54 years old and lives in a neighborhood called La Primavera ("Spring") in the capital, Managua. He is married and has two children who are six years old and eight years old and they study at the primary school in their neighborhood. Porfirio has a general store that he works with his wife. They have been doing sales for three years and they got started with a loan from a community bank. Porfirio is handicapped and his wife is in charge of the sales. This will be his second loan from Afodenic, which is a great benefit to him since the interest rates are so low. With his loan, he is going to invest in various products to satisfy his clients with new merchandise. In the long run his goal is to increase his business and give an education to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy canned products and basic grains.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace D. sells groceries like biscuits, sugar, Milo, milk, and so forth at the Elmina market. Grace has received a university education.  She is single and has no children. Grace has been selling groceries since 2007. She is responsible for paying utility bills and other financial expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more rice, sugar, Milo, milk, and other items. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy grocery supplies

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba Y., a single parent with five dependents and responsibility for paying her children's school fees, utility bills and other expenses, received schooling through junior high. Since 1995, Aba has processed and preserved fish purchased from local fishermen and then sends them to the Elmina market for sale.

She is now requesting a loan to increase her capital to buy more fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to save towards getting a piece of land to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To increase her capital to buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba T., who has a junior high education, processes and preserves fish that she has purchased from local fisherman and then sends them to the Elmina market to sell. A single parent with seven dependents and responsibility for her children's financial needs, Aba has been operating this business since 1992. 

She is now requesting a loan in order to increase her capital to buy more fish to sell, and hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a family house.

loans.use: To increase her capital to buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Llinset Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Llinset tiene 43 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, casada y  tiene un hijo que que estudio una carrera técnica y es contador, doña Llinset es secretaria de ventas desde hace doce años que fue recomendada por una amiga  y esta en las venta de una ferretería. Tiene varios créditos en Afodenic, esta seria la tercera solicitud lo cual quiere pata infraestructura en la construcción de un cuarto para su hijo para que pueda tener privacidad, para esto tiene que comprar materiales de construcción como piedra, arena, cemento, hierro entre otros. A largo plazo es tener mejores ingresos `para abrir una cuenta de ahorro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Llinset is 43 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Memorial Sandino in the capital, Managua. She is married and has a son who studied in technical school and is an accountant. Llinset is a secretary of sales and has been for twelve years; she does sales in a hardware store and was recommended for the job by a friend. She has had various loans with Afodenic and this would be her third one. She wants it for constructing a room for her son so that he can have privacy. For this purpose, she has to buy construction materials like stone, sand, cement, and iron among other things. In the long run, she hopes to have a better income to open a savings account.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a room for her son.

loans.name: Flora Maria

texts.es: Doña Flora Maria, casada, pequeña productora del municipio de Nueva Guinea, sus hijos todos son mayores de edad los cuales la apoyan en las labores agropecuarias, cuenta con el apoyo de su marido para los gastos familiares, solicita financiamiento a AFODENIC para comprar un semental de mejor raza lechera, para así aumentar sus rendimientos productivos y el numero del hato ganadero y asó ayudar al desarrollo de la económia del pais; esta señora es una mujer trabajadora del campo, le gusta ser una mujer empresaria, también se dedica trabajo de costura, es una mujer lider en la comunidad, de buenas relaciones humanas con las personas que necesitan de ella,  en la actualidad tiene buen record créditicio ante la institución, y afirma que con el servicio brindado de la institución a mejorado sus condicones de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Flora Maria is married and a small producer in the municipality of Nueva Guinea. Her children are all grown and help her with her farming tasks. She has the financial support of her husband for the household expenses. She is requesting a loan from AFODENIC to purchase a stud (bull) of a better breed for dairy activities in order to increase her production and the number of cattle in her herd, as well as contributing to the country's economic development. This is a hard working woman from the countryside; she likes being an entrepreneur and also works as a seamstress. She is a leader in her community and has good relationships with the people that need her. Currently, she has a good credit history with the institution and affirms that with the service provided by the institution she has improved her family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Dominga Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Dominga tiene 41 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, su esposo trabaja  como guarda de seguridad y aporta  a los gastos de su familia, tiene tres hijos dos mayores de edad que se encuentran en Costa Rica trabajando para ayudar a sus padres y uno de 18 años de edad,  que esta estudiando la Sra. Dominga lleva un ciclo de ochos créditos en Afodenic lo cuales han sido de gran beneficios ya que ha podido hacer mejora a su casa. Su negocio es la venta de tortilla, frijoles molidos lo cual inicio con dinero propio, desde hace siete años, con el préstamo desea comprar materiales de construcción para embaldosar la sala de su casa y levantar la pared del porche. A largo plazo es poder captar otros clientes como restaurantes y poder mejorar el margen de ganancia
texts.en:
Dominga is 41 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Memorial Sandino in the capital city Managua. Her husband works as a security guard and helps with the household expenses. They have three adult children that are working in Costa Rica to help their parents, and one 18 year old that is a student. Dominga has obtained eight loans through Afodenic which have been of great use, since she has been able to improve her house. Her business is selling tortillas and ground bean, which she started seven years ago. With this loan she would like to buy construction materials to tile her living room and put up wall on her porch. In the long term she would like to gain more clients, such as restaurants, to be able to improver her profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purhase of construction materials to tile her living room and put up a porch wall

loans.name: Fabiola Del Socorro

texts.es: la Sra. Fabiola  tiene 35 años de edad, casada y con tres hijos de 12,14,17 años de edad,  los cuales los tres estudian, su esposo es miembro de la policía nacional de Nicaragua, el negocio de doña Fabiola  es en  ventas de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos algunos por encargos y siempre tiene mercadería, sus ventas son al crédito y al contado, ella inicio desde hace 20 años lo cual ha logrado mucha experiencia en las ventas ya que su madre vendía ropa y viajaba a honduras a comprar lo cual obtenía muchas ganancias, por la falta de financiamiento para la inversión y la inestabilidad política y económica de nuestro país enfrenta, eso ha impedido su desarrollo para crecer en su negocio, con esta solicitud es la segunda en Afodenic la cual va invertir en inventario de ropa y zapatos en bastante variedad para la temporada. A largo plazo es poder obtener más financiamiento que le permita capitalizarse y llegar a nuevos segmentos.
texts.en:
Fabiola is 35 years old, married and has three children of ages 12, 14 and 17, respectively, whom are students. Her husband is a member of the national police of Nicaragua. Fabiola's business is the selling of clothing, shoes and cosmetics, some by order but she always has merchandise and her sales are on credit and in cash. She started twenty years ago which has provided a lot experience in retail, especially since her mother sold clothing and traveled to Honduras to purchase it, which provided lots of profit. The lack of available financing for investment and the political and economic instability that Nicaragua faces has impeded ability to grow the business. With this loan, which would be her second from Afodenic, she will invest in inventory for her clothing and shoes, in sufficient variety from the season. In the long term she would like to obtain more financing that would allow her reach new market segments.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a variety of clothing and shoes for the upcoming season

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua E. sells foodstuffs like plantain, cassava, and tomatoes at Elmina. Efua has received no formal education.  She is a single parent and has 5 dependants. Efua has been selling foodstuffs since 1998. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees, utility bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business and to increase her income to enable her give a quality education to her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi B. sells clothing and fabrics at the Elmina market. Esi has received primary education.  She is married and has 2 children. Her husband repairs electronics. Esi has been selling clothing and fabrics since 2002. She is responsible for assisting her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Her loan will be used to as additional capital to buy more clothing and fabrics for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards getting a piece of land to build a family house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to as additional capital to buy more clothing and fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba E. is a single parent with four dependents. She has received no formal education. Araba sells a local meal popularly known as banku that is made out of corn. She serves it with fried fish and hot sauce. It is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country. Her business, which she has had since 2005, is located in Bantama near Elmina. Araba uses her income to pay for her children's school fees, utility bills, and other family expenses. Araba will use the loan to increase her purchase of maize, which she uses to prepare the banku, to enable her increase her production of the food for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to save towards getting a piece of land to build a family house for the family.

She was not preparing the food as at the time this picture was taken, so she was asked to demonstrate how the banku is prepare.

loans.use: To increase her purchase of maize.

loans.name: Walter Mauricio

texts.es: El Sr. Walter tiene 44 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Hialeah, don Walter se desempeña como fotógrafo profesional, es casado y su esposa vende ropa y cosméticos al detalle, le tiene tres hijos de 12,14 y 16 años de edad, los tres estudian y ayudan  a los oficios del hogar, don Walter se propone terminar de construir su casa, con este crédito es cinco lo cual ha sido de gran beneficio para las mejoras de su casa y brindarle mayor seguridad a su  familia, por falta de financiamiento no ha podido crecer en su negocio como debiera, el inicio tomando foto desde hace veinte años en la guerra de los ochenta que enfrentaba el país,  ya que trabajaba como fotógrafo de la contra revolucionaria, lo cual fue una  experiencia en su vida personal, ya que era arriesgado pero era su trabajo,   su meta en el negocio es obtener mayor  cantidad de clientes, y ofrecer sus servicios para poder obtener ingresos que puedan cubrir sus necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Walter is 44 years old and lives in a neighbourhood of Managua called Hialeah. Walter is a professional photographer; he is married and his wife sells clothing and cosmetics. They have three children aged 12, 14, and 16 years who are all students and help at home. Walter wishes to finish construction of his home with this, his fifth loan. He has used previous loans for home improvements and to provide greater security for his family. Because of a lack of capital, he has been unable to invest in his business as he would have liked. He started twenty years ago taking photos during the civil war in the eighties as he was working as a photographer for the counter-revolutionaries which was quite an experience as it was risky, but it was his work. His goal in business is to gain more clients and offer his services, so that he can make enough money to meet the needs of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to plaster and repair his home.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. sells fish which she buys from fishermen and brings home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at the fisheries at Elmina. Efua has received junior high education.  She is married and has 3 dependants. Her husband owns a fishing boat which he gives out on a rental basis. Efua has been selling fish since 1995. She is responsible for assisting her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more fish for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a family house which she has planned to do with her husband.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
La Sra. Melania tiene 44 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Edgar Mungia, en la capital de Managua,  es casada, su esposo es pacificador lo cual entre ambos trabajan para desarrollar su negocio, tiene dos hijas de 
15 y 17 años de edad, que están cursando sus estudios, ellas también apoyan en el negocio de sus padres ya que es su fuente de ingresos, doña Melania lleva dos años en la elaboración de pan lo cual esta actividad se hace en la habitación de su casa, tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio ya que anteriormente vendía ropa, cosméticos y prendas de plata que ha la vez lo hace por encargo. Pues esta es su quinta solicitud en afodenic lo cual ha sido de mucho beneficios, por que ha podido mantener su negocio, con este préstamo va invertir en materia prima para desarrollar mejor su capital y sacar mas producción de pan en variedad. A largo plazo es poder ser una panadería de prestigio y distribuir sus productos de variedad, por todo el territorio.
texts.en:
Ms. Melania C. is a 44-year-old woman who lives in a neighborhood called Edgar Mungia, in the capital city of Managua. She is marred, and her husband is a pastor, so they both work to develop their business. She has two daughters, ages 15 and 17, who are currently studying. They, too, help out with their parents’ business because it is their source of income. Ms. C. has been making homemade bread for two years. She has plenty of experience in business because she used to sell clothing, cosmetics and silver jewelry by catalog. This is her fifth loan request with Afodenic, which has greatly benefited her in helping her maintain her business. She will invest this loan in the materials needed to further develop her capital and yield a greater variety of bread. Her long-term goal is to make her bakery a prestigious one and distribute her assorted breads throughout the entire country.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to increase bread production

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: La Sr. Karla tiene 31 años de edad,  habita en villa reconciliación de la ciudad de Managua, es casada y concibió tres adorados hijos de 1, 9 y 15 años de edad, dos los tiene estudiando en una escuela del barrio. Trabaja de sol a sol con su esposo en ventas de hierro en su casa ya que es una forma de cuidar a sus hijos y trabajar. Inicio recogiendo aluminio, hierro y todo tipo de chatarra en la calle con carreta de caballo, ahora tiene una camioneta.
