Con la solicitud del préstamo va a comprar mas materiales para ofrecer a sus clientes siempre variedad ya  con esta solicitud es la novena, y ha sido de gran beneficio para su negocio.  Sus planes son tener una ferretería grande y fuerte en la venta de productos de construcción sobre la pista principal. Por medio de los préstamos de Afodenic lograra aumentar sus ventas y a la vez sus ingresos y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Karla is 31; lives in Villa Reconciliación in the city of Managua; is married; and has 3 children whom she adores, who are 1, 9, and 15. Two are studying in the school in the neighborhood. She works from sun up to sun down with her husband selling iron out of her home, so she can care for her children and work. She started by collecting aluminum, iron, and all types of scrap metal off of the street with a horse cart. Now she has a small truck. With the money from this loan, she is going to buy more materials to offer to her customers so she will always have a variety. This is her ninth loan, and the loans have been of great benefit to her business. Her plans are to have a large hardware store to sell construction products along the main highway. Through these loans from Afodenic, she will succeed in raising her sales and her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase iron materials

loans.name: Rosa Adela

texts.es: La Sr. Rosa tiene 44 años de edad, vive  en un barrio de la ciudad de Managua villa reconciliación, es casada, tiene cuatros preciosos hijos actualmente los  tiene estudiando. Los planes de D. Rosa son mejorar su vivienda y el nivel de vida que tiene actualmente. Desde hace seis años vende prendas y bisuterías en su casa. También tiene quiere aumentar sus ventas con nuevos productos y comprar un tramo en el mercado. Que  lograra gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic le brinda desea comprar  nuevos productos variados, para la temporada, como adornos, ropa y ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is 44; lives in a neighborhood in the city of Managua called Villa Reconciliación; is married; and has 4 precious children, who are in school. D. Rosa's plans are to make improvements to her home and the quality of life that she presently has. For six years, she has sold garments and imitation jewelry out of her home. She also wants to raise her sales with new products and purchase a stretch in the market. We hope that she will accomplish this thanks to the loans that Afodenic offers her. She hopes to buy various new products for the season, such as decorations and clothes to offer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to make improvements to her home and to purchase Christmas decorations to supply her business.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa G. se dedica al negocio de venta de alimentos los cuales los prepara ella misma en su tramo en el mercado Iván Montenegro de la ciudad de Managua. Gracias a sus esfuerzos ha logrado salir adelante llevando a cabo la tarea de mantener su humilde hogar de habitación.

Hoy en día ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito el cual le permita la compra de la materia prima para la preparación de los alimentos. Por esta razón espera que su crédito será otorgado y así mejorará su condición económica.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Gaitan sells meals that she prepares herself in her booth at the Ivan Montenegro market in Managua. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to stay afloat by carrying out the work needed to maintain her humble home. Now she is asking for the support of Ceprodel so she may benefit from a loan that will permit her to buy the raw material (ingredients) needed to prepare the meals. Because of this she hopes that her loan will be granted so that she will be able to improve her economic condition.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marcos Antonio F. P. tiene la edad de 38 años,  habita en el barrio Medardo Andino  ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa y cuatro hijos que son menores de edad y están a su cargo, sus planes para el futuro es darle mejor condición de vida a su familia, el cliente trabaja como ebanista en su casa  y tiene el taller con todos sus herramientas, tiene ocho años de tener este negocio, que con sus propios esfuerzos ha logrado, el solicita la cantidad de  C$ 6,000.00 córdobas  para invertirlos en una maquina para cortar y pulir madera ; para así poder trabajar mejor y obtener mas ingresos  y darles una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcos Antonio F. P. is 38 years old, living in the Medardo Andino neighborhood located in the town of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife and four minor children who are in his care. His plan for the future is to give his family a better living condition. The client works as a cabinetmaker in his home and has his workshop with all his tools. He has this business thanks to his own efforts, and has had it for eight years. He is asking for 6,000 cordobas to invest in a machine to cut and polish wood so that he will be able to work better and have more income so that he can give his family a better living condition.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a machine for his business

loans.name: Sofia Salvador

texts.pt:
Sofia salvador C. é natural de Boane um dos distrito da província de Maputo ao sul de Moçambique, tem 55 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 6 filhos com idades entre 30, 27, 24, 21, 18 e 14 anos respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta um neto que vive com ele na sua casa. Tem casa própria.

Sofia estudou até 4ªclasse e parou por falta de condições dado que perdeu muito cedo o seu pai. Sofia é trabalhadora numa associação chamada Gueguegue a 8 anos, desempenhando as funções de contabilista. Tem um salário mensal de 3500,00mt e também é comerciante com uma mesa movél.

Este é o 4º empréstimo na HLUVUKU-ADSEMA e primeiro no Kiva, onde os três primeiros todos aplicados na compra de material de construção foram de 8000,00mt; 10000,00mt e 15000,00mt respectivamente. Assim Sofia pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim de construir um estabelecimento comercial para inciar negocio de venda a retalho em instalaçoes melhoradas.
texts.en:
Sofia Salvador C. is a native of Boane, one of the districts of Maputo Province in the south of Mozambique. She is 55 years old, married, and mother of 6 children aged 30, 27, 24, 21, 18 and 14,. In addition to her children, she supports a grandchild who lives in her home. She has her own home.

Sofia studied through the 4th grade, and stopped due to losing her father very early and financial circumstances. Sofia has worked for an association called Gueguegue for 8 years, keeping its books. She has a monthly salary of 3500 meticais and is also a business woman with a street cart.

This is her 4th loan from Hluvuku-Adsema and the first on Kiva. Sofia's first three loans were all used for the purchase of construction material, and were in the amounts of 8000 meticais, 10,0000 meticais, and 15,000 meticais respectively. Sofia plans to repay before the loan is due in order to request another one. She would like to build a store to start a scrap sales business in a better facility.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Esperanza Veronica

texts.es: La señora Esperanza Pérez tiene la edad de 23 años habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla junto a su  padres, ella tiene un taller de costuras que con mucho esfuerzos de sus padres y hermanos ha logrado salir adelante, ellos desde hace 10 años se dedican a este tipo de negocio la mayor dificultad que tienen es la falta de financiamiento, de producción. Ella solicita un monto de C$ 10,000.00 córdobas para ampliar y comprar maquina industrial plana OVERLOT. Y así poder confeccionar faldas y blusas que entregan el mercado. Esta joven estudia en la universidad y con las ganancias y ayuda de su padre paga todos sus gastos universitarios.
texts.en:
Esperanza Pérez is 23 years old and in the Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood with her parents. She has a sewing workshop through which, with much effort from her parents and siblings, has been able to get ahead. They have been doing this type of business for ten years. The biggest difficulty that they have is the lack of financing for their production. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Córdoba to expand her business and buy industrial machines to be able to produce skirts and blouses to bring to market. This young women is an university student and with these earnings and the support of her parents she pays all of her school expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an "overlook" machine for her business

loans.name: Teodora Lucía

texts.es:
La venta de cerámicas es el negocio al que se dedica la señora Teodora G. en el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León. Es visitada todos los días por los clientes interesados en la compra de los productos de cerámica y por este motivo es un reto para la señora G. adquirir mayores cantidades de dichos productos para comercializarlos.

Con miras a crecer y desarrollar el negocio ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito con el cual comprar los productos debido a que si no lo hace, sus competidores tomaran ventaja y no podrá salir adelante. Es por esto que ella espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora G. sells ceramics in the Telica area of the city of Leon. Every day customers who are interested in buying her ceramic products come to her store. For this reason she needs to buy greater quantities of those products to sell them. With visions of growing and developing the business, she has come to Ceprodel to solicit a loan with which to buy necesary products, because if she doesn't do this, her competitors will have the advantage, and she won't be able to advance. Because of this, she hopes that her loan will be granted so she can continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ceramics

loans.name: Freddy Bayardo

texts.es: El señor Freddy Bayardo A.  tiene la edad de 36 años habita en Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, junto a su esposa, ellos no tiene hijos, la esposa de don Freddy trabaja como domestica en una casa particular, para ayudarle con los gastos de la casa. El señor tiene proyecto futuro para hacer su vivienda ya que ellos están en un cuarto que le dio su mamá de su suegra. Este señor trabaja como vendedor ambulante desde hace dos años, el solicita C$ 8,000.00 córdobas para comprar frutas y verduras el ya tiene un mercado definido el cual entrega su producto. La mayor dificultad es la falta de financiamiento.
texts.en:
Freddy Bayardo A. is 36 years old and lives with his wife in Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla. They do no have any children. To help with living expenses, Freddy’s wife works as a domestic in a private home. In the future Freddy hopes to get their own home, but for now they have a room given to them by his wife’s grandmother. He has worked as a street vendor for the past two years, and is requesting a loan of $425 (8,000 córdobas) in order to buy fruits and vegetables. As he already has a market for his produce, the major obstacle is the lack of funding.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: La señora Juana Maria A. B. tiene la edad de 28 años,  habita en el sector de los cocos ubicado en la Concepción, junto a su esposo  , el trabaja como transportista para ayudarle con los gastos de la casa , ella se desempeña como niñera en la embajada Americana desde hace tres años, esta señora quiere mejorar su vivienda ya que no tiene la división de los cuartos y también quiere poner piso en la parte de sala ; por lo cual ella solicita la cantidad de C$ 5,000.00 córdobas para mejorar su vivienda .Y cumplir con su sueños ya que tiene una hija de ocho años y quiere que la pequeña tenga su cuarto aparte al igual que ella .
texts.en:
Juana Maria A. B. is 28 years old, she lives in Los Cocos suburb in Concepcion, together with her husband. He works in transport to help with the household expenses and she's worked as a nanny at the American embassy for the last three years. This lady wants to improve her home as it's not divided into rooms and she also wants to lay a floor in the living room. For this she is requesting a loan of $5000 cordobas to improve her home. This will let her achieve her ambitions as she has an eight-year old daughter and she wants her to have her own bedroom separate from Juana's.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purcahse construction materials to divide her home into rooms, and to lay a floor

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Agustina P. se dedica a trabajar fuertemente para mantener a su familia y brindar las condiciones necesarias para el desarrollo de su pequeño hijo. Para esto ha iniciado la reconstrucción de su vivienda pero debido la ausencia del capital financiero ha detenido la obra y ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción.

Una vez que el crédito sea otorgado, la señora P. logrará mejorar su vivienda dándole mejores condiciones de vida a su pequeño hijo y a la vez protegiéndose de desastres naturales que dañen la vivienda.
texts.en:
In Somotillo municipality in the city of Chinandega, Agustina P. works hard to support her family and provide the necessary conditions for the development of her little son. For this reason she has started the reconstruction of her house, but due to the lack of financing capital she has halted the work and come to Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase the construction materials. Once the loan is granted, P. will be able to improve her home, giving better living conditions to her son and at the same time protecting him from the natural disasters that harm the house.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to improve her house

loans.name: Oscar Isabel

texts.es:
El señor Oscar M. se dedica al negocio de herrería desde hace 20 años en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica arduamente a esta actividad con el propósito de llevar a cabo su sueño de brindarle un techo digno a su familia ya que a través del  transcurso de los años su vivienda ha sido azotada por lo que ha requerido mejorarla.

Para llevar a cabo esta obra ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los materiales de construcción y de esta forma continuar con el mejoramiento de su vivienda para darle a su familia todas las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar M. has been a blacksmith for the past 20 years in the Somotillo area of the city of Chinandega. He puts much effort into his work with the purpose of realizing his dream of putting a proper roof over his family since over the years their home has broken down and requires much to be improved. To carry out this work, he has come to Ceprodel for a loan that will allow him to buy construction materials and continue with the improvements on his home so that he can give his family all they need for their development.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Rene Benito

texts.es:
El señor Rene Benito C. vive en el municipio de Somotillo donde labora fuertemente con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda ya que por medio del tiempo se ha venido deteriorando y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus tres pequeños hijos busca la manera de cómo invertir en su vivienda.

Para llevar a cabo la reconstrucción el señor René ha acudido a Ceprodel esperando que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta forma comprar los materiales de construcción como lo son arena, piedrín, cemento y zinc. Es necesario destacar que el señor C. es el único sustento de su hogar por lo que requiere de este préstamo con urgencia.
texts.en:
Mr. Rene Benito C. lives in the Somotillo area where he works hard with the purpose of improving his home, since over time it has been deteriorating. With the responsibility of caring for his three small children, he is looking for a way to invest in his home. To carry out the reconstruction, Mr. Rene has come to Ceprodel hoping that his loan will be granted to allow for the purchase of construction materials such as sand, gravel, cement, and zinc. It's necessary to emphasize that Mr. C. is the sole provider in his home, so he needs this loan urgently.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Sonia Juarez se dedica a la actividad económica de venta de diesel el cual los almacena en barriles y luego los comercializa en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Somotillo de Chinandega.

Con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus dos hijos y siendo este negocio el único sustento del hogar ella ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo proporcionado por Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado préstamos que los ha sabido invertir en la compra del diesel. Una vez más espera que su crédito sea otorgado para continuar con el negocio en su localidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sonia Juarez sells diesel which she stores in barrels and later sells out of her home in the Somotillo area of Chinandega. With the responsibility of taking care of her two children and with this business being the household's only source of income, she has been able to advance thanks to the support of Ceprodel, which has granted her loans that she has used to purchase diesel. Once more she hopes that her loan will be granted to continue the business in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of diesel

loans.name: Khagani

texts.en:
Khagani was born in 1981. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Djabrayil region of the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He is now settled in Absheron region. 

He has been in the business of house repair for three years. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy the necessary things for repairing homes.

loans.use: to buy necessary things for house repair

loans.name: Khatira

texts.en:
Khatira is the mother of three children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Kalbadjar region of the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. She is now settled in Khirdalan settlement. 

Four years ago, she started this business and now needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy foodstuffs to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Melda Pinto

texts.pt:
Melda Pinto N. natural de Manjacaze província de Gaza, tem 49 anos de idade, casada maritalmente  e mãe de 6 filhos com idade entre 28, 26, 24, 21, 16 e 13 anos de idade respectivamente. Apenas dois que ainda são estudantes. Vive numa casa própria no bairro Campoene.    

Melda estudou até 5ªclasse e parou por ter ficada grávida,  em 1977 mudou se da província de Gaza para Maputo no Distrito de Boane sozinha para viver com o seu tio que se encontrava em missão de serviço.

Melda vive de negocio, onde pede empréstimo na Hluvuku pela terceira vez e primeira no Kiva. Pretende com estes 15000,00mt aumentar a mercadoria de forma a responder a procura nesta quadra festiva que se avizinha do fim do ano. E pretende pagar antes do tempo previsto para solicitar outro afim de melhorar a sua casa. 

Melda aparece na foto com seu empregado.
texts.en:
Melda Pinto N. is a native of the Manjacaze province of Gaza. She is 49 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children with ages 28, 26, 24, 21, 16, and 13 respectively. Only two children are still students. She lives in her own home in the Campoene district. Melda attended school until the 5th grade and stopped because she was pregnant. In 1977 she moved from the province of Gaza to Maputo in the district of Boane to live with her uncle who was on a service mission. Melda lives off her business where she is soliciting a loan from Hluvuku for the third time and the first time from Kiva. With this 15,000MT she intends to increase her mechandise to repond to the demand during the festive season that is approaching at the end of the year. She intends to pay before maturity so she can solicit another loan to improve her home. Melda appears in this photo with her employee.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sell a variety of products

loans.name: Catarina Rossana

texts.pt:
Catarina Rossana S. é natural de Xinavane distrito de Manhiça, tem 45 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 3 filhos com idade entre 29, 27 e 25 anos respectivamente, ninguém estuda. Para alem dos filhos sustenta enteados. 

Catarina estudou até 7ªclasse, em 1978 saiu de Xinavane para Boane por missão de serviço, trabalha como auxiliar no instituto pedagógico de Umbeleze em Boane a 25 anos, tem um horário das 6:00h as 14:00h, com um salário mensal de 2000,00mt.

Para Catarina este é o quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva nunca teve noutras instituições, os três primeiros destinou para compra de material de construção nos montantes seguintes; 10000,00mt; 7000,00mt e 15000,00mt respectivamente. Com este valor de 20000,00mt pretende dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. E pretende pagar antes do tempo regulamentado para solicitar outro afim de construir o muro de vedação. 

Catarina aparece na foto com o seu marido.
texts.en:
Catarina Rossana S. is a native of the Xinavane district of Manhiça. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children with ages 29, 27, and 25 respectively. None of them are students. Besides her children she also supports stepchildren. Catarina attended school until the 7th grade. In 1978 she left Xinavane for Boane for a service mission. She has worked as an assistant in the Pedagogical Institute of Umbeleze in Boane for 25 years. She works from 6:00am to 2:00pm with a monthly salary of 2,000MT This is Catarina's fourth loan with Hluvuku and the first with Kiva. She has never had loans with other institutions. The first three loans were used to purchase construction materials in the following amounts: 10,000MT, 7,000MT, and 15,000MT respectively. With this loan of 20,000MT she intends to continue the construction of her home. She intends to pay off this loan before the term so she can solicit another loan to build a wall around her home. Catarina appears in this photo with her husband.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase construction materials

loans.name: Manuel Isabel

texts.pt:
Manuel Isabel M. é natural da cidade de Maputo e tem 31 anos de idade, solteiro para alem da sua pessoa ajuda alguns familiares enviando genros alimentícios, neste momento trabalha como agente de lei e ordem (policia). Desde a sua infância viveu na cidade de Maputo tendo passado para Boane em missão de serviço. Onde trabalha das 7:30h as 15:30h.

Manuel para alem de ser policia é comerciante, dedicando se a venda de material de construção com destaque o cimento. Que compra o saco por 250,00mt e vende por 280,00mt. Onde tem um rendimento diário entre 3000,00mt e 4000,00mt. Onde exerce com apoio de um empregado. Vive numa casa própria.

Para Manuel este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, assim Manuel tem sonhos futuros a conclusão da sua obra e concorrer para ingressar na Universidade.
texts.en:
Manuel Isabel M. is a native of the city of Maputo and is 31 years old. He is single, and besides himself he helps family sending necessities to his sons-in-law. Right now he works as a police officer. Since his infancy he has lived in the city of Maputo having passed to Boane on a service mission. He works from 7:30am to 3:30pm. Manuel, besides being a police officer, is also a trader dedicated to selling construction materials, mostly cement. He purchases a sack for 250MT and sells it for 280MT. He has a daily income between 3,000MT and 4,000MT. He works with the help of one employee. He lives in his own home. This is Manuel's second loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. Manuel has a dream to finish his work and compete to attend the university.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and sale of construction materials

loans.name: Virgínia Benxane

texts.pt:
Virgínia Benxane X. é natural de Namaacha um dos distritos da província do Maputo, tem 31 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 4 filhos com idade entre 17, 15, 12 e 10 anos de respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta três sobrinhos que vive com eles na sua casa.

Virgínia é estudante da 6ªclasse curso nocturno, em 1980 mudou se do distrito de Namaacha para Boane na companhia da sua família. Virgínia é comerciante desde 1990, é dona do negocio com um estabelecimento que abre as 7:00h e fecha as 22:00h. onde vende com destaque os refrigerantes a cerveja compra a caixa por 230,00mt e vende a 300,00mt e o refresco compra a caixa por 184,00mt e vende por 240,00mt. Assim consegue um rendimento mensal de 6000,00mt e poupa 1000,00mt.

Para virgínia este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku  e primeiro no Kiva, o primeiro foi de 30000,00mt e o segundo de 15000,00mt ambos aplicados na compra dos produtos, este também pretende aumentar o estoque de forma a responder da melhor maneira a procura na quadra festiva que se avizinha do fim do ano.

Assim virgínia futuramente pretende iniciar outro tipo de actividades de rendimento alongo prazo que será de compra de 10 cabeças de gado bovino para criação. Virgínia aparece na foto com seus sobrinhos.
texts.en:
Virgínia Benxane X. is a native of namaacha, one of the districts of the province of Maputo. She is 31 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children with ages 17, 15, 12, and 10 respectively. Besides her children she also supports 3 nephews who live with them in their home. Virgínia is attending night school in a 6th grade course. In 1980 she moved from the district of Namaacha to Boane in the company of her family. Virgínia has been a merchant since 1990. She is the owner of a business with an establishment that opens at 7:00am and closes at 10:00pm. Her best products are refrigerated beer that she purchases for 230MT per box and sells for 300MT and refreshments that she buys for 184MT and sells for 240MT. She is able to achieve a monthly income of 6,000MT and saves 1,000MT. This is Virgínia's third loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. The first loan was for 30,000MT, the second was for 15,000MT, and both were applied to the purchase of products. This loan is also intended to increase her stock enough to respond to the demand from the holiday season that is approaching at the end of the year. In the future Virgínia intends to iniciate other types of income activities such as purchasing 10 head of cattle to raise. Virgínia appears in this photo with her nephews.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of a variety of products

loans.name: Maria Alberto

texts.pt:
Maria Alberto P.  nasceu na província de Inhambane, uma das província do sul de Moçambique, tem 37 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de um filho de 20 anos de idade, vive numa casa própria. Para alem do seu filho sustenta uma irmã enviando dinheiro mensalmente. 

Maria estudou até 3ª Classe, parou por falta de condições dado que perdeu os pais muito cedo e foi obrigada a viver com terceiros dai que saiu da província de Inhambane para Maputo no distrito de Boane na companhia do seu tio.

Maria vive de negocio onde exerce esta actividade a mais de 15 anos, tendo um estabelecimento, qual abre as 8:00h e fechas as 18:00h, tem como principais produtos os vinhos. Onde faz compras na cidade.

Para Maria este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, onde os dois primeiros foram de 8000,00mt e 10000,00mt respectivamente. Tem como planos para o futuro solicitar um empréstimo para a construção de  cozinha.
texts.en:
Maria Alberto P. was born in the province of Inhambane, one of the provinces in the south of Mozambique. She is 37 years old, married, and the mother of one son who is 20 years old. She lives in her own home. Besides her son she supports her sister and sends money to her every month. Maria studied until the 3rd grade and stopped because of poor conditions given that she lost her parents very early and was obliged to live with others. She left the province of Inhambane for Maputo to live in the district of Boane in the company of her uncle. Maria lives off her business which she has had for more than 15 years. She has an establishment that opens at 8:00am and closes at 6:00pm. She sells primarily wine. She makes her purchases in the city. This is Maria's third loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. The first two were for 8,000MT and 10,000MT respectively. She has plans for the future to solicit a loan so she can construct a kitchen.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various products

loans.name: Gina Moises Sitoe

texts.pt:
Gina  Moises Sitoe A.  é natural do distrito de Chibuto província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, tem 38 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de 4 filhos com idade entre 20, 14, 10 e 1 ano respectivamente, para alem dos filhos sustenta a sua sogra e sua mãe enviando dinheiro mensalmente.

Gina estudou até 9ªclasse e parou por ter ficado doente por muito tempo, em 1974 mudou se da província de Gaza para Maputo,  para continuar com os estudos e aos 20 anos se casou dai mudou da cidade para distrito de Boane na companhia do marido que é militar e assim vive na casa do estado afecta ao marido.

Gina é negociante, qual possui um estabelecimento comercial cita dentro do mercado municipal de Boane, dona do negocio e trabalha sozinha, o negocio consista na venda de roupa usada, onde tem um rendimento diário aproximadamente 700,00mt.

Para Gina este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, e sempre aplicou o empréstimo na compra de mercadoria para aumento do seu estoque. Para ela é um negocio rentável assim o sonho é melhorar cada vez mais.
texts.en:
Gina Moises Sitoe A. is from Chibuto district, Gaza province, in the south of Mozambique. She is 38, married, and the mother of four children, aged 20,14, 10, and 1. Besides her children, she supports her mother-in-law and her mother, sending them money monthly. Gina studied till 9th grade and stopped due to extended illness. In 1974 she moved from Gaza province to Maputo to continue her studies. When she was 20, she married and moved from the city to Boane district in the company of her husband. He is in the military, and so they live in a house provided by the state. Gina is a businessperson and owns a commercial establishment located in the Boane town market. She works alone. The business consists of the sale of used clothes. The business makes approximately 700 meticais a day. For Gina, this is her third loan from Hluvuku and her first from Kiva. She has always applied her loans to the purchase of merchandise to increase her stock. For her, it's a profitable business, and it's her dream to continually improve it.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of used clothing

loans.name: Murvat

texts.en: Murvat was born in 1959 and lives in Baku city. This kind man is married and has three children. Murvat is a metal turner who makes bolts, screws, and nuts. He has been in this business for 10 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy necessary items to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy necessary items to improve his business

loans.name: Salomão Alberto

texts.pt:
Salomão Alberto G. é natural do Distrito de Namaacha um dos distrito da província do Maputo que faz fronteira com a Suazilândia, é maior de 50 anos de idade, casado maritalmente com 2 esposa e mãe de 15 filhos já maior de idade quase todos apenas 3 que ainda vivem com ele e vão a escola, para alem desse vive com dois netos e sub suas responsabilidades.

Salomão estudou até 4ªclasse e parou porque naqueles tempo os colonos não deixava estudar mais que isso excepto algumas zonas, também pela condição social que tinha viu se obrigado a procurar emprego para o seu sustento. Desde a sua infância nunca mudou se da cidade.

Salomão é reformado e dedica se a agricultura de subsistência familiar desde 1990, tem um empregado, onde pratica monocultura ( o Repolho), tem uma pensão mensal de 1280,00mt. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, o primeiro foi de 10000,00mt e destinou na compra de insumos agrícolas que são adubos de forma a produzir um repolho de qualidade.

Salomão pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro empréstimo afim de abrir outra machamba de forma a diversificar as culturas.
texts.en:
Salomão Alberto G. is from Namaacha district, one of the districts of Maputo province that is on the frontier with Swaziland. He is over 50 years old, married, with two wives and fifteen children. Most of his children are already grown; only three still live with him and go to school. Besides these children, he lives with and is responsible for two grandchildren. Salomão studied until 4th grade and stopped because at that time, they were not allowed further study, except in some zones. Also, because of his living conditions, he felt obligated to look for employment to support himself. Since his childhood, he has never moved Namaacha. Salomão has worked in subsistence agriculture since 1990. He has one worker and grows a single crop, cabbage. He receives a monthly pension of 1280 meticais. This is his second loan from Hluvuku and his first from Kiva. The first loan was for 10000 meticais and went to buying agricultural inputs--fertilizers to grow quality cabbage. Salomão plans to repay his loan ahead of time in order to apply for another loan for opening another small farm to diversify his crops.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural inputs

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en: Vugar was born in 1987 and lives in Baku city. He is single. He has been in the business of selling music discs for a year. Now Vugar needs a loan of $625 to buy more discs to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy music discs to sell

loans.name: Venâncio Bernardo

texts.pt:
Venâncio Bernardo M. é natural da cidade da Matola um dos distritos urbanos da província do Maputo, tem 28 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos com idade entre o primeiro com 6 anos e o segundo com 2 anos de idade respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta os seus pais que vive com eles.

Venâncio é estudante da 11ªclasse tempo nocturno e durante o dia dedica se ao negocio de vende de artigos de fabrico caseiro e géneros alimentícios até refrigerantes. Onde destaca a Cerveja nacional que adquira a caixa por 230,00mt e vende por 300,00mt e o refresco também nacional que compra a caixa por 184 e vende por 240,00mt. Assim tem um rendimento diário de 600,00mt e consegue poupar algum no final de mês.

Para venâncio este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, onde os primeiros foram de 10300,00mt e 10300,00mt respectivamente e todos aplicados neste negocio, assim este também vai aplicar na compra de produtos para  melhor responder a demanda nesta quadra festiva que se avizinha do fim do ano. 

Venâncio tem pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro empréstimo para abrir um negocio tipo Teka Way.
texts.en:
Venâncio Bernardo M. is from the city of Matola--one of the urban districts of the Maputo province. He is 28 years old, married and has 2 sons--ages 2 and 6 respectively. Besides his children, he also supports his parents who live in the same house. Venancio is attending the 11th grade; he goes to school in the evenings, and he works selling home-made articles and food, including sodas, during the day. Two of the more profitable items are domestic beer--a box can be purchased for 230,00mt and sold for 300,00mt, and a national brand of juice that is purchased for 184,00mt a box and sold for 240,00mt. Daily, this generates an income of 600,00mt which he is able to save a portion of. This will be his third loan from Hluvuku and his first through Kiva; the first two loans were both in the amount of 10300,00mt, and they were invested in the business. The new loan he is seeking will be used to purchase additional merchandise to meet end-of-the-year holiday demands. Venancio wishes to pay it off before its due date so that he can requested another loan that will be invested to set up a Take-Away business.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Product purchase and retail.

loans.name: Ruhin

texts.en: Ruhin has been in the tailoring business for 10 years. He is married and has three children. He was born in 1975 and lives in Baku city. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy cloth and other necessary items in order to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy cloth and other items to improve his business

loans.name: Rizvan

texts.en: Rizvan lives in Baku city. He was born in 1980. This single man has three years of experience in the business of selling fruits and vegetables. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy fruits and vegetables to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Angélica Bernardo

texts.pt:
Angélica Bernardo N. é natural de Maputo cidade, tem 38 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 2 filhos, com idade entre 16 o primeiro e 13 anos o segundo. Apenas sustenta os filhos. Angélica estudou até 5ªclasse e parou quando ficou grávida, situação que lhe obrigou ir ao lar, sempre viveu na mesma cidade e com próprios pais só mudou de família quando foi ao lar.

Angélica vive de negocio que consiste na compra de fardos de sapatos usados e revendendo a retalho, é dona do negocio e tem uma empregada, onde exerce este trabalho a mais de 15 anos, compra o fardo por 3800,00mt com mais de 50 pares e vende por 350 o par de sapato. Tem um rendimento diário de 2500,00mt a 3000,00mt.

Para angélica este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva assim pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim de acelerar as obras de construção da casa para os filhos e aumentar cada vez mais o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Angélica Bernardo N. is from the city of Maputo. She is 38 years, widow and mother of 2 sons (13 and 16 years old respectively) whom she supports. Angelica attended school up until the 5th grade only because she got pregnant and had to move to her own place. She always lived in the same city with her parents before getting pregnant. Angelica makes her living purchasing bales of used shoes and selling them at retail prices; she has one employee, and she has been in business for over 15 years. These bales are purchased for 3800,00mt each; they contain 50 pairs of used shoes, and each pair can be sold for 350,00mt. Everyday she might earn between 2500,00mt and 3000,00mt. This will be the first time Angelica is requesting a loan fro Hluvuku and Kiva. She wishes to pay it back early so that she can apply for a second loan that will be used to speed up construction of her house to better accommodate her kids, and to further expand her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of used shoes.

loans.name: Virgínia João

texts.pt:
Virgínia João H. é natural de Maputo e tem 36 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de um filho com 6 anos de idade, alem do seu filho sustenta também a sua mãe e sua irmã que vive com elas.

Virgínia estudou ate 8ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras para custear os seus estudos, situação criada pela morte do seu pai e ela ainda era muito nova, em 1997 casou se com o marido que veio a perder vida em 2007.

Virgínia vive de negocio que consiste na venda de frangos e miudezas, é dona de negocio  faz sozinha nao tem empregada. Onde destaca as miudezas que adquira a embalagem por 80 rands(200,00mt) e vende por 420,00mt, com isso tem um rendimento mensal de 10000,00mt. Para viirginia este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, onde o primeiro foi de 15000,00mt e aplicou neste negocio.

Assim constitui grandes sonhos para virgínia o melhoramento das condições habitacionais da família e crescer mais o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Virgínia João H. is from the city of Maputo. She is 36 years old, a widow and mother of a 6 year-old son. Also living with her are her mother and a sister - she provides for both of them as well. Her father's passing when she was very young created financial difficulties for the family, and Virginia had to drop out of the school while on the 8th grade. Unfortunately, in 2007, after 10 years of marriage, she also lost her husband. Virginia makes her living by selling chickens, and a small variety of assorted articles, without help from additional employees. She is able to purchase these small articles for 80 rands (200,00mt) and sell them for 420,00mt, generating a monthly income of 10000,00mt. This is Virginia's second loan request from Hluvuku and the first through Kiva. She applied the whole loan amount of 15000,00mt from the first loan in her business. Ultimately, she wants to fulfill her dreams: make improvements to better accommodate her family and help her business grow further.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of chickens and small assorted articles.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida (her husband is pictured) was born in 1952. She lives in Baku city. She is a mother of 2 children. 5 years ago her husband started the taxi business. Now they need a loan of 500 AZN to buy spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Felicita Alberto

texts.pt:
Felicita Alberto T. é natural de Chiconela província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, tem 51 anos de idade, casada e mae de 4 filhos com idades entre 30, 29, 26 e 22 anos respectivamente. Apenas sustenta uma neta que vive com ela.

Felicita estudou até 10ªclasse e parou quando passou a viver longe da escola e havia falta de transporte, mudou se da província de Gaza quando concluiu a 4ªclasse e veio com a família para maputo, em 1978 casou se. Na suas andanças na vida trabalho numa ONG como auxiliar contabilista a 10 anos atrás.

Felicita vive de negocio de venda de carne, é dona do negocio a 7 anos, compra um kg de carne por 65,00mt e vende por 110,00mt , assim tem tido um rendimento mensal de 15000,00mt. Para Felicita este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva. E conheceu a através de amigas que eram clientes da Hluvuku.

Felicita tem planos futuros a construção de um talho e uma mercearia, dado que na zona onde desenvolve as suas actividades neste momento não existe nenhum talho.
texts.en:
Felicita Alberto T. is a native of Chiconela, a province of Gaza in the south of Mozambique. She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children with ages 30, 29, 26, and 22 respectively. She only supports her granddaughter who lives with her. Felicita studied until the 10th grade and stopped when she moved too far from school and did not have transportation. She moved from the province of Gaza when she finished 4th grade and came with her family to Maputo. In 1978 she was married. In her walk of life she has worked in an ONG as an assistant accountant 10 years ago. Felicita lives off her business of selling meat. She has been the owner of her business for 7 years. She buys 1 kg of meet for 65MT and sells it for 110MT. She has a monthly income of 15,000MT. This is her first loan through Hluvuku and with Kiva, and she was introduced to Hluvuku through friends who were already clients. Felicita has plans for the future to construct a butcher shop and a grocery store given that in the area where she conducts her activities no butcher shop exists today.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of meat

loans.name: Abulfat

texts.en: Abulfat was born in 1951. He is married and has three children. This kind man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, settled in Baku city. Five years ago, he started a taxi business. Now, he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Albertina José

texts.pt:
Albertina José M. é natural distrito de Zavala, província de Inhambane ao sul de Moçambique, tem 47 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 6 filhos, onde o mais velhos tem 31 anos de idade e o mais novo tem 12 anos de idade e estuda na 6ªclasse. Para alem dos filho sustenta dois netos que vive com eles.

Albertina Estudou até 6ªclasse e parou para ir ao lar dado que estava grávida, em 1976 vai a lar e para aumentar a renda da casa fazia pequenos negócios de vende de bebidas tradicionais ( fabrico caseiro)

Albertina vive de negocio a mais de 20 anos, onde neste momento dedica se a venda de frangos, qual adquira uma caixa de 12 frangos por 750,00mt e vende a caixa por 1000,00mt, não tem empregados. Vive numa casa própria. Este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva.

Albertina pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro empréstimo afim de melhorar as suas condições habitacionais.
texts.en:
Albertina José M. is a native of the district of Zavala in the province of Inhambane in the south of Mozambique. She is 47 years old, a widow, and the mother of 6 children. The oldest is 31 and the youngest is 12 years old and is in the 6th grade. Besides her children she also supports two grandkids who live with them. Albertina studied until the 6th grade and stopped to stay home because she was pregnant. In 1976 she went home, and to increase her household income she would transact a little business selling traditional drinks (home made). Albertina has made a living from her business for more than 20 years where right now she is focusing on selling chickens. She acquires a box of 12 chickens for 750MT and sells the box for 1,000MT. She does not have any employees. She lives in her own home. This is her first loan with Hluvuku and also with Kiva. Albertina intends to pay this loan off before the term so she can solicit another loan to use to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various products

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan H. is 26 years old, married, and has four young children, all under 8 years of age. Suzan and her husband live in a small hut with their children, her mother-in-law and father-in-law, and her husband's two young brothers who are still in school. 

The main source of income for the entire family is a small piece of land on which Suzan grows strawberries. Suzan’s husband works as a messenger in a mail office, but his income is not enough to feed and cloth the entire family. 

Suzan is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase additional strawberry seedlings in order to expand her farm and thus increase the income she contributes to support her family.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: Purchase  strawberry seedlings

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en: Zaur was born in 1975 and lives in Baku city. This single man plays a synthesizer, a business he started five years ago. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy the necessary instruments to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy instruments to improve his business

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en: Parviz was born in 1973. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli town in an Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, now settled in Baku city. He is married and has one child. He makes fireplaces and has been in this business for eight years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy necessary items for making fireplaces.

loans.use: To buy items for making fireplaces

loans.name: Shalala

texts.en: Shalala (her husband is pictured) was born in 1985. She and her husband have one child. Her husband has been in the taxi business for one year. Now they need a loan of $1200 to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en: Mubariz was born in 1969 and lives in Baku city. He is married and has four children. Ten years ago, he started a business selling foodstuffs. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy more items to sell.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Orudj

texts.en: Orudj was born in 1983 and lives in Baku city. He has been in the clothing sales business for a year. He is married and has one child. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Thavy's Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of six members, is located in Trapang Pring village in Kampong Chhnang Province and they plan to use the loan that they have obtained for various purposes. Mr. Thavy A. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land used to cultivate rice and earn income. As well as running this business, he is also a palm juice collector. His wife, Mrs. Let Phal Len, is a pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Therefore, Mr. Thavy A. decided to ask for a loan to buy two piglets to add to his wife’s breeding stock. He hopes to increase their income and improve his living conditions with this loan. Mr. Thavy A. does not have children.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. This system allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy two piglets to add his wife’s breeding stock.

loans.name: Pach

texts.en:
Mrs. Pach S. is a pig breeder and lives in Ang Kounh village in Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Sam Sarith, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he earns his living cultivating rice. Their family has little income to save and they cannot meet the needs of their family members.

Therefore, Mrs. Pach S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house. She is 34 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. Two of her children are attending the local school and the youngest is too young for studies. Her husband is shown on the right of this photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build her new house.

loans.name: Phang

texts.en:
Mrs. Phang N. is a farmer and lives in Ang Prasath village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Phang N. is 59 years-old and the mother of three children. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory and the third is a construction worker. Her husband, Mr. Sam Buth, is an invalid and cannot help support the family.

She owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her land is infertile, which has a negative effect on her crops. Mrs. N. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to improve her land and to make her crops more productive. She'll use the rest of the loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and a breeding cow

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Mrs. Run U. is a 54 year-old widow and lives in Ang Prasath village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Run U. has three children. Two of them are employed in garment factory while the third stays at home to do housework and help with the business.

Mrs. Run U. is a duck breeder. Because her business is going well, she wants to expand it. She would like a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: Buy more ducks for breeding

loans.name: Srey Neang

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Neang O. is a farmer and lives in Srae Boeung village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Srey Neang O. is 26 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband, Mr. Phoeng Horn, is presented on her right in the photo.

Mrs. Srey Neang O. owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband uses the rice to make wine for his business. The plot of land is infertile and she does not have oxen to plow the fields. Mrs. Srey Neang O. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her land. She will use the rest of the money to buy pesticides to protect her crops from insects.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pesticides and hire oxen to plow her fields

loans.name: Samkhann

texts.en:
Mr. Samkhann C. operates a motorbike taxi and lives in Ang Kounh village in Takeo Province. He is 28 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study. His wife, Mrs. Nuon Soka, is a hen breeder and appears on his left in the photo.

Even though they each run their own business, they can not support their household. Mr. Samkhann C. is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. He hopes this will increase the family's income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Tep P., 50, a widowed teacher who resides with her two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, typically makes about $8 a day from her teaching and selling products in the classroom. To defray living expenses, Tep is supported by her daughter, Tep Malyna, 21, who works selling groceries on the school campus and generally makes about $10 a day.

Mrs. Tep is now requesting a loan of $1200 to add more grocery items so that her daughter can attract more customers.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her daughter's business.

loans.name: Mrs. Youren Say Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Youren S. is the village bank president for eight members who all live in Preak Ta Ker village in Kandal province. She is 27 years old and she is single. She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates both rice and vegetables to earn a living.

Mrs. Youren S. has a problem because she does not have enough money to buy vegetable seeds. She is asking for a loan to buy vegetable seeds in hopes that she will increase her income and improve her living conditions.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term (EoT) loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Buy vegetable seeds

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea S., 60, is a widow and resides with five of her children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has a business renting rooms in her home to make approximately US$3 a day. To contribute to the daily expense, Chea S. is supported by four of her children who work selling rice and many kinds of food.

Chea S. is applying a loan of US$1000 to repair her home and add more rooms.

loans.use: To repair hotel and add more rooms.

loans.name: Sron's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sron C. is the team leader for three people who all live in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sokhon Mao, who is the group guarantor, is also presented in the picture with the group members.

Mrs. Sron C. is 27 years old and the mother of two children. The oldest child attends the local school and the youngest, who is two years old, stays at home. She and her husband, Mr. Thoeun Bunthy, are farmers who earn their living cultivating rice on a plot of land.

They face a problem because their land is infertile, which has a bad effect on the crops. To solve this problem, Mrs. Sron C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to improve her land and make her crops more productive.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until very end of the loan's term. End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to improve her crops

loans.name: El

texts.en:
El S., 64, is a true entrepreneur who has business as a tailor in his home. He resides with his wife and six children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He typically makes US$10 in revenue a day. His wife, Sem Mit, 53, works selling groceries from home and is able to generate about US$3 a day. Three of their children are students and the other three help in their father’s work.

El S. would like to take out a loan of US$500 to purchase another sewing machine for his business.

loans.use: To purchase another sewing machine.

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som N., 53, married and residing with her two children and husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, has a business selling many kinds of dried fish, eggs and sausage in the market. On average, she makes about $10 a day, while her husband works selling fruits, earning about $5 a day.

Som is asking for a loan of $1000 to add to her inventory of dried fish.

loans.use: To add to her inventory of dried fish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy more firewood to make palm sugar

loans.name: Hoy

texts.en:
Hoy S., 46, married and residing with his wife in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, is a security guard earning $3 a day while his wife, Rin Sotha, 44, sells clothing, making $10 in revenue a day. They have three children, two employed in a private company and one a student.

Hoy S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to add to Rin's clothing inventory in order to attract more customers. (Rin Sotha is shown in the picture.)

loans.use: To add to his wife's clothing inventory.

loans.name: Noeun's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Noeun K. is the group leader of four members who all live in Ta Sor village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mr. Noeun K. is 51 years old and the father of three children, two of whom work in different positions while the third attends the local school. His wife, Mrs. Vong Koeun, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice.

Mr. Noeun K. collects palm juice, which he processes into palm sugar and wine. He is having difficulty gathering enough palm juice because he does not have the necessary materials. To re-start his business, he is asking for a loan to buy a bamboo ladder that will allow him to collect juice from the top of the palm trees.

All the members who benefit from this village bank loan have end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan's term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Buy bamboo ladder to help collect palm juice

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel H. is a resident of Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 23 and has two children.  Her husband is a motorcycle driver and his work is their main source of income but is not enough for them. After one year of marriage, she joined Paglaum MPC in 2002 to acquire start-up capital of Php 3,000.00. Through the continuous education of PMPC, she enhanced her knowledge of “moron” (a native delicacy made of ground glutinous rice with coco milk and cocoa) and "puto" (made of ground rice with coco milk and sugar), but she had no start-up capital. As per records she has been a trusted borrower for almost 6 years.

With so much dedication, she sells her quality moron products to the passengers in the bus terminal of the town next to Plaridel and even in the nearby municipality. She has the passion to serve her customers' satisfactions. Because of this, the demand for moron products increases. In order to fulfill her orders, she needs to borrow additional capital of Php 10,000.00. She wants to help her community by hiring additional moron makers and purchase her own motorcycle so that she can prepare an education plan for her children.

loans.use: Purchase of glutinous rice, sugar, coconut, cocoa, and peanuts

loans.name: Arn's Group

texts.en:
This group loan which consists of five members is located in Sre Khtom village in Kampong Chhnang Province and they plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mr. Arn C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He has a threshing machine for his business. He now faces a problem because his machine is not running properly. In order to deal this problem, Mr. Arn C. decided to ask for a loan to repair his machine. His wife, Mrs. Aum Noeun, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Arn C. is 58 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is a construction worker while the other two are enrolled in the local school. 
All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to repair his threshing machine.

loans.name: Ida Ayu Ketut Priastini

texts.id:
Ida Ayu Ketut Priastini, nama ibu muda yang baru saja menikah diawal tahun 2008 ini, lebih akrab dipanggil Dayu, suaminya bernama Ida Bagus Komang Wardika. Usaha yang dijalani saat ini berjualan disebuah warung kecil yang terletak didepan rumah mereka. Warung ini adalah pemberian mertuanya yang sudah berjalan 30 tahun lamanya. Karena orang tuanya yang  usianya kini sudah lanjut dan tidak bisa lagi berjualan, maka usaha warung ini dilanjutkan oleh anak dan menantunya. Setiap hari Dayu mulai berjualan jam 7 pagi, setelah selesai memasak dan membersihkan rumah, dan akan tutup pada jam 10 malam. Dengan modal awal Rp. 500.000.- Dayu melengkapi warungnya dengan barang dagangan kebutuhan sehari – hari, seperti makanan ringan untuk anak – anak dan keperluan dapur. Sementara suaminya menjaga warung, Dayu kepasar untuk membeli bahan baku berupa aneka sayuran yang akan dipakai untuk membuat makanan tradisional yang disebut gado - gado ataupun dijual kembali. Dayu sangat ulet dan tekun sekali mengelola usahanya.  Keuntungan yang diperoleh dalam sehari rata Rp. 30.000.- yang hanya cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup sehari-hari.
             Dayu mengajukan permohonan pinjaman ketika Yayasan Dinari memberikan bantuan modal yang disalurkan melalui perkumpulan yang ada didesanya. Dengan modal yang akan didapatkannya nanti Dayu akan membeli lebih banyak lagi barang dagangan agar lebih bervariasi. Sekarang Dayu sedang giat-giatnya menjalankan usaha warung karena sampai saat ini belum juga punya momongan, namun demikian Dayu dan suaminya hidup rukun dan bahagia.
texts.en:
Ida Ayu Ketut Priastini or better known as Dayu, has recently got married to Ida Bagus Komang Wardika. They run a stall in front of their house. They inherited it from her Mother in Law who had run the shop for the past 30 years. Everyday Dayu starts her day at 7am in the morning by cooking and cleaning the house, and ends the day at 10 pm at night. With an initial capital of Rp. 500.000, Dayu stocks her stall with food and other items. While her husband watch over the stall, she goes to the market to get items needed to make a local delicacy called gado - gado. Dayu is very hardworking in making the gado - gado, her daily profit of Rp. 30.000 is only just sufficient enough to cover their daily expenses. Dayu hopes that with the financial assistance from Dinari, she can increase the variety of items sold at her stall.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stall's stock variety - Membeli barang dagangan untuk melengkapi koleksinya

loans.name: Mrs. Sokrey Choeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokrey C. is the village bank president of sixteen members who all live in Trapang Kor village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Sokrey C. is 34 years old and the mother of five children who attend the local school. Her husband, Mr. S. Sarath, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice.

Mrs. Sokrey C. owns a small store in the local market. Her customers make many requests for additional goods. To fulfill her customers' needs, she is requesting a loan to buy more groceries for her store.

This is a group loan, mainly consisting of end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially capable. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan's term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Ni Ketut Mariani

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Mariani adalah seorang Pengrajin Tenun yang sangat tekun. Mariani tidak pernah melewatkan waktunya untuk menenun setelah menyelesaikan pekerjaan rumah tangga mulai dari jam 6.00 wita sampai jam 11.00 siang. Sebelum menekuni kerajinan ini, Mariani juga pernah bekerja serabutan, mulai dari membuat jahitan ( Sarana persembahyangan ), jasa angkut kelapa bahkan pernah berjualan makanan keliling disekitar desanya dan sampai ke desa seberang. Tetapi karena terbatasnya modal yang dimilikinya, Mariani kembali menekuni usaha tenunnya, karena dirasa hasil yang didapatkannya lebih lumayan dibanding usaha yang lain. Dalam sebulan Mariani bisa menghasilkan 4 buah kain tenun dengan harga Rp. 600.000.- per satu lembar dengan keuntungan Rp. 100.000,- / bulan.
Hasil yang diperoleh dari keuntungan membuat tenun dipergunakan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Mariani merasa senang karena akan mendapatkan pinjaman modal dari yayasan Dinari yang disalurkan melalui lembaga didesanya. Dengan modal yang didapatkannya Mariani akan membeli lebih banyak lagi benang tenun yang beraneka warna agar hasil kainnya  lebih bervariasi.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Mariani is a hardworking weaver, she usually starts after completing her daily household chores at 6 to 11 in the morning. Before this, Mariani did other type jobs from being a seamstress, to selling food from town to town. However due to financial constraints, she return back to weaving cloth, because she profits from compared to her previous jobs. In a months she can make 4 pieces of cloth which can be sold for Rp. 600.000 and with a profit of Rp. 100.000. Earnings from this will be use to cover their daily expenses. Mariani, is happy because with the financial assistance from Dinari, she can increase her variety and quality of her cloths.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying thread and weaving equipments - Aneka jenis benang dan alat - alat yang menunjang usahanya

loans.name: Domingga

texts.en:
Mrs. Dominga A. lives in a small nipa (palm leaf) house in Barangay Danao, one of the depressed coastal areas in the Municipality of Plaridel. She was married as young as 16 years old and had three kids. Two of her kids worked at the fishing ferryboat, while the other one was disabled by polio and died when he was still young. In 2007, her husband died and she received a full insurance benefit from Paglaum MPC. 

Her main source of income is derived from the selling of fresh fish. Being a member in good standing, she always pays attention to her loans. She wants financial assistance amounting to PHP 13,000.00 for the purchase of a fishing net. Through this project, she dreams of obtaining additional income in order to repair her house and for their daily needs.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing net

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem M., 42, and her husband are farmers in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, growing rice and raising pigs on a plot of land behind their house. They have three children, all students. They started planting rice in 1999, and their output is just enough to support their family members. This couple grows rice twice a year, first during the rainy season, which requires six to seven months before harvesting, and second during the dry season, which requires three to four months.

Khem M. is now requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase fertilizers and good rice seed to grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and good rice seed to grow.

loans.name: Pum

texts.en:
Pum N., 29, resides with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, where they grow rice twice a year (during the rainy and dry seasons) and raise pigs on a plot of land behind their house. They have been in business for about 5 years, having learned how to farm from their parents, and on average make a combined income of about $3 of profit each day. This couple has one young child who is a student.

Pum N. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase fertilizers and good rice seed to grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and good rice seed to grow.

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Dendi

texts.id:
Diusia yang sudah lebih dari setengah abad Ni Nyoman Dendi, 55 tahun, masih saja tekun dan giat membuat sarana persembahyangan. Usaha ini dimulai saat Ni Nyoman Dendi sudah tidak menjadi pedagang hasil bumi. Ni Nyoman Dendi  dulu menjadi pedagang hasil bumi yang rute perjalanannya sampai ratusan kilometer setiap hari. Jenis dagangan yang dijual dari kelapa, pisang, sayur mayur, beras dan hasil bumi lainnya. Karena usia yang sudah lanjut, Ni Nyoman Dendi menghabiskan waktu menjadi pembuat dan pengepul sarana persembahyangan dirumahnya. Ni Nyoman Dendi juga membeli sarana persembahyangan ini dari para tetangganya  yang menjual  kepadanya dan akan dijual kembali ke pengepul yang lebih besar. Kurangnya modal yang dimiliki Ni Nyoman Dendi membuat usahanya tersendat-sendat.
              Tapi kini Ni Nyoman Dendi merasa lega dengan adanya bantuan pinjaman modal dari yayasan Dinari. Ni Nyoman Dendi berharap dari modal yang  diperolehnya nanti bisa memperlancar usaha yang  sudah dirintisnya selama  8 tahun. Keuntungan yang diperoleh tiap hari sebesar Rp. 30.000,-  dipergunakan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari, sisanya ditabung untuk masa tuanya nanti jika Ni Nyoman Dendi sudah tua dan tidak bisa berjualan lagi.
texts.en:
Even at the age of 55, Ni Nyoman Dendi is still hard at work to make praying items. She started this after she decided to stop working as a trader. She used to sell coconute, banana and other locally produced stuff, and need to travel up to hundreds of kilometers daily for this. Due to her old age, Ni Nyoman Dendi decided she would make Praying materials from her home. She makes and also buy from other housewives, which she would then later be sold to a local trader. Due to limited capital, she is facing problems. However with the help of Dinari, she hope that her 8 year old businees will grow. She earns about Rp. 30.000 which she saves for her retirement.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bamboo and Coconut leaves - Bahan baku berupa daun kelapa muda dan bambu

loans.name: Kloa

texts.en:
Kloa S., 61, lives with her husband and one child in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She and her husband grow rice twice a year, during the rainy and dry seasons, typically earning about $3 each day. Besides farming, Kloa also has a business weaving cotton scarves at home to earn an additional $3 each day.

Kloa S. is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase fertilizers and good rice seed to grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and good rice seed to grow.

loans.name: Desak Ketut Ratnawati

texts.id: Desak Ketut Ratnawati adalah seorang penjahit yang sangat terkenal didesanya. Desak Ketut Ratnawati berumur 33 tahun, sebelum menikah Desak memang seorang penjahit disebuah Garment yang cukup besar didaerah Nusa Dua – Denpasar – Bali. Karena hasil jahitannya yang rapi Desak diajak oleh temannya dan pindah ke Jakarta dan bekerja disebuah Butik. Ketika itu Desak baru berumur 21 tahun. Setelah kembali kekampung dan menikah dengan suaminya yang bernama Nengah Suparma, yang bekerja sebagai seorang tukang ukir. Desak mempunyai seorang anak yang kini duduk dibangku SD. Dengan keahlian yang dimilikinya, Desak membuka usaha tersebut dirumahnya. Namun, karena keterbatasan dana, usahanya belum bisa berkembang karena Desak tidak bisa memenuhi pesanan pelanggan. Desak merasa sangat antusias ketika yayasan Dinari memberikan bantuan pinjaman modal usaha. Desak berharap bisa mandapatkan bantuan tersebut yang nantinya akan dipergunakan untuk membeli bahan-bahan untuk keperluan menjahit. Modal yang dimiliki dipergunakan untuk membeli mesin jahit yang harganya Rp. 500.000.- Desak tinggal disebuah rumah semi permanen yang kecil, tetapi hidup mereka  bahagia.
texts.en:
Desak Ketut Ratnawati is a famous tailor at her town, age 33 before being getting married she was a tailor at a Garment factory in Nusa Dua – Denpasar – Bali. When she was 21, and with the invitation from her friend, she moved over to Jakarta to work in a boutique. Upon returning to her home town, she got married to Nengah Suparma who is a wood smith. She has a child who is still studying. Due limited capital, her business stop growing. She was delighted when she receives Dinari's financial asistance, with the capital she will buy a sewing machines as well as sewing materials. Even though they live in a semi permanent house, but they live happily.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Thread, cloths and other sewing materials - Benang, kain dan alat - alat yang menunjang usahanya

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa M., 31 years of age, is a dynamic and hardworking mother of three children in Barangay Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Melissa was a working student in college. After graduation she married Elmer M., a fisherman. Since her husband’s income is not enough to meet their daily expenses, she helps out by selling “Puto” made of cassava every day in the nearby school in their municipality.

When she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she attended trainings about how to run a business and expanded her business to a sari-sari store. She wants to obtain financial assistance amounting to PHP 50,000.00 to purchase a variety of goods to be sold in her sari-sari store, so that she can increase her sales and income. She plans to purchase a motorized fishing boat in the near future to be used by her husband.

She really values her credit worthiness, and she has been a member in good standing of Paglaum MPC since 2001.

loans.use: Purchase of a variety of goods for sari-sari store

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Mrs. Carmelita J. B., 53, is happily married to Petronilo B. Sr. They have one son. They live in Katipa, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Carmelita  has been a barangay (village) secretary since 1993.

She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since 2001. She used her previous loan to improve their sari-sari store. (The word sari-sari means "various kinds." Most sari-sari stores are privately owned shops that are located inside the owner’s house.)

Carmelita is requesting a loan of PHP15,000 to purchase more stock for their sari-sari store.

loans.use: Purchase  goods for sari-sari store

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa C. is 46 years old and married to Edwin C., Sr. They have 6 children and live in Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a daily wage farm worker. In order to help her husband, she sells “bibingka,” a rice cake snack that she bakes herself. Aside from selling rice cakes, she operates a sari-sari store.

In 2002, she became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of PHP 20,000.00 to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store because selling rice cakes is not sufficient for her daily needs. She plans to send her children to college so that they can help her in the future, and to repair their house.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for her sari-sari store

location.town: Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: 40 Quãng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Loan Group 40 consists of six poor women, all of whom live in village 3 Quang Hung Commune, Thanh Hoa City.  Thanh Hoa City is the provincial capital of Thanh Hoa province, one of the poorest provinces in Vietnam, and is located approximately 150 kilometers south of Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam.

Mrs. Tu Nguyen Thi is the lead borrower of the group. She is 54 years old.  Prior to borrowing from the Fund for Poor Women, her husband was unemployed, her two children had to quit school because Mrs Tu and her husband couldn’t afford the school fees, and her family farmed a small plot of land.  In short, her family’s life was very difficult.

Since she started borrowing from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, Mrs Tu has always repaid her loans in full and on time.  With previous loans, she opened a veterinary office in her house which provides her husband with employment.  With her share of this loan she will invest in the veterinary office and will also continue raising animals.  Her family’s life has gradually improved and she is very grateful to the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The loan will be split equally between all six borrowers with each member of the group borrowing 1,626,900 Vietnamese Dong, or just under US$100.  The other borrowers in the group will use their share of the loan as follows:

* Mrs. Minh Nguyen Thi is borrowing money to buy vegetables from farmers that she will resell at market.
* Mrs. Chieu Hoang Thi is borrowing money to buy and raise chickens and ducks.
