texts.en: Enyonam F. is a wife and mother of five children who are currently in school. She is a 40-year-old trader who trades in charcoal and bags of gari.  Charcoal is a very popular cooking fuel in many traditional Ghanaian homes. She has been in this business for the past 3 years. Through her business, she has supported two of her children through senior high school. Enyonam obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Tema and sells it at retail to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more charcoal and bags of gari to increase her stock. She believes the loan will enable her to increase her savings to provide for the educational needs of her children. She belongs to the community group called Morning Star Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and bags of gari.

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en: Kawthar S. is a 45 year-old woman living in Bar Elias in the Bekaa valley. A mother of three, Kawthar started working from home as a tailor in 1985. Being a very creative woman, she began to sell homemade souvenir gifts. As more and more clients requested her products, Kawthar soon opened her own workshop. Today she is asking for $1000 to buy inventory to produce more gifts and increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy supplies to meet customer demand for her tailored goods.

loans.name: Safiétou

texts.fr: Madame Safiétou C. est une brave commerçante , elle habite le quartier populaire de Kandé Banéto. Grâce à son commerce elle soutient son mari pour entretenir leur cinq enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son stock et augmenter son bénéfice.La période est propice avec les fêtes de Tabaski et de fin d'année.
texts.en:
Mrs. Safietou C. is an enterprising business woman. She lives in the popular district of Kande Baneto. With her business she is able to assist her husband in the raising of her five children. She is requesting this loan to increase her stock which will raise her income. This is an opportune time for business with the Tabaski (Muslim celebration) and the New Year holidays.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita K. is 42 years old. She is a wife and mother of three children. Currently all the children are in school. Selling for the past ten years, she has gained lots of experience in her business. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of maize from the farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at a higher price. She wants to use the loan to buy maize in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to save enough money to sponsor her children's education. Rita is a member of a community group called ‘Angels Trust Group’. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence E. is 42 years old and married with 3 children. She started this business in 2002. She travels to Delta State in Nigeria to purchase local gin (ogogoro) to sell to retailers in Benin City. She is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more local ogogoro to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and that they should keep up the good work.

loans.use: To purchase more local gin (ogogoro) to sell

loans.name: Bekmurod

texts.en:
K. Bekmurod, 48, is an exceptionally responsible father.  He's been farming since he was a young man; work that he likes.  He needs better tools to cultivate his land, though, because he can only plant maize now with difficulty. 

Bekmurod worries day and night about his children's education; they're the reason for his sweat and toil. 

Due to the upcoming season, he wants to sow wheat, potatoes and onions.  For this purpose, he requests $1000 USD for the term of 12 months.  He wants to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer and also some new tools.  Thanks to this loan, he will be able to expand his business and better provide for his family.  With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Nurulo

texts.ru: Джутов Нуруло проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 46 лет, женат и имеет шестерых детей. 12 лет занимается фермерской деятельностью. Сеет пшницу  на своем участке земли. Во время посевного сезона планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить семена пшениц. Кроме того , для посева необходимо нанимать трактор , за который нужно платить .Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nurulo J. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 46 years old, married, and has six children. For the past 12 years he has worked as a farmer, sowing wheat on his land plot. He plans to use a loan for purchase of seed wheat during the planting season. In addition, he must pay to rent a tractor for planting. The loan can be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grain for wheat planting

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir N. is a 49 year-old man living in Bourj El Barajneh, in the suburbs of Beirut. He is married and has four children. During the July war in Lebanon in 2006, Samir lost his sewing factory. Since then, he has been working as a taxi driver to support his family. Today Samir wants to borrow $1200 to change the tires of his vehicle as well as perform maintenance on his taxi.

loans.use: To buy new tires and perform vehicle maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Cette dame est depuis des années dans le commerce des tissus. Elle habite le grand quartier de Néma . Cette brave dame mariée et mére de 4 enfants soutient son époux avec les revenus tirés de son commerce. Elle demande ce crédit pour augmenter ses revenus en renforçant son stock.
texts.en:
Mrs. Awa Ndiayen has been in the fabric business for many years. She lives in the large district of Nema. This enterprising woman is married and has four children. She supports her husband with income earned from her business. Awa is requesting this loan to increase her stock and revenues.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn C. is a 45-year old mother of five who lives in Sto. Nino, South Cotabato. She and her husband work hard to keep their children in school. Her husband is a farmer who manages a family-owned rice field. Marilyn knows that a better future for her children will not be possible if she depends solely on the income her husband makes while farming, so she has decided to go into business for herself as a hog farmer. 

She started her hog-raising project in her backyard in 2007, using a loan as start-up capital to purchase a sow. After four months, she was able to raise two hogs which she sold at a profit. She used that profit to buy additional piglets.

Marilyn has learned that she can generate more money from her business by raising more capital.  That's why she is applying for a loan to buy feed for her animals. During an interview, she said that, “I believe that quality feed can increase the yield of my hogs. If I can do that, I not only increase my income, but also help my husband sustain the needs of our children, especially their education.”

loans.use: To buy feed for her hobs

loans.name: Onome

texts.en: Onome E. is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She sells cooked food and drinks to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. Onome needs the loan amount of N80,000 to renovate her store and purchase a fridge to cool her drinks for her customers. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To renovate her store and purchase a fridge

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
“Sending my daughter to college is very expensive, so I need to work hard in the fields and spend long hours under the heat of the sun just to support her financially," says Avelino C., who lives in Sto. Nino, South Cotabato.

Avelino is a 58-year-old father who is very devoted to helping his daughter finish her degree. “Unlike me, she has been able to go to college and has a chance to get a decent job. I need to support my family, and the only way I know to do that is by farming, which I have learned since childhood,” he said further. 

Avelino own a one-hectare rice field, which he manages and maintains on his own.  Occasionally during harvest time, he hires seasonal workers. He sells his crop to traders who live nearby. In order to maximize his farm's yield, he has applied for a loan which he will use to buy five bags of fertilizer, two quarts of pesticides and four bags of rice seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertiilizer, pesticides and seeds for their farm

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
A 23-year old Albert G. is a high-school graduate, married and a farmer/entrepreneur from Sto. South Cotabato. His wife stays at home to care for their one-year-old son. Married at young age, Albert learned to stand on his own in order to support the needs of his family by carefully tending the half-hectare rice field he inherited from his parents. To save labor costs, he manages his own rice field, were he earns his family's sole source of income.

Albert is applying for his second loan, which he will use to by fertilizer and pesticide for his rice field. “If I get this loan," he said, “I could maximize the yield of my farm, and with the extra money I earn, I will be able to send my son to school and finish a degree, a dream that I failed to achieve myself.”

Through his membership in CEV, Albert has not only generated savings, but also now has death insurance and a positive outlook on life. In meetings, he often talks about how the bible has inspired him to be courageous when trials come along his way.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for a rice field.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene E. is 42 years old and married with 5 children. She sells bush meat. Bush meat is used in Nigeria for the preparation of soup. The demand for bush meat is high in Nigeria. Irene needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more bush meat to sell. She is a Lapo client. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more bush meat to sell

loans.name: Kholmuhamad

texts.en:
N. Kholmuhamad is a farmer.  It is how he supports his family, which consists of his wife and two school-aged children (pictured in the photo because Kholmuhamad himself was absent on the day of our visit).  

With great sacrifice, he has been able to be successful and has supported himself with the loans he has received from IMON.  In spite of the economic challenges that he has encountered, he has been able, with much sacrifice, to support his home.  That is why today, he is concerned about improving his work by investing in crops through technical assistance, and by buying seeds and fertilizers for their development.  

Today he has approached to IMON for a loan that will permit him to buy supplies for his crops.  This loan will benefit him, as well as the family that he so loves.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Amadou Tidiane

texts.fr: Ce jeune a choisi de faire fortune au pays contrairement à ceux qui ont choisi l'immigration clandestine. Il exploite une librairie-papeterie non loin du marché central de Ziguinchor. Sa clientéle est composé pour l'essentiel des éléves, des étudiants et autres administrations publiques et privées. Il sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son fond de roulement en cette période d'année scolaire.
texts.en:
This young man has chosen to make his fortune in his own country as opposed to those who engage in clandestine immigration. He runs a little stationery store and bookshop not far from the central market of Ziguinchor. His clientele is essentially composed of school children, students, and representatives of public and private offices. He is requesting this loan to bolster his working capital during the back-to-school period.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stationery shop and bookshop

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is a hairdresser. She makes lovely hairstyles for her customers. Deborah is 32 years old and married with 4 children. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more hair materials like weaves, hair creams, and hair extensions to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more salon materials to sell

loans.name: Mukhtor

texts.en:
Mukhtor is an excellent father of three children, and farmer who is dedicated to his work.  His goal is to better his farming techniques.  This way, he fulfills the needs within his home, especially for his three children.  

He sows wheat, corn and different kinds of vegetables with the help of his wife, who is pictured in the photo as Mukhtor himself was absent on the day of our visit.  He travels daily, without delay, to his agricultural lands and is aware of every change that occurs.  Due to high demand for his products - because of their excellent quality, size and flavor - Mukhtor has decided to plant more, and apply for a loan to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers that will contribute to an excellent harvest. 

With this, Mukhtor will be able to increase his sales, earn more, and meet the needs of his dearest children.  Your support will really help him.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Миралиева Адолат житеьница города Душанбе. Домохозяйка , которая занимается шитьем . Данным видом бизнеса занимается уже с молодости. Обратилась к нам за получением кредита. Деньги планирует использовать для того , чтобы купить швейную машинку. Погашать кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Adolat M. lives in Dushanbe. She is a homemaker and is also a seamstress. She has been in this business since her youth. Adolat has turned to us for a loan. She plans to use the money to purchase a sewing machine. Adolat plans to pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Khusnidin

texts.en:
S. Khusnidin is 44 years of age, married with 5 children and lives with his family in Shahrituz, Tajikistan.  He is dedicated to agriculture, having 5 years of experience in this activity.  

He has sown different kinds of vegetables and wheat.  A part of his crop is destined for personal use, and the majority he sells in the different markets of Shahrituz.  The income that he generates with this activity varies depending on the season in which the product is harvested.  That is why his wife supports him in paying the household expenses.  She is dedicated to the sale of their products. 

The economic situation of the country has affected the acquisition of the supplies for productive work.  The costs of fertilizers, supplements and insecticides have been increased to the point where he needs a loan to be able to buy them.  For this reason, he is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni (1200 USD) for the term of 12 months.  You could become an important part of his family's life.  Khusnidin deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Amen

texts.en: Amen is 38 years old and married with 4 children. She has a salon where she sells weaves and other salon materials. She also makes lovely hairstyles for her customers. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more weaves to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase weaves to sell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia sells bags of garri (cassava). She started this business in 2007. Before then, she was involved in petty trading, but she was not making enough profits and had to switch over to the garri business. Patricia needs the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell. She is 35 years old and married with 5 children. She and her family live in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Botir

texts.en:
S. Botir is 41 years old.  He is married and, together with his wife, has 5 children.  Botir has the specialty of engineering.  However, for several years now he has been selling clothing together with his wife, who is pictured in the photo.  They are selling socks for men and children, and also national women's slippers in the central local market.  

The income from the business Botir is spending on educating his children as he and his wife are dreaming that their children shall have higher education. 

Botir has been provided with the loans by IMON already in the past 2 years.  For this entire period of time, he has shown himself to be an accurate client.  Today, he requests 2600 Somoni ($775 USD) for purchasing new goods for selling.  Botir promises to repay the loan in 12 months and sincerely thanks all for supporting him.

loans.use: Purchasing of new goods for selling in order to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr: Ce jeune commerçant tient un commerce dans le grand marché de Ziguinchor. Il constitue un véritable soutient pour sa famille resté au village. Il demande ce crédit pour renforcer son commerce et réaliser davantage de bénéfices.Il a déjà vendu des centaines de sacs au dos pour écoliers.
texts.en:
Mohamed G. is a young entrepreneur with a general retail shop located in the central marketplace of Ziguinchor. With this business he has been able to sell hundreds of school bags. He is a strong support for his family who live in his home village. He is requesting this loan to improve his business and increase his income.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business improvement and purchase of stock

loans.name: Zulkhumor

texts.en:
E. Zulkhumor is 35 years old.  She is married with three children.  Zulkhumor is running a catering business where she provides meals of the national cuisine.  

She rents the catering room in a caravan, which is located in the central local market and allows Zulkhumor to have many clients, the majority of which are those making purchases in the market. Every day, she purchases the latest foodstuff and cooks delicious dishes.  

Zulkhumor’s children are already adults and in order to send them to the university, she has to earn more as her husband doesn’t earn much.  Now, she is asking for a loan 3900 Somoni ($1150 USD) with the term of 3 months in order to expand her business and earn enough to be able to send her children to the University next year. 

She will use the loan for buying kitchen inventory, tables and chairs.  She thanks all supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.  Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to make her dreams come reality.

loans.use: Purchasing of kitchen inventory, tables and chairs

loans.name: Ergash

texts.en:
H. Ergash is a father who has devoted himself to independent agriculture tasks for the past 8 years cultivating potatoes, onions and carrots.  His daily efforts and the care of his fields assure him a good harvest as well as profits, so that his four children can continue their education. 

Ergash has dreamed of extending his lands and wants to obtain a loan to invest in his current land by purchasing seeds and fertilizer to earn greater profits and reach the goal he has set for himself.  Ergash thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan with no violations.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer for sowing potatoes and onions

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
For the last four months, Victoria has been developing her small business: selling womens' lingerie. She sells her merchandise at the local marketplace in her home town of Vasilyevka. Victoria loves what she does, which shows in how she conducts her business. With her friendly smile and helpful service, she makes customers feel appreciated and want to return and buy from her again.

Victoria has degree in law which helps her manage her business more efficiently. One of the things Victoria enjoys about having her own business is the ability to help her family financially. She has requested a loan to allow her to purchase needed inventory so she can keep up with demand. Obtaining products in a timely manner can be difficult due to problems with suppliers and shipping. This funding will make it easier for Victoria to maintain her inventory and continue to offer excellent service to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise

loans.name: Uljaboy

texts.en:
K. Uljaboy is 48 years old.  He is married with 5 children.  Uljaboy is an optimistic, hardworking father.  He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent vegetables. 

Uljaboy has been in agro-business for more than 8 years.  In fact, he draws strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city.  Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time-taking job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. 

He is planning to fix the house and save enough money to pay for his children’s school fees.  With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900 USD), which he has committed to repay within 12 months.  With the desire to realize his plan, Uljaboy appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en: Nkechi is 30 years old and married with a child. She sells bags of rice and beans wholesale and retail. She started this business in 2004. Nkechi is a LAPO client. She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more bags of rice and beans to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.en:
Iskandar is one of the most hard-working young men in the area where he lives, which differentiates him from other local residents and makes him stand out as a well-respected and very important member of the community.  

Farming requires a lot of effort, which is why from a young age, Iskandar has dedicated himself to this business and today is seeking a way to expand his efforts in order to support his family, which consists of his wife and a son.  

Because his crop provides the main income for the family, he is seeking a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750 USD) for the term of 9 months to plow more farmland and purchase seeds and fertilizer.  The loan will allow him to expand his farming business.  Iskandar hopes the loan can increase the family's income.  He hopes you will support him and thanks you for your generosity.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer for sowing potatoes and onions

loans.name: Abdoul

texts.fr: Agée de 26 ans Abdoul S. est un jeune commerçant celibataire installé à Mbour.Venu de son village natal ,il a débuté son commerce par la vente de lait caillé avant d' ouvrir il y a six (06) une boutique de commerce de detail  pour diversifier son activité.Avec le pret  demandé,il va renforcer les quantités de stock de marchandises pour mieux répondre à la demande de la clientelle
texts.en:
Abdoul S., 26 and single, is a young merchant living in Mbour. Having come there from the village where he was born, he began by selling buttermilk before he opened his little general store 6 years ago, in order to diversify his business. With the loan he is requesting, he hopes to bolster his inventory so that he can better meet the needs of his clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: Abdurazok

texts.en:
M. Abdurazok is 41 years old and has a very collaborative and supportive wife who joins him in tending to their crops.  This couple has 4 children who are all in school.  He and his wife have been working in agriculture for many years.  It is their livelihood.  

He likes the earth to be well worked.  He plants wheat, potatoes, onions and carrots.  His wife and 4 children work for the family's daily income. The eldest child is 20 years old, and helps take care of the crops, but then has to go and study. 

Now, Abdurazok needs a loan of 3500 Somoni ($1050 USD) for the term of 12 months.  He is planning to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer for sowing wheat and potato.  His goal, with time, is to plant larger quantities and educate his children.  With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
A small entrepreneur from Mikhailovka, Yelena owns a business selling clothing at a local market. She is a married mother of one son. Yelena has a nice selection of inventory that is both trendy and affordable. She has been in the trade for two years. Currently, she earns approximately 12,000 UAH in gross income every month.

Yelena has experience in this business. At first, she was helping her family members with their clothing business and then decided to go into the business herself. She is an outstanding example of a persevering and focused woman. She balances her family and business and manages her time very effectively. Yelena is requesting a loan of 6,000 Grivnas to stock her vending place with new merchandise.

loans.use: to increase her stock

loans.name: Malik

texts.en:
M. Malik is 48 years old and living with his wife and three children.  He has grown vegetables and wheat for more than 17 years, which he fertilizes and waters every morning.  

His small plots are close to his home, which helps him to care for them patiently.  This work takes all day, but because it is close to his home, it is not too difficult to care for them.  This pleases him because he has more time to spend with his family and his children.  The hard part is transporting the products into the cities because of the scarcity of buses that get to his community.  

Malik gets most of his enthusiasm and will to keep going from his family.  He will invest the money in the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizer in order to increase his production and, therefore, his income.  With your help, Malik will get ahead.  He is counting on your help.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer for sowing wheat and seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Toshnazar

texts.en:
N. Toshnazar is 51 years old and lives with his wife and three children.  He is a farmer dedicated to studying the land and to the cultivation of wheat, potatoes and corn.  

His farming generates earnings that allow him to support his family.  He takes his products to the town of Shahrituz to sell throughout the primary markets of that town.  Toshnazar is always vigilant of his farmland, making sure to keep tabs on any possible pest infestations or diseases that may harm his crops.  

Toshnazar is motivated, day in and day out, by his desire to better provide for his family and by his wish for his children to complete their education so that they can look forward to bright futures. 

He seeks a loan with which to buy products for planting his crops, such as seeds and fertilizer, in order to improve his yield in the future.  The well-being of this family is in your hands.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
U. Hasan is a 38 year old man who lives with his wife.  He has always worked in agriculture, and since his marriage, he has put his experience to work in the fields so that he and his wife might achieve well being in their family.  

Their jobs take up most of their time every day, and require plenty of hard work, but they enjoy it.  They are especially proud of their product, which they care for by purchasing manure and fertilizer which helps them to grow their crops successfully.  

The cost of these necessary items, however, is very high.  Hasan must care for his children every day, and this is his main motivation to work hard.  He would like to make an investment in wheat and potato production, so that he can have a successful enough crop which will provide a bright future for his children.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer for sowing potatoes and onions

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir S. is a 37 year-old  man living in Saadnayel, in the Bekaa valley. Married with two small children, Samir repairs and sells water pumps for a living. He started his own business in 1989 after seeing a need for such services in the region. Today, Samir wishes to borrow $1200 to purchase water pumps in order to resell them within the scope of his work.

loans.use: To purchase water pumps to resell.

loans.name: Fatoumata Thiémokho

texts.fr: Fatoumata Thiémokho Traoré, 50 ans, veuve avec 10 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de CESIRI depuis 1 an et demi. Elle vend des légumes sur une table au marché. Fatoumata veut acheter de l’huile de palme, de la pâte d’arachide, du poisson séché, du yet et autres marchandises diverses pour renforcer son commerce.  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Thiémokho Traoré is fifty years old, a widow and is raising 10 children. She has been a member of the CERISI loan group for one and a half years. She sells vegetables from a table at the marketplace. Fatoumata would like to buy palm oil, peanut butter, dried fish and various merchandise to increase her business. She is requesting this loan which would be reimbursed all in one payment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, palm oil, dried peanuts and various merchandise

loans.name: Sud Métal Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de soudeurs métallique est animé par Ansoumana S.. Situé sur le boulevard 54m à Tiléne, ils arrivent à réaliser beaucoup d'activités. Ils sollicitent ce prêt pour renforcer leur fond de roulement et acheter du fer.
texts.en:
This group of welders is organized by Ansoumana S.. Located on Boulevard 54m in Tiléne, they manage to get a lot of different work done. They are asking for this loan to bolster their working capital and buy iron.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying iron for welding

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Mrs. Maribel E., 45 years old, married, lives in Ilaya, Dapitan City, Zamboanga del Norte. She has 2 children. Her husband is a mere driver of LGU- Dapitan City, ZDN. Because of her desire to help her husband, she decided to open her little bakeshop.

The demand of the people in their "barangay" seems very favorable to her, and so she decided to increase her production by acquiring some bakery equipment. This was the time she needed money to finance the bakery and decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2006. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 20,000. The purpose of the loan is to buy additional sacks of flour and sandwich-slicer equipment in order to increase the volume of production. Paglaum MPC has also helped her to save a part of her income for future use, aside from its other benefits like insurance and dividends. With God's help and hard work, her business is going so well that she was able to send her son to college and purchased some baking equipment.

Mrs. E. plans to undertake major renovations on her bakeshop, extend its eat-in area, and have a presentable bakeshop in the future. She also plans to send her bakers to attend a training course for new technologies and baking techniques so as to be competitive.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, sugar, and other ingredients for bread-making and buy sandwich-slicer equipment

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is married and has one child. She runs a small business selling clothing at the central market. She started this business about a year ago and it is financially profitable. Her working capital is 30,000 UAH and her monthly income is 2,900 UAH. Anna decided to get involved in this particular business because she saw a good opportunity. Inexpensive clothing is always in demand. The seasons change and people buy new clothing constantly.

Being a hardworking and entrepreneurial person, Anna can continue to make her business a success. Anna would like to request a loan of 3,000 UAH to purchase more goods for the upcoming busy winter season. More goods would bring her more profit and enable her take better care of her family. Note: this is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Volodymir

texts.en:
Volodymir is married and has two small children. A few years ago, he was laid off and couldn’t find a job. He decided to invest his savings into a small business: using his car as a taxi. Volodymir helps his clients get around, not only within the city limits but to other cities as well. He has loyal clients, which makes his business more and more successful. His daily gross income is 180-200 UAH. The car has been equipped to use a special low cost gas to save money on fuel.

Volodymir is requesting a loan of 5000 UAH to fix his car. After he fixes his car, he will be able to take home a regular income and better provide for his familys needs.

loans.use: to fix his car

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is married and has two daughters. She is an entrepreneur from Mukachevo, Ukraine. Lubov sells vegetables and fruit at a local market called “Green Market.” Her merchandise is affordable and of very high quality. Lubov started her business venture six years ago because she couldn’t find other ways to support herself and her family. Today, her business has grown and she has approximately t 25,000 Grivnas in inventory.

As a determined entrepreneur with an enthusiastic personality, Lubov has managed to overcome difficulties and keep her business sustainable. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 Grivnas to increase her turnover capital and develop her business. She is hoping to repay the loan in 2 months. Note: this is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: to increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Djiby

texts.fr: Mr T. est pére de famille agé de quarente (40) ans .Il est tailleur de profession depuis 22 ans .Dans son atelier il forme des jeunes au metier de tailleur en meme temps il confection des vetements.Les fetes de fin d' année constituent  des periodes de grandes opportinuté pour les tailleurs ainsi il sollicite un pret pour acheter de accessoires (fils biais bouton renfort ect)pour pouvoir beneficier des economies d'echelle.
texts.en:
Mr. T. is 40 years old and a father of a family. He has been a tailor by profession for 22 years. He uses his workshop to teach young people the tailoring trade while at the same time selling his clothing. The end of the year holiday is a very important sales period for tailors. For this reason he is requesting this loan to purchase accessories ( thread, buttons, cut material, linings, etc) that would increase his business and benefit from the economies of scale.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating funds (to purchase materials)

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She has a restaurant where she sells cooked food like rice, beans, plantains, etc. She has lots of customers who patronize her restaurant. Helen needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs for cooking and also drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed A. K. is a young man, currently twenty years of age. When his father lost his job, Mohammed quit school to help provide for his family, thus ending his life long dream of getting a higher education. Instead, Mohammed opened a small cafeteria which supports his parents and his five younger brothers.

Mohammed is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy tables and chairs for his cafeteria as well as some additionA. cooking equipment. The new seating and improved cooking equipment will help him increase his income and provide a better standard of living for his family. He thanks all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs as well as some additional cooking equipment for his cafeteria business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 64 years old, and she is a widow with 3 children. She lives in Benin City with her family. She sells goats. She needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more goats to sell. She is happy because the festive season is fast approaching and the demands for her goats will be high. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more goats to sell

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married and has no children. She sells womens' clothing at the central market in Melitopol. Since she is the owner, she can keep prices low to attract many customers. Irina has been in this business for two years. Her relatives were very supportive and helped her business grow. Irina was able to increase her monthly gross income to 10,000 UAH.

Irina is requesting a loan of 4,000 UAH to increase the variety of goods she sells. She believes that having more goods can bring her additional income. This would help her pay for her increased family expenses during in winter.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married and has two grown children. She owns a little kiosk at the central market in Melitopol City. She sells various types of clothing. Some of the advantages of her business are: variety, consistency, and affordable prices. Valentina has been working in this business for eight years. She is always seeking to grow and develop her business and improve her entrepreneurial skills. Currently, Valentina’s working capital is 10,000 UAH and her monthly gross income is about 4,000 UAH.

Valentina is requesting a loan of 2,500 UAH to purchase more goods for the upcoming winter season. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s financial situation. Note: this is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: to purchase more goods

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary I. is 47 years old and married with a child. Mary sells sarongs and shoes. Mary started this business in 2006. She needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more sarongs and shoes to sell. Mary says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and shoes to sell

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 32 years old and married with 4 children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. Doris has been in this business since 1998. She is a LAPO client. Doris needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She sells provisions, drinks, wine, and cosmetics. Magdalene needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more products to sell. She hopes to meet the demand of her customers. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks, wine, and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Improve mechanical workshop and purchase iron supplies

loans.name: Luz En La Tiniebla Group

texts.en: Maria K. is the representative of this group called "luz en la tiniebla".  She was chosen because she is a very hardworK. lady and is a perfect example of the type of person microcredit tries to work with.  She is living in extreme poverty and trying to provide for her five young children.  Each child is under the age of 16, and she even has a baby of nine months to care for.  She realized that she wanted to be able to provide a good life for her children and hopefully get them out of their poverty.  She is taK. out a loan to try and make this dream a reality.  She wants to start a small business maK. and selling clothing in her neighborhood.  She dreams of increasing her business into a thriving clothing store.  Her dream in life is to send all her children to college and have them be able to live out their dreams.  She is very excited about this first step to a better life and is ready for the challenge!

loans.use: To start a business selling clothing.

loans.name: David

texts.es: EL SR. DAVID PINTO B., SE DEDICA A LA PRODUCCION DE LIBROS EN PEQUEÑAS CANTIDADES, LABOR QUE REALIZA EN SU DOMICILIO CON UNA PEQUEÑA MAQUINA DE IMPRENTA CLIENTE QUE TIENE DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS, ESTA LABOR REPRESENTA SU ÚNICA FORMA DE SUSTENTO PARA ÉL Y SU FAMILIA, ES ASÍ QUE GRACIAS A ESTE TRAJO, PUEDE MANTENER A SU UNICA HIJA, CUBRIENDO SUS GASTOS DE ESTUDIO Y ALIMENTACIÓN PORQUE ES PADRE SOLTERO. SE DEDICA CON MUCHO AMOR A SU TRABAJO Y A SU HIJ, DANDO EN EL DÍA A DÍA MUCHO DE SI. SU SUEÑO ES TENER UNA IMPRENTA PROPIA Y QUE SU HIJA SALGA PROFESIONAL.
texts.en:
Mr. David P. B. prints small quantities of books for a living, using a small printing press, which he has had for several years, at home. This job is his sole source of income for his family. Thanks to this occupation, he is able to support his only daughter, covering her food and educational costs since he is a single dad. He is wholeheartedly dedicated to his work and his daughter, giving it his all on a daily basis. He dreams of both having his own printing works and of his daughter becoming a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Anielka Del Socorro

texts.es:
La joven de nombre Anielka Del Socorro S. D. tiene la edad de 24 años, su estado civil es casada esta joven no tiene hijos, su compañero de vida labora como barbero y la misma vez estudia economía, en sus deseos Anielka quiere construir su casa ya que tiene el lugar necesita los materiales para la construcción por lo que los costos de los materiales están demasiados elevados, en sus propósitos esta el de acondicionar su vivienda de la manera mas sencilla pero que ella y su esposo tengan un lugar digno donde vivir, y que sus negocio se mantenga de forma activa para obtener lo que desea.



La actividad económica de a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general, el tiempo de tener este negocio es de 5 años, sus inicios son por cuenta propia y porque quería independizarse de sus padres y empieza con la venta de ropa en pequeñas cantidades como fue la ropa interior y camisetas y mas tarde decide incrementarse un poco mas y es así como obtiene este negocio a pesar de que trabaja esta Joven no dejo sus estudios por lo que actualmente cursa el 4 año de la carrera banca y finanzas y para lograr administrar de una forma segura su negocio, el  financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que ella compra cada 15 días a 20 días y que necesita surtir mas en estos días festivos por lo que necesita ofrecer una variedad de ropa para que sus clientes puedan escoger lo que mas les guste y agradece que fundación león 2000 y otras organizaciones ayuden a la causa de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Anielka Del Socorro S. D. is 24 years old, married with no children. Her husband works as a barber and studies economy at the same time. Anielka wishes to build her house, she has the land but needs the building materials. As the cost is too high it is her purpose to condition her dwelling in a simple way to make it a decent place to live for her and her husband as well as to keep business active in order to obtain what she wants.

For the past 5 years, she has been selling a variety of merchandise for a living. She started on her own, because she wanted to become independent from her parents, selling small amounts of garments such as underwear and shirts. Later on she decided to increase business even if she was studying banking and financing in the 4th year at the same time. In order to administer her business in a safe way, the loan will be used as work capital as she purchases merchandise every 15-20 days and needs more for the holidays and therefore it is necessary to have a variety of garments to offer to her clients. She is thankful to Fundación León 2000 and other organizations that support the cause of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Martha Cecilia Z. D. tiene 41 años de edad, sus estado civil es casada, Doña Martha tiene 2 hijos su hija mayor tiene 19 años de edad y cursa reciente mente el 2 año de administración y su hijo menor 16 años que cursa el 4 año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora como obrero en una constructora, sus propósitos son de establecer su propio negocio en un lugar donde represente las condiciones adecuadas, en sus deseos esta el ayudar a sus hijos a seguir adelante para que puedan defenderse en un futuro y prepáralos para el mañana.


La actividad económica a la que ella se dedica es la venta de productos médicos, el tiempo que tiene de tener este negocio es de 10 años, en sus inicios empieza vendiendo productos médicos en el campus de la universidad de León a los estudiantes que llevan la carrera de odontología y mas tarde decide realizar la distribución de sus productos en las diferentes farmacias en león por lo que el motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que consiste en la compra: alcohol, acetona, moldes para la dentadura ya que las compras las realiza en Managua por lo que tiene que buscar el lugar donde a ella le ofrezcan el producto mas accesible.
texts.en:
Ms. Martha Cecilia Z. D. is a married 41-year-old mother with 2 children. Her eldest child, age 19, is currently in her second year of Business Administration, while her youngest child, age 16, is currently in his fourth year of high school. Her husband works in construction. Her goal is to establish her own business in an optimal location. She also wishes to help her children get ahead and prepare them for tomorrow so that they can get by in the future.

She has been selling medical products for a living for 10 years. Initially, she would sell medical products to the dentistry students on campus at the University of León. Later, she decided to distribute her products to the different pharmacies in León. She is requesting this loan to use as work capital to buy: alcohol, acetone, molds for making dental impressions, etc. She purchases these products in Managua, where she has to search for the place that sells them to her at an affordable price.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sandra Marina

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Marina S. C. tiene la edad de 40 años, su estado civil es soltera, doña Sandra tiene 1 hija de 15 años que cursa recientemente el 2 año de secundaria sus propósitos son de mejorar su negocio y adquirir mas conocimiento en lo que seria el mercado competitivo por lo que en sus deseos  esta el que su hija logre graduarse y seguirla ayudando para que pueda tener un futuro prometedor en sus estudios.


Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos como lo es perfumes, cremas, lociones y pintura de labio el tiempo que tiene de tener este negocio es de 2 años, ella  inicia este negocio por medio de una señora que la indujo que a través de la venta de este obtendría ingresos para su familia pero comienza con la venta de perfumes para varón por lo que al ver que obtiene resultados de este negocio decide realizar un financiamiento que estaría destinado para el capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar las compras de mas productos por lo que también se avecinan las fechas festivas y necesita demostrar la variedad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Ms. Sandra Marina S. C. is a 40-year-old single mother with a 15-year-old daughter who is in her second year of high school. She plans on improving her business and acquiring more knowledge with respect to the competitive market. She also hopes that her daughter will manage to graduate, and that she can keep supporting her so that she can have a promising future in her studies.

Her business consists of selling cosmetics, such as perfume, creams, lotions, and lipsticks. She has had this business for 2 years. She started the business because a woman persuaded her to do so, telling her that she would be able to obtain an income for her family through cosmetics sales. She started out by selling cologne for men. Upon realizing that the business yielded favorable results, she decided to take out a loan, which she will use as work capital to purchase more products. Furthermore, the holidays are approaching, so she needs to offer a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Carlos J. Rodríguez de 42 años, siendo su estado civil casado, con 4 hijos el mayor con 18 años cursa el 1 año de ingeniería en sistema, la segunda es una mujer con 16 años de edad que actualmente cursa el 4 año de electricidad, el tercero un niño de 11 años cursa el 6 grado de primaria y el ultimo de sus hijos tiene la edad de 5 años que cursa el 5 grado de primaria, su esposa no labora posee un negocio el cual administrado por ella misma, el propósito de Carlos es salir adelante con su negocio y brindarles a cada uno de sus hijos la oportunidad de llegar a ser unos grandes profesionales y poder ser buenas  personas  ante la sociedad.


La actividad económica a la cual se dedica actualmente es a la venta de pollo que esta ubicada en el mercado central, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 5 años, el inicia este negocio con un frezeer lo cual empezó en el mercado central   pero tuvieron que trasladarse en su casa de habitación por motivos de que el impuesto en el mercado central era demasiado alto y no podían costearlo es por eso que su negocio es trasladado a su vivienda, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que el necesita realizar la compra de sus productos para ofertar a sus clientes una mejor calidad de venta ya en su mayoría lo que mas vende es la pechuga del pollo.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos J. Rodríguez is a 42-year-old married father of 4 children. The eldest is an 18-year-old who is in his first year of computer systems engineering. The second one, a 16-year-old female, is currently in her fourth year of electrical studies. The third one, an 11-year-old son, is in the 6th grade, while the youngest, a 5-year-old, is in first grade. His wife does not work because she has a business that she manages for herself. Carlos’ goal is to get ahead in his business and give each of his children the opportunity to be great professionals and good people in society.

Carlos sells chicken for a living. He has had this business for 5 years, starting out with a freezer in the central market, but they had to relocate the business to their home because they could no longer afford the high taxes charged in the market. He is requesting this loan as work capital; he needs to purchase products to offer in order to offer to his customers a higher quality of chicken. What he sells most are chicken breasts.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rafaela Leonor

texts.es:
La muchacha Rafaela Leonor Z. Téllez tiene la edad de 34 años, su estado civil es casada esta Joven tiene 3 hijos su hijo mayor tiene la edad de 11 años que cursa el 1 año de secundaria, su otro hijo 7 años esta cursando el 1 grado de primaria y su niña de 2 años que no estudia su compañero de vida labora como cobrador de transporte, sus deseos y sueños de esta joven es de mantener su negocio activo por lo que la situación en el país esta totalmente muy  inestatable, y en sus deseos esta el obtener una mejor vida para ella y sus hijos y en  por eso busca el medio de mantener a sus hijos por lo que trabaja en la empresa ARNECOM  y agradece a la Fundación león 2000 y las organizaciones amigas.




El tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 8 años, la actividad económica a la que ella que se dedica es la venta de ropa y cosméticos como lo es: pantalón, short, camisa cremas y  perfumes, ella inicia este negocio  por cuenta propia con la venta de perfumes por lo que decidió incrementar su producción de venta en productos como lo es: venta de oro laminado, perfumes y el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar las compras de la variedad de productos por los días festivos que ya se aproximan y así ofrecerá a sus clientes una variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Rafaela Leonor Z. Téllez is 34 years old and married. This young woman has three children. Her oldest son is 11 years old and in his first year of secondary school. Her second son is seven years old and in the first year of primary school. Her daughter is two years old. Rafaela's husband works as a bus driver. Since she was a child, Rafaela has dreamed of maintaining an active business, given that the situation in the country is very unstable. Rafaela would like to obtain the best life possible for herself and her children. Because of this she searches for a means of maintaining her children, which is why she works in ARNECOM, and why she thanks the Fundación león 2000 and its partner organizations. Rafaela has had this organization for eight years. She sells clothing and cosmetics such as shorts, shirts, creams, and perfumes. Rafaela began this business by selling perfumes on her own. She decided to increase her sales by adding products such as gold jewelry and perfumes. The loan is for Rafaela to buy a variety of products for the upcoming holidays, so that she can offer her clients a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juana  De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Juana de la Cruz García tiene la edad de 41 años, su estado civil es soltera esta señora tiene 2 hijos su hijo mayor tiene la edad de 18 años que cursa recientemente el 5 año de secundaria y su otro hijo de 14 años cursa el 3 año de secundaria, en sus propósitos esta mantener activo su negocio de forma segura y así podrá darle a sus hijos un futuro prometedor por lo que en sus deseos esta que sus hijos logren graduarse y proporcionarles una vivienda donde ellos puedan gozar de plena libertad .



El tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 10 años, su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas, ella inicia este negocio por iniciativa propia por unos parientes que residían en una finca y ella empezó la elaboración de las tortillas en su casa de habitación y las vecinos llegaban a pedirle tortillas por lo que mas tarde decide poner una venta de tortillas y es así como obtiene este negocio, el motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra del maíz, leña ya que la carreta vale 840 y también realiza la compra de maíz por quintal por lo que de esta forma le resulta mas factible  y así podrá generar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Juana de la Cruz García is 41 years old and single. She has two children. Her older son is 18 years old and is repeating his fifth year of secondary school. Her younger son is 14 years old and in his third year of secondary school. Juana would like to maintain an active, secure business so that she can give her sons a promising future. She hopes that her sons will graduate and wants to provide them with a house that they can freely enjoy. Juana has been making and selling tortillas for 10 years. She started this business buy herself with some relatives who live on a farm. She started making tortillas in her home and neighbors would come by to purchase them. Later she decided to establish her business to sell her tortillas more widely. Juana will use the loan to buy firewood, now that a cart costs 840. She'll also buy corn in 100kg bags because its more feasible, and thereby generate income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Erika De La Concepcion

texts.es:
Esta Joven emprendedora de nombre Erika  de La Concepción C.  de 33 años de edad, su estado civil es casada, tiene 2 hijos el varón tiene la edad de 14 años de edad y cursa  recientemente el 3 año de secundaria y su hija de 13 años cursa el 1 año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora como taxista, los propósitos que esta joven tiene es de extender su negocio por lo que necesita preparar a su hijos para el mañana y también en sus deseos esta comprarle una casa propia para sus hijos razón por la que necesita luchar muy duro par sacar adelante a su familia y realizar sus propósitos.


El tiempo que tiene en su negocio es de 4 años, la actividad económica  la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general en lo que vende lo siguiente: pantalones, short, camisas, cremas y body,  la venta de plata Ella inicia este negocio por desde muy pequeña le gustaba ser independiente por lo que empieza con la venta de granos básicos en su casa de habitación y fue de así que decidió quedarse con el negocio de la venta en mercadería en general, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita la compra de sus productos como es la plata ya que necesita distribuir sus productos en los diferentes departamentos ya que ella lo realiza por medio de encargos.
texts.en:
This young entrepreneur named Erika de La Concepción C. is a 33-year-old married mother of 2 children. Her son is 14 and is in his third year of middle school, while her daughter is 13 and is in her first year of middle school. Her husband works as a taxi cab driver. This young woman has the goal of expanding her business so that she can prepare her children for the future. She also wishes to buy her own house for her children, which is why she needs to work hard in order to help her family get ahead and reach their goals.

She has had her business for 4 years, selling general merchandise like pants, shorts, shirts, lotion, body sprays, and silver. She started this business because from a young age, she has always liked to be independent, which is why she started selling staple grains from home. She then decided to stay in business by selling general merchandise. She needs this loan as work capital to purchase products like silver in order to distribute her merchandise to the different departments because she sells by catalog.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Aura Luz's Group

texts.es:
La señora emprendedora Aura Luz P. R. tiene la edad de 47 años, su estado civil es casada, esta señora tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 dependen de ella una niña de 19 años de edad que hará el examen de admisión de la universidad publica de la unan- león y un varón de 17 años de edad que también realizara el examen en esa misma universidad, su compañero de vida labora como artesano en la elaboración de calzado, Doña Aura tiene sueños de instalar su negocio en un lugar mas cómodo para sus clientes en donde puedan deleitarse y disfrutar de sus deliciosos nacatamales para que estos a su vez logren tener las comodidades necesaria en un establecimiento, también como propósito esta el seguir ayudando a sus hijos ya que ellos son unas de las prioridades mas importantes para ella asegurarles a sus hijos un futuro seguro en estudios.



Su actividad económica es la elaboración de nacatamal y sus derivados como lo es: frito, chicharrón, chingaste  y adobado por lo que su ubicación es en su casa de habitación cancha posada del sol ½ C abajo en león , ella tiene de poseer este negocio alrededor de 25 años, sus inicios empiezan desde que tiene la edad de 7 años por  lo que el negocio le pertenecía  a su mama ya que Doña Aura ayudaba en la elaboración y al adquirir la practica su mama decide dejarle el negocio a ella  para que este no pierda los antecedentes familiares y desde entonces es ella quien ha tenido a cargo este negocio, por lo que es necesario el financiamiento para la compra de capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la compra de maíz, la hoja para envolver el nacatamal y los diferentes productos para  la elaboración del mismo.
texts.en:
The entereprising lady, Mrs. Aura Luz P. R. is 47 years old, married with 5 children, 2 still depend on her, a 19 year-old girl and a 17 year-old boy, both in the process of applying to the public university UNAN-León. Her life partner works in the manufacture of footwear. It is Doña Aura's dream to set up her business at a comfortable place for her clients where they can enjoy her delicious "nacatamales" with all the necessary comodities. She also wishes to go on supporting her children as it is one of her priorities to secure a safe study environment in the future for her children. For a living she makes "nacatamales" and the by-products such as "frito", "chicharrón", "chingaste" and "adobado" at her house located at Cancha Posada del Sol 1/2 C, abajo, in León. She has had this business for about 25 years. She started when she was 7, the owner of the business was her mother and Doña Aura helped in the preparation, and when experienced, her mother decided to let her take over the business to keep it in the family and since then she has been in charge. She needs the loan as work capital as she has to buy corn, leaves to wrap up the "nacatamal", and the raw materials for the production.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Las Vecinas Group

texts.en: "Las Vecinas" is a group of 15 people hoping to receive a loan.  For many members of this group it will be the first loan they are taking out.  Many don't have a form of income and are living in extreme poverty.  Martina E. is the representative of this group and is one of the members who has received a loan in the past.  She is the leader of the group because she has been very successful in her small business and someone the others can come to for advice.  Martina has two young children and is dedicated to send them to college.  She is on her 6th loan cycle and excited to keep on increasing the size of her business.  She has a business selling jewelry and specializes in wedding rings and other promise-type jewelry.  She finally feels able to proviD. for her two children, and for the first time in her life, feels like she can get out of her situation.  She dreams of traveling and owning her own thriving jewelry business.  Her main goal is preparing her children to get out of their poverty and giving them all the necessary education.  Everyone is the group is excited for this next step and ready to change his or her life!

loans.use: To buy products to create rings, bracelets, and other types of jewelry.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr: L'écovillage de MbouM. est situé dans la région de Saint Louis à 300 km de Dakar. La  Population de gandiol s'estime à 13968 habitants. Les principales activités économiques dans la zone sont : le commerce, la pêche, le maraichage, l'élevage et l'extraction du sel. Cependant du fait de la péjoration climatique et des phénomènes anthropiques, le niveau de dégradation et de désorganisation est ressenti par sa communauté entière. Les femmes du groupement Mouit ayant bénéficié d'un premier prêt qui leur avait permis de réaliser leurs rêves reviennent auprès de Kiva pour solliciter un renouvellement. Avec le prêt, elles vont acheter des semences, de l'engrais, du fumier, des pulvérisateurs pour faire du maraichage. Les produits récoltés, elles espèrent développer le marché local par la création d'un système d'approvisionnement et de commercialisation de fruits et légumes
texts.en:
The ecovillage of MbouM. is located in the Saint Louis region 300 km from Dakar. The population of Gandiol is about 13,968 inhabitants. The principal economic activities in the area are: commerce, fishing, truck farming, farming and extracting salt. However, due to the climatic decline and anthropogenic phenomena, the level of decline and disruption is felt by the entire community. The women of the Mouit group, having benefited from a first loan which allowed them to realize their dreams, are coming back to Kiva to seek a renewal. With this loan, they are going to buy seed, fertilizer, manure, and sprays in order to do truck farming. With the crops, they hope to grow the local market by creating a system of supply and commercialization of fruits and vegetables.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: truck farming

loans.name: Femmes De Gandiol 2 Group

texts.fr: L'écovillage de Mboumbaye est situé dans la région de Saint-Louis à 300 km de Dakar. La Population de gandiol s'estime à 13968 habitants. Les principales activités économiques dans la zone sont : le commerce, la pêche, le maraichage, l'élevage et l'extraction du sel. Présidé par Monsieur Ndické D. responsable de l'écovillage de Mboumbaye, les femmes du groupement ayant bénéficié d'un premier prêt qui leur avait permis de réaliser leurs rêves reviennent auprès de Kiva pour solliciter un renouvellement. Avec le prêt, elles vont acheter des produits de grande consommation (poissons frais, légumes, fruits, épices et matériaux d'artisanat)trés recherchés par les populations locales qu'elles vont revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires et villages environnants.
texts.en:
The ecovillage of Mboumbaye is located in the Saint Louis region 300 km from Dakar. The population of Gandiol is about 13,968 inhabitants. The principal economic activities in the area are: commerce, fishing, truck farming, farming and extracting salt. However, due to the climatic decline and anthropogenic phenomena, the level of decline and disruption is felt by the entire community. The women of the Mouit group, having benefited from a first loan which allowed them to realize their dreams, are coming back to Kiva to seek a renewal. With this loan, they are going to buy mass consumption products (fresh fish, vegetables, fruits, spices and crafts materials), which are heavily sought after by the local populations.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables, fruits, fresh fish, crafts materials

loans.name: Americo

texts.es: Américo tiene 19 años, es conviviente con su esposa, tiene una hija pequeñita de 2 añitos. Desde niño es agricultor, ahora está sembrando 3 hectáreas de papa; pero ahora que ya tiene su familia ha visto por conveniente tener una pequeña bodega e incrementar sus ganancias con ella, en horas de la mañana se va muy temprano a su chacra y después regresa a desayunar, atiende su negocio, pero los días cuando tiene que trabajar todo el día en su chacra, su esposa se queda en el negocio. A él le agrada estar en contacto constante con la gente, de ese modo se las ingenia para vender sus productos. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero, de manera inmediata, va a comprar productos para su bodega, para que de ese modo pueda incrementar el número de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Américo is 19 years old, lives with his wife and their 2 year-old daughter. He has always been a farmer. At the present he is planting 3 hectares of potato but as he now has a family, he finds it convenient to keep a small grocery store and thus increase his earnings. Very early in the morning he works on his farm, returns for breakfast and then takes care of his business. The days he has to work on the farm all day, his wife looks after the business. He enjoys the constant contact with people and finds ways of selling his products. This is the first time he requests a loan from MFP. With the loan immediately he will buy products for his grocery store in order to increase the number of clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the variety of products in a grocery store.

loans.name: Bokk Kholl 2 Group

texts.fr: L'écovillage de Mboumbaye est situé dans la région de Saint Louis à 300 km de Dakar. La  Population de gandiol s'estime à 13968 habitants. Les principales activités économiques dans la zone sont : le commerce, la pêche, le maraichage, l'élevage et l'extraction du sel. Cependant du fait de la péjoration climatique et des phénomènes anthropiques, le niveau de dégradation et de désorganisation est ressenti par sa communauté entière. Les femmes du groupement ayant bénéficié d'un premier prêt qui leur avait permis de réaliser leurs rêves reviennent auprès de Kiva pour solliciter un renouvellement. Le groupe Bokk kholl 2 compte faire de l'élevage de poulets de chair, de vente de poissons frais, des fruits et légumes et aussi de la vente d'habillement pour femmes.
texts.en:
The ecovillage of Mboumbaye is located in the Saint Louis region 300 km from Dakar. The population of Gandiol is about 13,968 inhabitants. The principal economic activities in the area are: commerce, fishing, truck farming, farming and extracting salt. However, due to the climatic decline and anthropogenic phenomena, the level of decline and disruption is felt by the entire community. The women of the group, having benefited from a first loan which allowed them to realize their dreams, are coming back to Kiva to seek a renewal. The group Bokk Kholl 2 plans to raise chickens, as well as sell fresh fish, fruits and vegetables, and women’s clothing.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fish, fruits and vegetables; to raise poultry; to sell clothes

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es: Patricio tiene 43 años, es casado, tiene 9 hijos, de los cuales ahora esta viviendo con 4 de sus hijos. Desde los 12 años ha trabajado en las chacras de sus vecinos, eran varios hermanos y nos les alcanzaba el dinero, después se casó, en un inicio se dedicó a la labor de chofer, pero no le agradó, entonces volvió a la actividad de la agricultura a la que tiene mayor cariño, además le es muy rentable en esta temporada que el mercado ha cotizado muy bien sus productos, lo difícil es en tiempos donde el mercado no paga un buen precio a la papa o arvejas, además le incomoda la constante alza de precios de los fertilizantes, ahora su dinero ya no le alcanza para lo que antes sí. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero va comprar 7 sacos de fertilizante (Nitrato), cada saco cuesta a 146 soles.
texts.en:
Patricio is 43 years old and has nine children, four of whom live with him. Since he was 12 years old, Patricio has worked in his neighbor's farms, where there were various brothers and they helped him earn money. After he married he became a driver, but he didn't like this work. Instead he returned to agriculture, which he cares for very much. Furthermore, agriculture is very profitable in this season and demand is high. The most difficult times are when the market doesn't pay well for potatoes or peas, and the rising price of fertilizer makes Patricio uncomfortable. Now his money doesn't buy as much as it used to. This is his first loan with MFP. With the money he'll buy seven sacks of fertilizer (nitrate), which cost 146 soles each.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción tiene 64 años, es casado, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales ya no viven con él, ahora está viviendo sólo con su esposa. Desde su juventud se ha dedicado a la agricultura, sembrando hectáreas tras hectárea de papas, pero desde que vio que a su hija le va bien en la  crianza de cuyes decidió incursionar en este rubro. Entonces su hija le regaló algunos, él con mucha emoción construyó jaulas, ahora sus vecinos saben que el criá cuyes y le hacen pedidos. Y cuando su hija viaja él aprovecha en enviarle para que los pueda vender; y del mismo modo le ayuda a su hija en el cultivo de su chacra. Sembrar le es dificultoso, por ello es que ahora siembra solo para su consumo personal, la crianza de cuyes le parece más rentable. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, ha sido puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita va comprar cebada para sembrar, esto sirve para la alimentación diaria de sus roedores, otra parte usará para la compra de fertilizantes para su chacra de papa.
texts.en:
Concepción is a 64-year-old married father of 4 children, who no longer live with him. Only he and his wife live at home. Ever since he was young, he has worked in agriculture, growing hectare upon hectare of potatoes. However, ever since he noticed that his daughter was prosperous in raising guinea pigs, he decided to enter this field. His daughter then gave him some of her guinea pigs, and he enthusiastically built cages for them. Now that his neighbors know that he is raising guinea pigs, they order some from him. When his daughter travels, he takes advantage of it, sending her however many guinea pigs she can sell. He also helps his daughter to cultivate her farm. Growing crops is difficult, which is why he only does it for personal consumption. Raising guinea pigs, on the other hand, is more lucrative. This is his second loan with MFP. He has made his payments punctually. With this loan, he will purchase barley for planting, which serves as food for the rodents. He will also purchase fertilizer for his potato farm with the other part of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and plant barley for guinea pig food

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban tiene 49 años de edad, se ha quedado viudo hace 4 años, de esa relación tuvo 5 hijos, de los cuales está viviendo con el segundo de ellos. Estaban es agricultor, única actividad que ha desarrollado toda su vida, le gusta cultivar alverjas, papas, habas, etc., pero lo que nunca deja de sembrar es papa, y ahora el mercado le ha favorecido en el costo, lo que le ha  permitido recuperar su inversión, en cambio, no ha sembrado mucha alverja, por la falta de dinero. Aparte de esto, tiene ganado, y personas quienes los cuidan, él solamente los revisa esporádicamente. Lo más difícil en su actividad es el elevado costo de los fertilizantes, porque siembra en sus chacras tanto de regadío (sistema de riego) y temporales (según las lluvias), por ello no se abastece con el dinero suficiente para comprar sus fertilizantes. El es un nuevo cliente de MFP. Con el dinero que solicita comprará abono de granjas que por bolsa le cuesta S/.200, invertirá un aproximado de S/.1.000.
texts.en:
Esteban is a 49-year-old man who has been a widower for 4 years. He has 5 children, the second of whom lives with him. Esteban is a farmer, as he has been his whole life. He likes to grow peas, potatoes, broad beans, etc., but what he never stops growing are potatoes. The potato stock is up right now, which has allowed him to recoup his investment. On the other hand, he has not been growing very many peas due to a lack of funds. Aside from that, he also has cattle that other people look after. He only occasionally checks on his cattle. The most difficult aspect about his work is the high cost of fertilizers because he grows crops on both irrigated land and seasonal plots (according to the rain), which is why he does not have enough money to buy fertilizer. He is a new MFP member. With the money being requested, he will purchase fertilizer at 200.00 PEN a bag. He will invest approximately 1,000.00 PEN.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for his crop fields

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es: Evarista tiene 23 años, es conviviente vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, viven en la casa de sus padres. Se levanta a las 4.00am para prepara el desayuno, a las 8.00am ya está listo el almuerzo, de ahí tiene que irse a la chacra a unos 4 kilómetros de su pueblo, es por ello que madruga, desde niña realizó esta actividad, y ya se acostumbró, y le es rentable, dice que para la chacra hay que dedicarse a tiempo completo para que produzca muy bien, de ahí cotiza sus productos en el mercado a un buen precio. La dificultad en la chacra es cuando las diversas enfermedades atacan a las plantas, para evitar ello tiene utilizar preventivos y fumigar cuanto antes para tener una buena cosecha. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero comprará los productos llamados Ditani y Atoc para fumigar cada 8 días, se usa de 2 a 3 cucharadas para cada litro, esta inversión será un aproximado de S/. 850.00.
texts.en:
Evarista is 23 years old, lives with her partner and 2 sons in her parents home. Evarista wakes up at 4am everyday to prepare breakfast, and by 8am lunch is ready. By that time she has to go to the small farm about 4km from her town. That is why she wakes up so early. She has been doing this work since she was young, so she is used to it. The farm work she does is profitable. Evarista says that working on a farm you have to work full time so that the farm produces well. She is then able to sell her products in the market at a good price. The difficulty of the farm is all the different illnesses that affect the plants. To avoid these illnesses she has to take several precautions and fumigate in advance, to ensure a good harvest. This is Evarista's first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money from the loan she will buy the products (named Ditani and Atoc) to fumigate her farm. She has to use these products every 8 days, using 2-3 spoonfuls for every liter. The investment needed for these fumigation materials is 850 soles

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Staff Member

loans.use: Purchase of insecticide for her farm

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es: Fabiana tiene 32 años, es madre soltera con cuatro hijos, vive tan solo con tres de ellos porque la mayor se fue a trabajar a la ciudad de Lima. Cuando era muy niña ella ayudaba a trabajar la chacra a sus padres, pero al crecer y tener 2 hijos notó que no le era suficiente, decidió emprender negocio en la crianza de cuyes de raza, gracias a un programa gubernamental le regalaron 2 cuyes; y ella logró aumentar los ejemplares. Ahora se dedica a comercializar cada cuy a S/.12 en Tarma (sierra) y aumenta en el mercado de la selva. Ella los proporciona a cada puesto y a la siguiente semana los cobra, le agrada criar cuyes, ya que le es muy rentable, con ello puede educar a sus hijos del nivel primario. Este es su cuarto préstamo en MFP, ha pagado puntualmente sus cuotas anteriores. Con el dinero que solicita va comprar alimentos para sus cuyes, la otra parte la derivará a la compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo de papa
texts.en:
Fabiana is a 32-year-old single mother with 4 children. She lives with only three of them because the eldest went to work in Lima. When she was very young, she used to work on her parents’ farm, but as she grew up and had 2 children, she realized it was not enough. She then decided to start a guinea pig business thanks to a government program that gave her 2 guinea pigs. She has managed to increase her herd of guinea pigs. She now sells each one for 12 PEN in Tarma (sierra), and the price increases in the markets of the jungle. She distributes them in each stand, and collects payments the following week. She likes to raise guinea pigs because it is lucrative. With the profits, she can give her children an elementary education. This is her fourth loan with MFP.
